Reviews.Title: “Small, off the beaten but just okay”
Reviews.Author: Julie1266
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 weeks for biz trip. Laundry is done well, on time but expensive. Good to have a microwave but not for the dirty pot. Free wifi needs everyday login. safety box was not big enough for my notebook. Nearby it was hard to find cafe for breakfast but Delifrance. Needs to walk 5-10min to mtr station and it is close but NOT easy. Clubs are around so try to stay higher level. Reception is small and it took some time to check in / out. Sometimes elevator smells smoke. Overall it was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Suite is a good size, but a few unusual 'quirks'!!”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Female
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite, as I was told this was the only room type with a king size bed. The day before we arrived, I read some of the noise complaints on Tripadvisor and emailed the hotel requesting a quiet room. On check-in, we were assigned room 1808. The bedroom is compact and had a queen bed, not the promised king. The living room is spacious, with a generous living area with kitchen sink and microwave. The 'quirk' comes here; although there are masses of kitchen drawers and a lot of bench space, there isn't one stick of crockery (bar tea-cups), or cutlery, not a single pot or a pan. So odd! Why put in a large kitchen area and microwave and not at least provide plates, bowls and basic crockery???! This was annoying as I wanted breakfast in the room and was planning cereal, but couldn't as my only option would have been to eat it out of the small coffee / tea cups, the only crockery provided. Free wi-fi is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “really like it !”
Reviews.Author: Pingkan P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our family vacation. We have early checked in and leave our luggages safely. The location is great, close to some places that we are interested such as Museum of Space, Symphony of Lights, Hongkong China Ferry Terminal, Temple Street, etc. Our room is very clean and good facilities. Nice price n friendly staff. We will stay here again next time in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Robert R
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for 1 night while on business in China. Located in Central Kowloon near Nathan Road and Kowloon Park. Pros - Room was large. I was upgraded to a Suite as a courtesy. For a family or a group this would be nice. There is a Kitchenette with a microwave, refrigerator, sink, counter top for food prep, and a small dining area. This room also had a large outdoor patio with a table and chairs although I could not open the door to go out and take a look. - Free WiFi - Staff spoke English and was both courteous and helpful - 2 blocks from the East Tsim Sha Tsui train station on Mody Road. - Very comfortable bed! I'm picky about that. Cons - A little off the beaten path. It would be a bit of a walk or short taxi ride to the area attractions like the Temple Street Market. You can walk to nearby shopping and dining. - Street is a little noisy at night but not overbearing - The bathroom was nice but the tile could use a good scrubbing and maintenance. The room could have used a fresh coat of paint as well. - TV was a little small if you plan to spend time watching it Overall I would say this is a 3 plus hotel. If it was a little closer to some of the attractions I would say it was a good value. It was fine for me but for someone that is on vacation it might not fit the bill. My room at least could use a little freshening up. The shower head had a leak that shot straight into the ceiling and as stated the tile could use some cleaning. The carpet, although not terrible, is probably due for replacement. I travel to Hong Kong on business every 2 months or so and like to try different places. I didn't have any major issues but probably would not stay here again. I prefer something a little closer to the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover base”
Reviews.Author: CDW46
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stopover point to and from the UK. Hotel is staffed by very friendly people. it is very handy to Nathan Road, short walk to ferries, and the free bus to the central station (to catch a train to the airport) is only a short walk away. Hotel room was quiet, plenty of room and had good facilities. Perfect to have as base to explore Hong Kong. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good quality stay”
Reviews.Author: rudyrafalee
Reviews.Content: stayed here during my last trip. the rooms are clean. bathroom is big but not that functional. free wifi and bottled water. location is quite a walk from nathan road, so if you intent to go back and forth your hotel room you might find it a task. there is noise that you can hear inside the room on weekend nights because there are clubs near the hotel. overall it is still good value!

Reviews.Title: “Love this SuperB hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ANNALYN6168
Reviews.Content: Date: 10 - 13 August 2012 Very clean and nice room! Great value for money! Great location for foods and shopping area! Very comfy bed and internet was not bad! Good and friendly hotel staff! I would definetely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: ksaw8
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 905 of the Butterfly on Pratt Hotel from August 19 to August 22, 2012. The hotel is conveniently located on the Kowloon side, close to food and is a 5 minute walk to the Tsim Tsa Tsui (sp?) subway station. It is also within walking distance to the China Ferry Terminal which took us to Macau. The room was small with two twin beds but VERY clean. My wife, daughter, and I shared the room so I had to get a rollup bed which cost HK$360 extra. The taxi ride to the airport was HK$258. The hotel staff were friendly and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: srapy
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay at hotel butterfly on Prat.I Have been in several hotels in Hong Kong but so far this is the best value for money. A more expensive and luxury one don't have the same kindness of hotel staff like the one I have meet at this hotel.I Had a small issue with the bathroom towels and the manager was wondering abt solving the problem and ready to listen to my complain.This is certainly a plus point in terms of customer satisfaction.Moreover u can experience free wifi all over rooms and lobby,wireless phone in rooms,nice design and style ( very fresh and colorful),two iMacs are in the lobby available for guests to access the Internet free of charge very good location near tst subway and surrounded from restaurants and shops for a very nice shopping experience.My total score for this hotel in a scale from 0-10 is 9.

Reviews.Title: “clean small hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Sherbu
Reviews.Content: The hotel has no lobby and no breakfast. The check in and check out takes ages. BUT the location is excellent and the rooms are very clean and have everything one needs. I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with great service and great location”
Reviews.Author: mingzhen
Reviews.Content: location: the hotel location is really excellent, located 5mins walk from tsim sha tsui mtr! which also means walkable distance to many of the great shopping places/malls. and its near to almost everywhere good for a tourist with the fact that tsim sha tsui mtr is like in the middle of the mtr line, very convenient location indeed. environment: plenty of food around the area hence no worries of getting hungry or if one is rushing for a breakfast/dinner before all the places to go. room: small but with everything and its nice and comfortable. very neat, simple, I like the fact that there's plenty of space to put things and luggage especially if you are there to shop. they provide basic necessity like towels, toothbrush, toothpaste, shampoo and shower gel. service of the staff: really helpful, readily and willingly to help! even going to the extent of providing map, telling us where we are located, ask them if you want recommendations of good food too! plus can get them to book seats and reservations easily for us. they are so willing to help that they actually printed map for me twice to give to taxi drivers! 24hrs check in service and can call them to get them to speak to taxi driver in case taxi driver dont understand you (they offered that service to me). only thing is cab drivers there might not know all the small streets and lanes so well hence cant get you to the exact spot, but you wont be wrong once you reach tsim sha tsui!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneEssex
Reviews.Content: Rooms have everything apart from a large bed, this is okay if you are a single traveller. Wi Fi is free in rooms and lobby and the rooms have everything you need. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Location is not to bad and close to MTR, restaurants all around. Rooms are very clean and well presented.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: aw215
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for its combination of location and relative price (and Tripadvisor review). The location is excellent, right in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui. If you're coming from the airport, take the train to Kowloon, then (free) bus K5 to Park Hotel. Butterfly on Prat is a block away, and close enough to the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station for easy sightseeing or getting to Central. The price, though favorable relative to some other Hong Kong options, is still very high for what you get, which is a nice, but not spectacular, room in a convenient spot. Everything was clean and the service was fine, but there's nothing truly outstanding about the hotel. But given the convenience of the location and the fact that it was a hassle-free stay, I would recommend it for anyone visiting Hong Kong without endless money to spend on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MasterySg
Reviews.Content: I spend 3 nights in this hotel. The location to the nearest MTR is about a good 10 minutes away. The hotel is conveniently located surrounded by convenient stores and restaurants. There is also a thai eatery nearby. Rooms are clean and the showers are see through type. Once I entered the hotel I was immediately welcome by the nice smells. Its really refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small rooms with no sound proof”
Reviews.Author: milkcandies
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at this hotel. Location: walking distance (about 10 mins stroll) to TST MTR. Prat Ave is not a very well-known street for the taxi drivers, so have the address in Chinese with you, it will come in handy. Surrounded by eateries and convenience stores, so it's always convenient for a late night snack or dessert. There are several pubs along and around Prat Ave, so it's quite lively at night. Rooms: Small but considerably comfortable for Hong Kong standards. We had one large and one small luggage and one of them had to be placed on the floor. So we had to jump over it when we walked past that corner. There is a mini fridge, microwave, electric kettle and safe in the room. Water heater in the shower works perfectly, didn't have to wait long. Free cable and wifi connection in the room is fast. I didn't like the bed frame as it has sharp corners. The hotel had covered the corners but it still hurts when I knocked my shin on them. As the hotel is located in a small lane, forget about having a view as the room on the highest floor (18th) looks straight into another building opposite. The biggest problem I had with the room is noise. The doors are not sound proof so I could hear noises coming from the corridor. It didn't help that I had some guests from China staying next door who talks loudly and woke me up every morning. The housekeeper goes around at 10am in the morning knocking on every door shouting "housekeeping!" which adds up the frustration. Service: Staff are friendly and professional, speak considerably good English and are quick during check-in and check-out. There are two computer terminals in the lobby with free internet usage.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Reiner71
Reviews.Content: I spent four days in this Hotel. I enjoyed it, a very boutique room. Though small it was a good experience and within minutes you've been on vibrant Nathan Road. Central in Tsim Sha Tsui, underground station was close and there has been lots of things to do within reach. The staff was very polite and helpful, the rooms have been refurbished not too long ago. The rooms just could have been a bit more spacious. But then the experience was good and the price reasonable. I recommend a stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in Tsim Shai Tsui”
Reviews.Author: R B
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, but clean and efficient. Basic hotel service if that is what you are looking for. We enjoyed our stay here even though rooms are a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Good location! Worth it to spend a little more on the deluxe room.”
Reviews.Author: Antonino20
Reviews.Content: Good location! Worth it to spend a little more on the deluxe room. Although for some weird reason the lift always smelled of cigarettes! Don't know why?!? Non smoking rooms no smell.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Torontoshanghai
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights and thought 'why have i not stayed here before?" I go to HK a few times a year and this will become my preferred hotel. All around great, just 2 things went wrong, 1) the power in my room went off and it seems like it happens a lot and 2) the fire alarm went off on Sunday evening at midnight and and the next morning the front desk told me it went off due to faulty equipment. So faulty electrical in the room and faulty fire alarm is alarming...but i have some faith in the HK inspection bureau.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive and great value”
Reviews.Author: hb133
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the Butterfly on Prat, so much so that I booked one of their other hotels on Hong Kong Island for a night on my return through Hong Kong. Location is good and close to the MTR (although you have to run a gauntlet of suits and fake rolexes on offer) and the hotel itself was great. Rooms are modern and good quality, size is fine for one, but maybe a bit cosy for two. Bedding and towels were of a decent quality and there is wifi in the room (albeit slightly slow and not good enough for skype on the iphone). Staff were fine, but didn't really go out of their way to help or offer advice, and this literally is just a hotel - there's no breakfast room etc. For a comfortable stay at a good price (for Hong Kong) in a decent location, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, friendly staff, comfortable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: MALAAIDY L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in April by myself for business trip. The hotel's lobby was quite small, but quite simple and mordern, thought the room would very tiny, but it came out quite spacious comparing to other HKG hotels in the city. Something surprise me that the room got microwave and a deep bath with seperate shower. That was really good. The location of the hotel is very convenient, easy to get to anyway and shopping. All the staff were really nice and friendly, even the housekeeping staff would say greetings. Love the stay and would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Short trip to Tsim Sha Tsui Area- Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Akureview
Reviews.Content: Close to shops and MTR stations. Nice Staff and free wifi. Confortable bed. We were a group of 6 and we all had a nice stay. Very likely to stay at the Butterfly On Prat on my next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Nii14
Reviews.Content: A nice boutique hotel in Tsim Sha Tsui area. Very close to the shops, restaurants, supermarkets and the mtr station, I picked this hotel for it's location which was excellent. The staff was friendly and helpful, I booked online and got a better deal cause of them. The rooms were standard sized not to big or small either but clean and the bathrooms were nice. A great hotel if you just want the basics and want to be out most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Billtell
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a place that is convenient but don't care too much about the rooms, then this is the ideal place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Demelza62
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and modern with lovely bathrooms. The beds are large and very comfortable and toiletries are provided daily. There is nowhere to eat in the hotel so you have to go out for all food but this was not a drawback. There is a very good Italian restaurant next door if you don't want to walk too far.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: lisamm83
Reviews.Content: Bed Bugs! Its a shame because while we were staying here we loved it. Great location, modern rooms and friendly staff. However, by the 2nd night both myself and my husband were covered in bed bug bites. We did email the hotel notifying them of the problem once home and they have failed to respond. Wouldnt go back.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel - clean design - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: supergirl
Reviews.Content: I arrived early (7:30 am) on a day the hotel was booked and they stored my belongings for me while I explored the city. I'm sure if there was any room available they would have let me have a room early. The room is adorable (a deluxe room) - not big - but just enough for my needs. Very nice, minimal, clean design. There are also computers to use in the lobby area. Downside, the safe was too small to hold my laptop so I had to lock it up in my suitcase. Nearby, as you exit the front door, go right to the corner, that is where the cafe DeliFrance is located. It feels very much like a parisian cafe. There is a soup with noodles, chicken and an egg that is pretty good and it comes with tea or coffee for $26HKD. It's a good place to start to get you bearings and chill out after a long flight. If you go left out from hotel, keep walking straight (don't forget your map because the roads are not in your typical straight line) and eventually you will hit the giant mall called Harbor City mall. You can spend all day in that place... The closest subway is Tsim Sha Tsui. Get an Octopus card at the station by going up to the MTR counter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Mabuti
Reviews.Content: Most everything has already been said about this gem of a hotel. Checked in late and they had given us a free upgrade to a deluxe room. The room was plenty big enough and the bathroom had a bathtub with a separate shower. Water pressure was great and plenty of hot water. Hand held shower was a nice touch. Was on the 11th floor over looking Prat and there was no noise from the street at all. All the amenities you could ask for were provided from soaps, shampoo, toothpaste, toothbrushes, bottled water, coffee and tea. Even had a microwave and nice size refrigerator which many hotels do not provide. WiFi was free and worked good, but not as fast as the local 3G/4G network. Everything was clean and fresh. Carpet was a little worn, but to be expected in any hotel several years old and they provided free slippers if you don't want to walk on the floor barefoot. Staff was very helpful and informative about finding the MTR or anything else for that matter. They never seemed to be too busy to help and all service was provided with a nice smile.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, good location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: Aeh0630
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel last February 2012 with my husband. We stayed there for 5D4N. What I can say is the hotel is very clean and space is average. But this is very usual in HK anyways. The place is so good as there are many good restaurants just outside the hotel and the food is nice too! Usually, we go to the one just in front of the hotel and the price is nice and the servings are too big! There are also lots of shopping centers around as this is in Tsim Sha Tsui. MRT station is around 5mins walk only. Also, we visit Macau for a day and the ferry terminal is just a walking distance away from the hotel. For the staffs, they are very nice and welcoming. Everytime we come in, the reception greets and smiles at us. Service is good and housekeeping cleans good as well. For special requests, I really like pillows so when checking-in, I don't know that they had 4 pillows already and I requested for 2 more during check-in. This is because I thought they will be giving 2 pillows only like the one we visited in HK in 2011. So they give me additional 2 pillows and we had 6! This is with no extra charge. The sleep is comfortable and the sheets, pillows and towels are clean. They provide toiletries, toothbrush and even disposable slippers! After 2 days of stay, they replenish the supplies of toiletries and slippers. Like many hotels, towels can be replaced everyday as long as you put it on the floors. There is also a safe where you can put your important things and a wardrobe. For the security, you can only ride the elevator to your floor when you have the card, which is also used to open your room. The only downside for me is the aircon is either too cold or too warm. But I can just let it go. The toilet's door is a bit uncomfortable, but it's ok as I'm staying with my husband. But for just "friends", it’s a bit annoying. All, in all, I would recommend this hotel and if me and my husband are going back to HK, I will still love to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool!”
Reviews.Author: Noppyb
Reviews.Content: Shower room make us sweet dream. Free wifi is good enough for me to play online game.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and basic accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: pubprisoner
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights. Check in took some time due to crowded tiny lobby. Friendly staff, clean room, close to the action. I stayed at bp international a week earlier. BP is far larger, much more luxurious, and close to the jordan MTR. With the fabulous MTR close to both hotels, getting around is no big deal. I liked the butterfly but would only stay there again if I wanted to be in the busy area again. I hate crowds. And, the DeliFrance bakery spot on the corner someone recommended is a real winner.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel in the Heart of Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: Goldfish_139
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during our visit to Hong Kong last month. The hotel is very chic clean and space is average. But this is normal in Hong Kong. The hotel location is excellent. A21 bus ride from the airport is about 40 minutes. There are many great restaurants just outside the hotel and the food is awesome! There are also many shopping centers and stores around in Tsim Sha Tsui. MRT station is about 5 minutes walk. The hotel staffs are very friendly. Every time we come into the hotel, the reception greets and smiles at us. Service provided by housekeeping is outstanding. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. We will come back to this hotel if we visit Hong Kong again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: suzy i
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels but this is by far the worst one. The people working there was nice but the location of this hotel was terrible. The way its presented on the web is nothing like it when you get there. The maid doesn't make your room properly - its like she wasn't there. The rooms are so tiny and the view from your room is horrible. You come back to your room thinking your bed is made but it looks like it wasn't . Would never stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kellaussie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location near the train. The little Italian restaurant downstairs is so nice. The hotel itself has no restaurant services, but the rooms are a decent size. There are no cups, cutlery etc in the rooms though, no tea bags etc. Staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, funky digs”
Reviews.Author: TravelM0nkeys
Reviews.Content: Good position close to restaurants, airport shuttle and MTR. Staff very helpful and friendly. Bathroom door doesn't quite close but ok as long as you know your travel companion very well!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: WackyBoy
Reviews.Content: Great location, and the restaurants nearby were pretty good! Got some take-out for a couple of nights when we were just too tired from walking. Room was ok, had a nook to store our luggage. Overall the room was cozy, not spacious but not tight either. Price isn't bad, especially if you compare it the hotels along Harbour Centre, but of course you don't get the service and feel that the high-end hotels have.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelchicme
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite chic! Absolutely adore the atmosphere of the place and such a great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shortymaria
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I am in Hong Kong, and I found BoP online and read the reviews. We wanted something nice, yet not too pricey, located close to metro and Tsim Sha Tsui. As a Chinese, my preferred part to stay in is in Kowloon, as I think that the Island is just too full of expats and doesn't seem as local as it does on the mainland part of HK. We loved the hotel, we had room 1708 which was perfect, just the smallest room they have, but it was still big enough for the two of us for our 8 night stay. The room was clean, good amenities, nice with a fridge and microwave to keep all of our drinks and left over foods from various restaurants, free wifi worked perfect, air con was great, the staff was nice, even though we keep to ourselves and stay discreet and do not interact too much with them. Our room was facing the backside of the hotel, so there was no noise to be heard, and our view was just buildings opposite our hotel. We heard clients at reception asking for rooms with views, but they clearly do not know HK and the area of Tsim Sha Shui by Nathan and Chatham if they want room with a view, not much to see in that area from high above. The hotels that will have views are located right by the water and are in a much higher price range than Butterfly. Again, we used the room to sleep in and that was it. The hotel is perfectly located at Tsim Sha Tsui, 3 min walk to the metro, exit A2 on Humphreys, lots of shops, eateries, grocery stores, bars, massage parlors on the short walk between metro and hotel. We even managed to eat at one of them next to the hotel at 2.30am in the morning! Many buses as well on Chatham and Nathan Road, so easy to get around, easy to walk over to the Star Pier to catch the cheap Star Ferry over to the Island, and short walk to Avenue of the Stars as well. We are normally budget travelers, so have to say this has been one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. When we go back to HK, we will be staying at BoP again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sharon L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good and the room is good enough for couples. The location of the hotel is excellent. The area is full of food, dessert and shopping. It's very convenient to walk to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR..

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: TEFLnick
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the UK after two nights with my GF at the Butterfly on Prat. Absolutely no concerns at all and would happily recommend the place. Im always a bit worried that things dont always compare in reality to the internet images and reviews. This place didnt disappoint. Location is good. Very close to at least one Metro, the Harbour shopping centre and the harbour area etc. Hong Kong seemed quite a lot smaller than I expected, possibly due to the convenient location of the hotel. Room was lovely. Very comfortable bed, smart shower room and more than enough room for two people on a short trip. Complete with room safe, Wall mounted TV with some English channels, fridge, hairdryer, Tea making facilities, good quality thick towels etc. Really cant complain. Check in staff are friendly and speak English, Cantonese and Putonghua. I arrived early and they secured my luggage for me prior to checking in. They also offer a bus shuttle service to the aiport which I took advantage of. Hourly service at around 140HK$. Might not be as cheap as a regular bus, but was convenient. I stayed on the 6th floor, no noise really, and had two good nights sleep before leaving. This was my first actual stay in HK. Have been in and out of the airport 10 times, but never been to visit HK per se. Highly recommend both the city and this hotel as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly & clean”
Reviews.Author: j8gray
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel partly for its location and partly for its boutique style. Having not traveled to Hong Kong before we took a bit of a gamble with location but it really paid off - a couple of minutes walk to Tsim Sha Tsui station, a few minutes to the waterfront and a few minutes ride on the MTR to Hong Kong Island or up to Mongkok. The room was a decent size, which for Hong Kong seems to be a bit of a luxury. There was no bar or restaurant facilities but in Kowloon with the abundance of bars/restaurants/cafes on your doorstop this really wasn't an issue. We would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MJR1018
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its convenient location, reasonable rate, and positive reviews on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed! We stayed five nights. The hotel is located in Kowloon, just a few blocks from the Tsim Sha Tsui metro station, the waterfront and the Avenue of the Stars, Kowloon Park, and plenty of shopping. It's in the middle of a vibrant neighborhood with lots of authentic noodle shops, delicious street stand food, restaurants/bars, and modern convenience stores. The hotel is modern and bright and although the rooms are small, they are very comfortable with flat screen TVs and a good selection of English channels, a fridge, microwave, safe, free Wi-Fi, and a hair dryer. It had all the amenities you need. The bed was comfortable and I was most happy that the room was very quiet despite the street noise below. We had a room on the 12th Floor and I recommend a high floor to ensure that you are high enough to avoid noise. The staff was helpful and polite and provided a good city map upon arrival. I couldn't get the Wi-Fi working on my phone initially but the hotel staff quickly helped resolve the issue. Although the hotel does not have breakfast, there is a great option half a block down the road called, DeliFrance. They had good bread, croissants, muffins, as well as, eggs and ham. Their set breakfast meals are an excellent deal, being about US$3-5 each, including coffee. Overall, we had a great experience. I highly recommend Butterfly on Prat!

Reviews.Title: “Sutissfaction”
Reviews.Author: Fytianos K
Reviews.Content: I was absoloutely hapy to stay in your hotel. I will recomment also to other frients and colleques

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CCRR
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on previous reviews on TripAdvisor. We took the tip about upgrading to a deluxe room and were very pleased. As previously noted, the location is great, close to restaurants, convenience stores, the MTR, shopping. The front desk staff were always pleasant and professional. Liked having the fridge and little freezer to store snacks. Also liked the tea kettle, free tea, coffee and two bottles of water provided each day. The free wi-fi worked well. We had a view of the street but it wasn't noisy (on the 10th floor). The bed was comfortable. There were only a couple of minor drawbacks, one being the bathroom, although spacious, didn't offer the privacy that we prefer. Also, there was no electrical outlet in the bathroom so I had to blow dry my hair outside of the bathroom, and the cord didn't reach over to where the mirror was. One more negative, and this is a big one for us, there was a reading light on one side of the bed but not on the other. Luckily, my husband was able to read using his ipad on his side of the bed, otherwise whoever got that side of the bed wouldn't have a light. Bottom line, would we stay here again? Yes. The pros definitely outweighed the cons.

Reviews.Title: “The great services”
Reviews.Author: Kellyfong
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the hotel services . The. Staff are so friendly, they always have great smile, always ready to answer your questions and open the heavy door

Reviews.Title: “It Just Gets Better on Each Visit”
Reviews.Author: wfeo
Reviews.Content: I was back to Butterfly on Prat for the third time, and this time with a group of 6, with young and elders. And we are all pleasantly surprised with our stay here. Hotel continues to upkeep the good standard it has, over these few years. The staff continue to extend their best service, making our visit warm and pleasant. I think Prat Ave is getting more and more interesting. Good desert store has opened directly opposite the hotel. And really everything is near the hotel. We also discovered more good eating places near it. And apparently just a street from the hotel, there are also direct buses going to Stanley. The hotel has started their own loyalty program, which allow return travellers to book with direct discount. I will do that if I return there again! If you are confused on where to stay, for the first visit to HKG. This is really the right hotel to stay in. With everything around it, and yet not as crowded on the streets like Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Disaster, Decent Recovery”
Reviews.Author: TravellingUncleWally
Reviews.Content: We reserved a suite for several nights, staying first on the 5th floor. The good: clean, nice large bathroom, comfortable space for three adults. The bad: room smelled musty, carpets and curtains showing wear, no dishes or utensils in food service area, terrible noise all night until 5:30AM from the club next door. After complaining about noise, we were moved to a suite on the 18th floor, where the room smelled better, no noise problems, and furnishings were in better condition; however the suite rooms and bathroom were smaller, and no outside deck. The room change was an improvement. The staff apologized for the noise problem and moved us without hesitation, however we feel it is unacceptable to expect any guest to tolerate that. We suspect it's been a problem for a while, the staff knows about it. In general the staff was helpful, attentive, and efficient. The hotel is a good value for someone who doesn’t need a view, an elegant entry, and the big hotel lobby scene with all the trappings and services. It’s convenient for walking to local Kowloon attractions, buses, and the MTR; good restaurants are close by. It's on a busy, narrow side street; while that may be unappealing to some people, we felt comfortable and safe walking there. Just be careful about the room condition and location within the building.

Reviews.Title: “Brlliant location, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: StarDame
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days/9 nights, which is a long time in terms of holidays to Hong Kong. Did check Trip Advisor before booking and found hotel and staff lived up to the good press! The location is unbelievably perfect for getting around to all the sights. The MTR station is a about 3 minute walk. Nathan Road 3 mins. The Star Ferry about 10-15 mins walk. The hotel was clean and staff really pleasant and helpful (also printing our boarding passes for us when we did online check-in for our flight home!). Handy tip - there is a bus at the end of the street (turn right out the hotel then cross main road, Chatham Rd). I think was 493 (or 497, you'll see on bus stop schedule), it takes you all the way to Stanley, Aberdeen, Repulse Bay. It was a great find. I'll return to this hotel if back in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: jl j
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel with a pretty good location. Room very nice and clean with a nice bathroom. There is no breakfast, but like said an other person of tripadvisor, there is at 30 yards, at the corner of the street an french style coffee where you can find a good breakfast for an afordable price, and with good coffee. Sight from the room (11th floor) was correct on all the HK buildings, but in this kind of price, you cannot ask harbour view in Hong Kong. The really good thing is that the hotel is located in a place at walking distance of a lot of things, you have a lot of good restaurants close, malls, a very nice parc and subway is very close too. And the good thing wich isnt everywhere is that the reception team is very kind, i specially remember of Zelos and jennifer(maybe i make a mistake on this lady firstname) wich were so kind, available and helpfull persons, but anyway all the team is really smiling and take care of you. So for my next stay in HK, i will certainly go back in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great and good located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pranesh A
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay very much. The rooms are beautiful, the staff friendly and the location just perfect. We would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: swissa01
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our quick getaway in HK and I must share our great experience with this hotel. It was very accessible from the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station (exit D2). The standard room was just right for two people. Very attractive room design, clean and complete with the basic amenities. The mini-fridge was quite big compared to other hotels, had a microwave, hairblower, flat TV, safe, ipod/iphone dock and free wi-fi (which gave this hotel the edge). The only thing I would have wanted changed was the dresser mirror which was'nt too convenient (at room 1109) since it was installed mainly for aesthtic purposes than its use. Overall, I would definitely go back and also recommend this to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRavelBug232323
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with my family of 5, so got 2 adjacent rooms. We were happy and have no major complains. Its modern and is avant-garde in design. For a boutique hotel, they have everything covered. They had your must haves of a coffee kettle with free coffee and tea, mini fridge, in room safe, strong water shower, blow dryer, LCD TV, enough cabinetry, and free Wifi in room. A plus were the DVD player, iPod dock, and microwave- good for heating left overs. You also can use for free 2 IMac Apple computers at the lobby. By the way, as in all boutique hotels, there is a very small lobby. Room was quiet despite being at the center of the city. TRAIN station was a short walk away. Hotel is centrally located and close to everything- stores, restaurants. Nice new bathroom. The hotel won the Trip Advisor's Award back in 2010 Recommendations to hotel: Vacuum carpet longer, a lock at the sliding door to the restroom. YES WOULD RECOMMEND IT

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: CleptaK
Reviews.Content: As with other reviewers, we were attracted to this hotel based on the good reviews. We checked into room 1201 for five nights for our honeymoon (we travel on a budget!). I was disappointed by the staff, not particularly friendly, particularly at check-in. The cleanliness of the room left a lot to be desired; coffee was spilt on the wall and the desk area and appeared to be there for sometime. There was hair from previous guests in the wardrobe area and bathroom. Shower was also mouldy. This was mentioned to staff and partially rectified. The location was ok, but we could stay in a harbourside hotel for the same price. Lifts were extremely slow, not good if you're busting for the loo! Also, a small quibble, but my husband mentioned in our booking notes that it was our honeymoon, and this was not noted by the staff. Disappointing and will not stay again!

Reviews.Title: “nice vibe!”
Reviews.Author: harbrsl
Reviews.Content: i wanted to try a new hotel while in HK so i booked this place based on reviews and photos. i wasn't disappointed. pros: the ipod dock in the bedroom comfy bed! great location quiet room cool decor cons: no instructions on how to use the nespresso machine tiny bathroom compared to the size of the rest of the room odd mirror placement (hard to view an outfit outside of the bathroom) low powered hair dryer slow elevators

Reviews.Title: “good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: faith n
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to sleep that is affordable and easily accessible to shops and restaurants, butterfly hotel is for you. Frills are at a minimum. Don't be discouraged by the side street where it is located. Butterfly is simple, clean and maintained well. very small lobby which has computers for your use. smells great too! if you're travelling with friends they give you a bath enclosed but for couples, surprise! you get a glass enclosed see through bath. make sure you specify which you prefer. Hotel staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel room best for couple”
Reviews.Author: Plee25
Reviews.Content: The hotel deco is very modern and the rooms are in decent sizes despite the fact that we are in hong kong... The location is quite good and you can get food easily ard there... One thing to consider is tat our bathroom has no real door, u can see everything from the room. Suits couples only... :) Probably they have other type of rooms. We were at lvl 10 but facing the main road. Quite noisy at night due to the night clubs below.

Reviews.Title: “not sure if i'll be back”
Reviews.Author: zefashionista
Reviews.Content: i went ahead and book this hotel based on the glowing reviews here on tripadvisor and the comparatively affordable rate that the hotel offers - which is about SGD50 cheaper than the other hotels i was considering. my travel dates were 4 to 7 May 2012. the great thing about this hotel is its location, location, location. like some reviewers previously mentioned, the area is well populated even at night so you'd feel rather safe walking the streets at any time. the next best thing about this hotel is the service. they are efficient and approachable. i checked in first because i was already in HK for a work trip so my husband was flying up to join me for the weekend. his flight landed safely but he was delayed from disembarking because of the amber light warning due to thunderstorms. it was about 3am when he reached the hotel front desk and apparently the front desk personnel had already changed shift so the current one didn't know about the situation and my request for my husband to receive the room key in exchange for my name. they then accompanied my husband up to the room (i was already in dreamland) and waited for me to wake up and confirm that i was waiting for someone and i knew him before they left. i thought that was very good security indeed. now, the not so good things: i was supposed to be on a non-smoking floor (level 9) but there was this guest who kept smoking and leaving his door open as he did so so as not to set off the smoke detector. i complained to the front desk about it twice and they said they will follow it up but i still smelt cigarette smoke at night or when i came out of my room in the morning the smell was still there lingering in the corridor. the hotel staff sprayed the area but it didn't solve the problem. another issue was the room keys and the lift. i couldn't get the lift to read my room key on some occasions, which got pretty annoying. my husband's room key couldn't work at times when he was trying to get into the room and despite changing it, it didn't really help. am not sure why this happened. the last night we were there, the room was not cleaned up much. the dustbin wasn't cleared even though it was full and the towels weren't changed (though the previous two nights it was). however we knew that the housekeeping staff had been in the room because the bathroom mat was changed. we just thought it was strange that he/she only did that and nothing else? the room was small-ish but still comfortable enough for two. it's definitely more up-market than budget accommodation but affordable as well. there is no sort of view from my floor (level nine). we couldn't figure out the blinds or maybe it just doesn't work, i dont know, but i would have had liked some natural light in the room but it was completely blocked out by the blind. all in all, i think it's a good place to stay if you can overlook some things, but i'm not sure if i will be back again so soon. if there's another place with equally competitive rates, i might just go over and try that.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good value”
Reviews.Author: hoteldiary
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay central, but are on a budget this hotel is a good choice. Tube, restaurants and shops are close. It's a easy walk to the harbour for the lightshow and nice rooftop bars. For the rate, I have to say the hotel is a really good value. - staff is very helpful and friendly - complimentary water and free wifi which was working very well - nice! - even the shampoo was good quality - standard rooms are small, as usual in such big asian cities, but have a good cut - nice bathrooms! The rooms are like on the published foots, which I appreciate much (had already other experiences) - cleaning and maintenance are ok, but could have been slightly better (bathroom ok, but there was dust and some hairs on the furniture) - the beds are nice with nice pillows and blankets - aircon was working well and not that loud (be aware that you are not in a luxes hotel area, the buildings have their aireation outside of the building, which you can hear a little. But such noise is normal in that kind of cities.)

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller z
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Hong Kong are not cheap at all! but on this hotel you get a good deal for your money! Great location! and the rooms are really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Dunedain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Butterfly on Prat for 4 nights. Checking in was painless and the staff were very helpful. We had two rooms on the 9th floor, one with a queen bed and the other was a twin. The twin room was larger than the double and were spacious for Hong Kong standards. I guess we were high enough not to hear noise from the street. There is no scenic view on this floor! The The chic colour scheme in the rooms was refreshing and one could not fault the cleanliness of the place. Free wifi is a major plus as is access to public transport. The efficient metro at Tsim Sha Tsui is a few minutes walk away. Being in the heart of Kowloon, we found it buzzing with activity all the time and we went with the flow and found it safe to walk in the area at night. If shopping is your thing then Nathan Road is a stone's throw. There was never difficulty in finding eating places as eating is a favourite pastime. We took the queue from the locals and frequented places where they ate. As we spent most of our day out and about, we found the hotel to be a good place to rest away from the hustle and bustle of the crowds. We choose the Prat as we wanted to be in Kowloon otherwise we would have stayed at the Morrison or the Wellington which might well be the case the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, tidy and handily placed”
Reviews.Author: LoftusroadW12
Reviews.Content: The place is ideal, bang in the heart of Kowloon and close to all that you may need in that part of HK. The staff were faultless and really helpful. We had a couple of queries and they dealt with them efficiently and spoek excellent English. The rooms, were neat, tidy and maybe if one were to raise an issue, just a bit on the small side, but this would be more a case to advise potential guests who maybe need more room. However, based on our experience, we would have no qualms in recommending this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy and neat, nothing special about the rooms though”
Reviews.Author: raysar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in April, booked via the hotel website. Small but acceptable considering it is Hong Kong. Free wifi was very good and fast. Was able to Skype no problems. When we checked in and got to our room there was maintenance people in there fixing the curtains but they disappeared very quickly. There was a dirty mark on the outside of the toilet bowl which remained there the entire stay... not sure how thoroughly they clean the bathrooms. Reception staff were quite friendly and helpful though. Personally I wouldn't stay at a hotel on Kowloon side again, I don't really like the atmosphere there.

Reviews.Title: “best choice !”
Reviews.Author: jiamin88
Reviews.Content: love this hotel! i got a Queen bed room shared with 2 of my gfs. the toilet is clean & surprisingly big. Reception staff are very friendly. Hotel are located just 5mins walk from Tsim Sha Tsui Mtr station. shop houses/MacDonald are just beside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly what you read odr see on the web site”
Reviews.Author: bldeagle99
Reviews.Content: Sadly after booking this hotel for a 18 night stay i checked out after two nights. The hotel location is fine for backpackers but not a good location for business. The area is very seedy and frequented by some unsightly people and professions. Even though the Hotel is supposed to be a non smoking area it is not and after two nights of finding hotel rooms dors open and people openly smoking in the rooms and corridors i left. Even though i had called the front desk staff about what was happening in ther rooms and corridors it still continued. The room quality was ok but overall this hotel is a low 3 star and not at all for a long stay or a business friendly location. GREAT SHAME but cannot receommend to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, good hotel for work or holiday.”
Reviews.Author: Philippad
Reviews.Content: room small but normal for HK hotels.. was very clean, decent linen, tv fine etc. bathroom was new, and great shower. bathroom/room relationship a bit close/intimate! sliding door that doesnt really close 100% so i guess fine for couples, but only think i would change about the room. really nice to have free wifi in room. staff very pleasant- offered info when needed, and always smiling and nice. location very very good. quick walk to MTR. close to buses to airport (A21) and other areas- so save money on not needing airport express/shuttles. area had lots of restaurants accessible and was fun and vibey. definitely would stay there again. seemed expensive but all hotels in HK that are semi decent and decent, are expensive, so just deal with that and look online for best prices.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and central to everything”
Reviews.Author: Leon S
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Butterfly. This time we chose a larger room, and it was well worth it! We found the position central not only to our needs, but also the MTR which takes you everywhere you need to go in Hong Kong, but within walking distance of shops, markets, walks and attractions. The staff at the hotel bend over backwards to give service - which is really appreciated. Loved the room, large shower facility, wifi, and did I mention the service? Thank you Butterfly. See you on our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Great little hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised with this hip little hotel in Tsim Sha Sui. Stayed for 2 nights and found the staff to be very helpful on arrival and eager to please throughout our stay. Stayed in a deluxe non smoking room with a little extra space, free wi fi and the room size was fine for Hong Kong. The location is great, walking distance to restaurants, pubs and of course shopping and the MTR is close by. What particularly impressed is the overall good condition of the hotel and especially the cleanliness of the rooms and I'd happily recommend the Butterfly to anyone wanting boutique style accomodation in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a good service”
Reviews.Author: Pailin S
Reviews.Content: We been hong kong for the first time and the staff helps us a lot for attractions and restaurants. The service is nice as well as the room decoration. Also, free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and big room”
Reviews.Author: Goodtrip2012
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay with Butterfly on Prat and what impressed me was the good and friendly service provided by the staff. They made my stay very pleasant and comfortable which is what good hotels should be doing. The location was excellent as it was about 5 minutes from Tsim Sha Tsui station. However as it is along a busy street, it can be quite noisy. I booked a superior room but was given an upgrade as the hotel was crowded. The room was big and comfortable, there was ample space to move around. With free wifi, I was able to face time with my family anytime I want. Plus the wifi connection was good and had no disruption. If only the hotel had a 'no smoking' policy, the cigarette smell do linger in the lift and along corridor areas. A sign to remind customers to tone down is required at the lift area, it can be quite noisy which was what I experienced as my room was directly facing the lift. Overall, this is a good hotel which I would come back to as well as recommend to friends going to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique and chic!”
Reviews.Author: jenn4592
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at this hotel. The hotel was a little hard to find bc there are so many small streets. Having found the hotel, I was fairly impressed with the chicness of this hotel. Located right in Tsim Tsa Tsui, it is a great location to be in such a busy area. The room was nice and chic. If I had known, I would have stayed longer however I was booked in another hotel and only needed the one day stay. There are many restaurants and shops within the area. The check in process was quick and painless. Overall a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Modern!”
Reviews.Author: ard0912
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for its proximity to some restaurants that we wanted to check out. We were in for a pleasant surprise! Butterfly on Prat was located right in the middle of everything - restos, cafes, dessert shops and bars. It's also a mere 5-8 minute walk to the MTR station and Nathan Road. The room was beautiful, clean, and came with a microwave, a well-stocked mini-bar, fluffy pillows and everything else that you would usually find in a much more upscale hotel. The hotel also has a friendly English-speaking staff and excellent Wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: purplepinay
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husband and myself via the internet and had no problems at all with booking. Check-in was not perfect but was not difficult. There was a little communication issue but this was solved quickly after a little checking. The room we had was quaint and (truthfully) stylish. It was brown and white with orange ceiling accents. Stylish! The bathroom was comfortable and spacious. There was no tub but the shower enclosure was big. The bed was very comfy. The TV was big. Wi-fi signal was strong and free. My only issue was that the thermostat of the air-conditioning was not perfectly tuned so I had to snuggle underneath the (thankfully) warm quilt. The bedroom slippers were also quite charming. There were 2 pairs in the room--one in violet and another in lime green. This is a nice departure from the usual white bedroom slippers that are found in other hotels. The hotel is less than 5 minutes walk from the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station so it was very convenient. It is near enough to everything. It does not have any coffee shop but it does have smoking rooms (we stayed in one of those, by request), free use of computers in the hotel lobby, efficient cleaning and maintenance service and fast elevators. The lobby is as cute as it appears on the websites and travel sites. Kudos to the interior designer. The ambience of the hotel contributed greatly to the whole experience. Would I check in again? Yup, yup, yup!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to it's motto”
Reviews.Author: Changsha_Panda
Reviews.Content: Reflecting on my recent stay (March/April 2012) at Butterfly on Pratt, I can’t help but think the hotel lives up to its philosophy of ‘living central’. There are several existing “Butterfly” hotels and more in the books but I stayed at the one on Pratt. This is not a typical ‘stuffy’ hotel as the rooms are decorated in bright, spirited colours; the lobby is a small cozy place proving a feeling of intimacy. Once mustn’t forget, being in HK real estate is prime! The rooms are well appointed and had everything I needed. Two pouches of instant coffee were provided along with two bottled of water; as a morning coffee drinker, this fell short of my requirement; however the staff had no problem in providing me with all the coffee and bottled water I wanted. Overall, the hotel is clean and comfortable with staff who are friendly and helpful. The location is great as it is within easy walking distance of the MTR and Nathan Road; two locations to access the rest of HK. Shopping is around every corner as is dining; from traditional to the posh. Not a typical hotel, Butterfly on Pratt is breaking the mould by providing its guests with upbeat styled rooms with great locations suited to the traveler’s needs.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay, not as good as the 1st one though...”
Reviews.Author: fijitime71
Reviews.Content: My 2nd stay, after 2 years, not as good as the 1st one though. I had probably booked a junior suite during my 1st stay, however I remember the room being much better and at a very attractive price. Even though in this occasion I've been told having been upgraded to a deluxe room, I didn't really found it deluxe at all, yet clean and confortable. Just a bit noisy maybe (on Prat Av., if you have the choice go for one on the back side) very well located in the hearth of TST (less than 5 mins walk from A2 MRT exit), you can enjoy free wi-fi in the room and a free shuttle service from/to Kowloon station 1 block away (just opposite Kowloon hotel). Friendly and useful staff for this nice small boutique hotel, overall a pretty good choice in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Michelle C
Reviews.Content: Last day at Butterfly! Stayed three nights, was offered an upgrade when checking in but decided to stick with the superior room we had booked as would rather spend the extra cash shopping:-) Yes, the room is very small, probably the smallest I have ever stayed but it is clean, has everything you require, marvelous shower, great beds and very quiet room! Also great, great location with everything you require a stone throw from the hotel. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stopover in Hong Kong on way to Australia.”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Butterfly on Prat. The hotel staff were very helpful, the rooms were very clean. The hotel is in a great location for a short stay in Hong Kong/Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jamestravelsmith
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here travelling through Hing Kong and found the staff very very helpful, they let us check in early and provided information and assistance when ever we asked. the location is great with resturants and bars all around and while the room is small, its not as small as the average in this city and is very clean with funky designs. definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “new and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilly C
Reviews.Content: the room is new and no any smoking smell in modern style. it's close to the town so easy to go anywhere. free wi-fi and a great service of reception.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: NoraCManila
Reviews.Content: The best thing about staying here was the excellent ,friendly and knowledgeable staff. If they did not know the answer to your question, they would research and get you a print out. No one seemed too preoccupied not to give you their attention. The location was very convenient, walking distance to most everywhere we wanted to go, and close enough to public transport. Lucky Dessert was just across the street! The room we requested for 3 (extra bed) was too small (de luxe), and the toiletries they provided were for 2 only, even on request. Other than this, it was a pleasant experience. THis is an excellent hotel for persons wanting to be close to main shopping areas and good eating places of different price ranges. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Venezuela11
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this cool boutique hotel located nicely in Kowloon. We paid 1100 HK dollars and were upgraded to one of the larger rooms which was very spacious by Hong Kong standards. The room was clean, modern and stylishly decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable and we had a peaceful night's sleep. There was free wifi in the room and two computers in the lobby for guests to use. The front desk was efficient, friendly and knowledgeable. It has a great location and is a ten minute walk to the Avenue of Stars where you can take in Hong Kong's amazing skyline. Also, there are lots of restaurants and shops in the vicinity. Overall, Butterfly on Prat is a great hotel and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value + location”
Reviews.Author: Ishi M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for those who wants to be in Tsim Sha Tsui. Walking distance to MTR and major retail locations around Nathan, Kimberly and Chatham Rd. Clean room and spacious bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joshep T
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel in a good location. The room is new and we got a good rest here. Many pubs and restaurants near the hotel. I will stay here again for sure. Also, free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Vanesssa B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room. Our room is nice and modern. Also they have free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: salthound
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Butterfly on Prat for all my recent visits to Hong Kong and I have found it a comfortable and affordable hotel. The rooms are fairly compact but the bathroom is good and the rooms are very comfortable. The location is also very convenient, close to Tsim Sha Tsoi MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: oracle123
Reviews.Content: My experience in this hotel was very positive. Location to shops, restaurants, MTR, museums and waterfront was excellent. Rooms were comfortable and it was pillow heaven (4 big, soft pillows)! Reception staff were friendly and ready to help with any questions. The street noise did wake me up a few times even though I was on 18th floor but I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to HK and ask for a room at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for food, pubs, MRT and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: rock_angel81
Reviews.Content: I love love love this boutique hotel. It is so convenient to get anything you want. Just opposite the hotel, there is a dessert place called Lucky Dessert which you must try. Just few steps from the hotel, you get street food, pubs, convenient stores. K11 mall that has famous labels is also just 5 minutes away. MTR is also just 5 minutes away. And you can also walk to Canton Road that has even higher end brands like Chanel, LV, Dior, Hermes. You'll never get hungry or bored at this location. :) Hotel itself is not that big. But it's good enough as we're hardly in the hotel anyway. Rooms look new, clean with trendy designs. Thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring HK”
Reviews.Author: HelenAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Butterfly On Prat not so much because I needed to shop a lot or see a lot of sights; I just had to be within walking distance of the HK marathon start. But this hotel is good for anyone visiting HK for a few days, who want to be close to everything (TST's Nathan Road and MTR station are just a block away), and don't want to or can't afford the larger luxury hotels though still want to be comfortable and want a good bed - I know that a lot of smaller HK hotels have the harder Chinese style mattresses that ensure you won't have a good night's sleep. + room was clean, not too big but certainly enough space for me and my 2 large bags of luggage. My partner had fit as well if he'd joined. + bathroom also clean, good shower + free wifi of good quality + microwave in every room - didn't use it, but loved this option! There are 2 convenience stores in the street too, so fancy hot noodles anytime in the room? No problem! + reception staff was always friendly - the hotel does not serve breakfast. To me not a problem, the street of the hotel alone had several options and TST is full of eateries everywhere. But to those who want to slip downstairs for a quick brekkie before dressing for the day, not going to happen here! - I asked for a wake up call on marathon morning...and didn't get called until 30 mins AFTER I requested it. Luckily I had 3 other alarm clocks for this particular occasion, but was still not amused. The gentleman did not really sound like he cared too much... - the room was pretty quiet though it must be said that the walls aren't the thickest of all hotels I've ever stayed in HK. I could hear neighbours on occasion. I must add that I am a light sleeper, so if you're of the kind that falls asleep within minutes, you won't find this bothering.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, convenient, convenient”
Reviews.Author: karinf74
Reviews.Content: After a couple of weeks in China, I was incredibly excited about the style and amenities of the Butterfly on Prat. The room -- and bathroom -- are surpisingly spacious, and the free wifi is a definite perk. On the down side, the fitness center is a bit of a joke, a couple of ancient machines in a small room. The Tsim Sha Shui location also had some pros and cons. I was working, so it could be a bit irritating to have to wend through the tourist throngs and a number of the nearby restaurants catered to that crowd. On the other hand, I could not have asked for a more convenient location. I was traveling throughout Hong Kong for work, and being just a couple of minutes from the MTR was an incredible boon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and great pricing”
Reviews.Author: Tony N
Reviews.Content: Great location in Tsim Sha Shui. I traveled solo and the room was very comfortable. I made a reservation for for a superior room (standard room), and I needed an early check in. Upon my arrival, no superior rooms were available; however, I was offered an upgrade to a deluxe room at a minimal upgrade rate so I accepted. The front desk staff is very friendly and accommodating. The deluxe rooms are on higher floors (which is a plus as it gets you further from the traffic noise). Since almost every building in Hong Kong is tall, the view out of the room was not spectacular (main reason for not rating excellent). I felt the rooms to be nice and the bathroom with rainfall shower head was AWESOME! The bathroom amenities were stocked very well. The room had a mini-fridge, safe, electric kettle and small LCD TV. I needed a plug adapter and the front desk sent one up. Free Wi-Fi included. If you need to print boarding passes, etc. they are a couple computers by the front desk you can use. This is a boutique hotel with no bar, restaurant or room service. No worries, there are many options within a VERY short walk from the hotel. The airport express shuttle bus is just a block away and the metro station is very close. The airport express train was HK$160 round trip. Taxi fare from airport was quoted to be around HK$200-250 each way. I loved the location so much I will return to the hotel on my next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful butterfly”
Reviews.Author: SaraInWonderland_13
Reviews.Content: Veri nice boutique hotel in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui. Highly reccomended for couple, groups of friends or solo travellers looking for something nice with great price and nice location. They do not have a restaurant, but you can find nice places close to the hotel ( I really enjoyed the Agnés B. Café, 5 minutes walk from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Happy in butterfly”
Reviews.Author: Tourist298573
Reviews.Content: Found a new home in hong kong. Good location,efficient and friendly staff,nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: ““A stylish hotel with very pleasant reception staff””
Reviews.Author: Witleyflopsybunny
Reviews.Content: We had a short stop-over from Australia to England for our first visit to Hong Kong. The taxi driver had no trouble in taking us to the hotel; the fare was HK$250 from the airport. We arrived early in the morning so we couldn't get in to our room until 12 p.m. (although normal check-in time is 2 p.m.) We looked at a restaurant nearby for breakfast but they only accepted cash, and we preferred to pay by card as we were only in Hong Kong for a relatively short time. We walked on further and came across Hullett House, 1881 Heritage in Canton Road. We wanted to sit down somewhere peaceful and have a luxurious breakfast and this fitted the bill perfectly. The continental breakfast was surprisingly inexpensive and substantial. Everything was home made by the 4 French chefs, one with a Michelin star. Our room in the hotel was a deluxe room was on the 12th floor facing the back of the hotel. The bathroom was very chic and the shower cubicle was enormous. The toiletry bottles with the hotel's name were larger than usual and the colourful complimentary slippers were a lovely extra. We had another night flight the next evening so we decided to visit Ocean Park on HongKong Island, principally to see the pandas. We took the underground one stop to Admiralty station on Hong Kong Island. Outside the station is a ticket booth where one can pay by card for both the 629 bus fare to get to Ocean Park and for the park entrance ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Butterfly”
Reviews.Author: Fanny M
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Convenience location with less than 5 mins walk to metro train, bus stop, and ferry. Hotel that surrounded by plenty of food choices, shops of all kind, and personal services. Economical price with excellent service beyond my expectation! Thank you to all the staff and management team, especially Ms. Chang for reserving the modern and comfortable room for me and my family. Lastly, thank you to Ms. Jackie Cheung, Tracey and Zelos. If I need accomadation anytime in the future in Hong Kong, the Butterfly Hotels would be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient spot, bigger than expected room.”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust786
Reviews.Content: Wrapping up our stay in room 601. We took the airport express to kowloon station and hopped on the k4 bus. Got off at the 1st park hotel doubled back around the corner and prat is one street south. Will pass delifrance on the corner which is convenient for brunch. Look for the pink Neway sign and Butterfly on south side of street. Got a free upgrade to a larger room. Room larger than expected! Microwave, fridge, haidryer and kettle all handy. Great shower will massage away jetlag! Husband found gym and liked the added bonus. Free wifi in room. If needing more brunch options, try holiday inn golden mile breakfast buffet at $100 per two people. Convenient to symphony of lights, star ferry, Nathan road, tst mtr, and lots of restaurants. Supermarket close by too. Only con: must like late night karaoke! We would hear that faintly in our room and I am unfortunately a light sleeper. I would stay here again, just a different room.

Reviews.Title: “okay for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: papemelroti
Reviews.Content: Butterfly on the prat is classified as a boutique hotel. Sure it is cheaper than most hotels in hk but it wasn't worth it for the price i paid for 3 nights. what i didn't like about the hotel was how their "official photos" was so different from seeing the rooms in person. the table and table sink looked cheap, the wall had drawings on them and its just so spartan as if they never bothered to add a few homey touches here and there. on the plus side, the location is close to nathan road and there is a good dessert place just at the corner. the staff was helpful and gave me a bandaid immediately upon my request. the bathroom was clean and an ok size. i just wish the bathroom windows would have some sort of cover for privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy C
Reviews.Content: Excellent location +excellent hotel. If you like spending your day lounging around a hotel lobby then this is not for you. However, if you want to be less than 5 minutes from the MTR + bus station and a 10 minute walk to the harbour then this is the place. Plenty of eating places and the best hotel that we have stopped in Hong Kong. Local bakery at the end of the street + 3 Starbucks within 5 mins walk. Will definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: this hotel has pretty good location, walking distance from great eateries. staff are very friendly and helpful and speak good english too. they'll tell you how to get to the place that you want and advise you on where to get good food. hotel rooms are simple but if you want something more grand, definitely look to other places. wifi available at hotel lobby but not many chairs for you to sit on around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel at fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: free_sp1rit
Reviews.Content: Situated in a convenient location, close to the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR and various malls. Lots of good food around the hotel as well. The rooms are clean and much bigger than the typical HK hotel rooms and we got upgraded for free. The reception staff were helpful too. We stayed here almost everytime we visit HK and we highly recommend Butterfly on Prat!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: paul w
Reviews.Content: Great location and great location. The staff at this hotel are so helpful it makes you wonder if your actually in Hong Kong. The room was spotlessly clean and larger than expected. Well furnished with a very nice bathroom. Amazing shower with proper water pressure for a change. We had a great stay here made all the better by its location and the staff not forgetting the excellent rate, try booking direct rates tend to be even better than Web booking services. Would definately stay agin without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Butterfly on Prat - the Superior rooms are really a misnomer”
Reviews.Author: WilliamJo
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Tsim Sha Shui district, not far from the legendary Peninsula Hotel Kowloon, and within walking distance of the Star Ferry,making it easy to get across the Victoria Harbour to Hong Kong Island. Also conveniently located for the MTR (subway) trains, only a couple of minutes away on foot, so you can get here from the airport by train very easily, without taking a taxi or the airport bus (that takes a long time as it stops off at all the hotels, the MTR is quick and very impressive). In addition the Butterfly on Prat is within easy walking distance of the Hong Kong Polytechnic University and the Museum of History (recommended) and in a safe area where I never felt in danger. So why did I only give this hotel a rating of three out of five? I initially booked a Superior Room but on arrival when I was shown to the room I found it totally claustrophic, as it was very small and overlooked an inner courtyard with no view of the street (or harbour) and this meant you needed to keep the blinds down all the time: not very good for reading. I asked for an upgrade as I was very disappointed with the Superior room, and they moved me to a De Luxe room but this was certainly no more than what I would consider to be a standard hotel room and it was considerably more expensive than the rate quoted for the "Superior Room". The room was clean and well furnished and I had a view down onto the street 17 floors below, but nothing spectacular. In addition there are no public rooms AT ALL in the hotel, so if you want to sit in the lounge and drink a coffee and read the newspaper, sorry, you can't do that. On the ground floor the lobby is a narrow passageway with two receptionists, then two computers with Internet access - but no seats, you have to stand while reading your mail - and then the lift. So no public rooms at all. Not even a breakfast room - and the places where you can get breakfast on Prat Avenue are not all that inspiring. In comparison, some colleagues were staying at the Metropole, just two minutes away, and when I went to their hotel one evening I was impressed by the vast public areas where you could sit and talk. They paid much less than I did at the Butterfly, and they had a much more spacious hotel. At the Butterfly you basically just get a room, and not a big one even if you opt for a De Luxe room, and then you pay a good deal more than for the Superior room. And breakfast is not available. The fitness room was really tiny and I couldn't bring myself to use it. Next time I think I will check the rates at the Metropole. And hopefully get a Harbour view, which you don't get at the Butterfly on Prat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: StuGautz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for 3 nights. The rooms are bit on the small side. We had a double bed with maybe 12 inches of clearance around it. One suitcase was on the desk and the other on the suitcase rack. The washroom was clean, although there wasn't enough clearance between the faucet and the sink. I was told to expect cramped accommodations in Hong Kong, so I can't say I'm surprised. Room was very clean and the staff was helpful. Location was excellent, close to a MTR station as well as many restaurants and Nathan road. We stayed on the 17th floor. We could hear people walk in the hallway as well as work going on outside. Also, the curtains were behind the bed and very difficult to open. I would stay here again if I were to visit Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and comfy...”
Reviews.Author: Mish S
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel a few days before traveling and this was during the peak festive season, between X mas and New Year - so wouldn't say "value for money" but it far exceeded our expectations. The hotel is centrally located and close to all the hot spots on Kowloon. The MTR station is a short 5 minute walk from the hotel and offers excellent connectivity to all places in HK. The rooms were clean. The bathroom impressed us - was a decent size, good shower with hot water and the complimentary toiletries. The rooms could have been a bit bigger, but not complaining as we spent a short time there. No restaurants in the hotel for breakfast...but the Delifrance restaurant that is less than 50 mtrs away served us well. The aircon was very cold even after setting it to the highest temperature. However, the hotel staff provided us with a room heater to keep us warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with good eateries nearby”
Reviews.Author: candyhohoho
