Reviews.Content: Contemporary hotel with responsive English-speaking staff. Love the super big shower head! Felt like standing under a waterfall. A cheap but upmarket yam cha restaurant 'Dao Xiang' (Mandarin) or crop frangance (translation) is about 15 mins away. There is a delicious dry noodle shop on the walk back from the station. Look for vivid posters of fish ball noodles or fried wantons outside the small shop front. This review was late... better late than never.

Reviews.Title: “In its price range, an excellent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonCarioca
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong hotels are known for the small size of their rooms, so it was great to find an affordable hotel in a good location that has decent sized rooms. The staff were also very helpful and friendly, making our stay a pleasure. And while the hotel does not serve breakfast, we had no trouble finding somewhere to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent business hotel and is highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ally2011haiti
Reviews.Content: Was a little bit daunted by the negative comments here and pleasantly suprised. The room I had was 9th floor, back ( grim view of towers but kept curtains closed) away from lift and was as silent as could be. 5th - 8th Floors all smoking - why the smokers go first I don't know as surely those floors are the fire risk? The important thing was it was silent as could be even over New year's eve. Who'd have thought. I slept so well here! The room was pristine clean. I needn't have worried about the lack of wifi internet as there was an internet cable provided - in a little grey bag byt he bedside drawers which is easy to miss, The room was small but I liked it. I was on my own though and maybe 2 people would feel cramped. But you don't go to Hong Kong for the space. Breakfast across the road at the French cafe is great and relatively cheap - $32 HKD was all I spent each day. Do not go to the Italian restaurant downstairs as they ripped me off. I chose what I wanted to eat based on the 2 menus they had on the wall outside. The bill was higher. This is because the menu has a revised price. I said I didn't need to look at the menu as it is outside. They argued and were really rude to me. I was quite shocked at how rude. I think this attitude was wholly inappriopriate and wrong. Transport to places couldn't have been easier. I walked to get the Star Ferry - 10 mins away. There is also a Marks and Spencer nearby so it was good to do some shopping! It was lovely to go for a walk along the promenade of the stars in the evening. The staff were wonderful and very helpful. I'm not putting a high score on value as I travelled over New year and all hotels in hong Kong are out to rip you off - $500 for one night for New Year's eve. Can you believe it? Normally it is $120. Final comment - the Butterfly needs to change their air refreshner in reception. It's horrible and gave me an allergy!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: Kin T
Reviews.Content: Heart of Tsim Sha Tsui. Perfectly located. Receptionists are very nice and patient. Personally think this is a good hotel for both leisure and business purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great spacious room”
Reviews.Author: baocong
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the deluxe room. Ample walking space unlike many other hotels within same location, minus branded ones. Will be great if Housekeeping do not converse so loudly along corridor though

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: filipin0traveller
Reviews.Content: within walking distance to many attractions, dining places and shopping areas. I visited with my mother. My sister from Dubai also booked a room. When we checked out on our last day, they let us stay in my sisters room. Very nice staff

Reviews.Title: “Stylish spot in chaotic Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ladybug_cesca
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully stylish and colorful lobby, very gentle and helpful staff, nice and clean rooms with all the amenities that you may need (microwave, kettle with tea bags and instant coffee, air conditioning, alarm clock, flat screen tv, free wifi internet, safe, hair dryer), this hotel is a great deal in terms of quality and price. Moreover it's very close to the Tsim Sha Trui underground station. Something you may want to know: the en-suite bathroom has a transparent glass wall with door.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: queenstowngirlie
Reviews.Content: It was a little difficult to find without a map - which is all my fault. Their website tells you to take the K3 free shuttle from Kowloon, but you're better off taking the K4. Arrived very early, but they helpfully let me check in at 9.30 which was great. Once you're there, the location is great. The MTR is just a couple minutes' walk away and is right on Nathan Road for shopping. Also close to waterfront which was great after watching the light show I just ambled on back. The bed and pillows were very comfy. Have to be a little careful in the bathroom of the room I was given, not to bump myself on corners. Clean room, plenty of hot water. Staff are super helpful and friendly. Yes it was one of the smaller hotel rooms I've ever stayed in, but I felt it was still quite spacious. Only real downside was that the air conditioning was either on or off, there was no temperature control. Which meant I alternated between freezing and boiling at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: skylovechan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just about a few minutes walk from the MTR. The superior room is a very small room but clean and well maintained. They allowed us to check in early and check out late. The lobby of the hotel smells so good! Also, there are lots of restos near the hotel so you have lots of choices to eat. Also near other shopping areas like Granville. The problem is the aircon is aimed straight at you at the center of the bed when you sleep. We had to switch at the other end so it doesn't get uncomfortably cold. Although not too big of a deal, they did not have toiletries on our first night of stay. I didn't bother to ask because we brought ours anyway. I figured they must have forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Disaapointed on 2nd time re-visit.”
Reviews.Author: Proxity
Reviews.Content: After a very happy stay with the hotel in July, I brought my friend to stay here in September By guaraty that the hotel is value for money plus good location, finally the hotel made me very disaapointed. The reception assign room 808 to me without notify me at all that this room is designed for wheel-chair. I am 1.80 m tall, the shower head was at my chest and it's leaked. The very very tiny wash basin was just 10 cm above my knee level. You have to bend yourself more than 90 degree to wash your face or else need to knee down and you cannot your shower to wash just your face because it's leaked (otherwise you will wet whole body). If this not upset enough, on the day I checked out, I told reception that the room has problem, she just nodded her head without asked just one question what wrong with the room. Seems she already know that the room has problem or else she might not care on whichever guest comment. It's shamed to me because I have strongly guaranty my friend that the hotel is great and insist him to change hotel from what he always stay.. I put this hotel on list to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AC-Angel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights last May 2011. The place was tiny which seems to be a standard for Hong Kong. Its located in a small alley near Nathan Road (Shopping District of Hong Kong). Love how when you come in a soothing smell from the lobby overwhelms you. No complementary breakfast but there's a McDonald's near the place and some other breakfast joint. The hotel is very accessible to the train and the shopping centers (including the night markets). A bit pricey but I guess for Hong Kong standards its already ok. What I didn't like about the place is the bathroom and the window. No privacy at all since both are made from glass thus people from the outside can see you.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel - Centralised and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jennyMalaysia18
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is situated at a very convenient location and nearby Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. On our first day, we actually have difficulty locating the hotel. Once we have manage to get our orientation of the hotel location, it is very to move around. The hotel is parallel to Cameron Road. There are many small roads that can lead to the hotel from Nathan Road. Personally I prefer to use Humphrey.. If you come from Granville Road then you have to turn right into Carnavon Road, pass Cameron Road on the left and Prat Avenue is the next road. The hotel is located on the right hand side of the road on Prat Avenue. Look out for " Neway " signage at the top and you will be able to spot the hotel. If you come from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station, walk pass K11 shopping mall pass Hanoi Road and you will come to a cross junction. Prat avenue is just 12 o'clock down the road. The hotel is relatively new and the room is clean and quite spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location in kowloon”
Reviews.Author: rival1981
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here. Great hotel near some fantastic bars and restaurants. Central to everything in kowloon

Reviews.Title: “friendly, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danny1956
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent and easy to get to and from Kowloon station a very good base to explore HK. We had a son in a wheelchair and staff always assisted and suggested interesting places.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location + Free Wi-Fi + Nice Simple Room”
Reviews.Author: duffy12
Reviews.Content: Location is superb, being a few short minutes' walk from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR. Plenty of food eateries along the way (Oh, please go ahead and try the yummy curry fish balls at a corner shop. Opens at night.). It was only a short MTR ride for us, whether to go further north to Jordan/Mongkok or across to the island. Very, very convenient. Travellers from HKIA can take the Airport Express to Kowloon Station and transfer to the free shuttle bus service. The Hotel is not listed but the ushers there will direct you to take the route where you stop about 5 minutes' walk away from the Hotel. Free Wi-Fi is of course great and gives much comfort to those who need internet access to check their mails etc. No faults about the deluxe room as well. Only feedback we can give is that the pillows given in the room were way too soft. Even with 2 pillows you can't really feel the support. We did not bother, but if it is too much of a discomfort, try asking for harder ones. Also, curtains are not thick enough which allow too much sunlight to seep into the room. Well, minor issue but could be a deal breaker for those who wish to sleep in late.

Reviews.Title: “Tad ex but it is nice”
Reviews.Author: fridaywoo
Reviews.Content: During the peak season, the price can be tad ex for what it offers. But if you were to stay on other days, it is a hotel for flashpackers to consider. We almost missed the entrance to the hotel, which is slightly smaller than a shopfront, blocked by the pillar of the driveway (which was cordoned off to cars). Our room didn't come with a view, but I was surprised by the microwave in the room. I think it is very useful to have microwaves in hotel rooms, for warming those many "ta-baos" we have. Lucky for us, though we didn't stay on a high floor, we weren't affected by the pubs, unlike many other reviews below. The bathroom door is a lock-less swing door which swings freely either way. So, do note that, if you're traveling with someone you're actually not very close to (e.g. colleagues on a business trip), or if you have inquisitive, running children? The staff are sweet- they helped to print the flight itineraries for free. I've yet to been to a budget hotel which provides macs at the lobby, free wifi, on top of free printing. Friendly room service crew too. Location wise, it is not the best, but it doesn't matter. Whatever you might need is within walking distance. Tsim Sha Tsui is already a convenient enough location with many buses and covered by a spidery web of underground tunnels which leads to the MTR. You'll be able to get back to the hotel in a jiffy.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need, nothing you don't: Location, wifi, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Realq86
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of ballar 6-7 star hotels in HK for you to spoil yourself on, especially in the Tsim Sha Tsui area. However there are also a lot of choices for budget/valued conscious minded travels and this is one of my favorite! I travel to HK a lot and because of a friend working in the Starwood group I always stay at the W in Kowloon station. So I consider myself pretty spoiled about hotels in HK. When I no longer can get the family and friends rate at the W, I've been experimenting with boutique hotels in the Tsim Sha Tsui area. The rule of thumb I had is, hotels get cheaper and better with each city block you are willing to walk away from a MTR station or the Harbor City mall. This hotel fits the description very well. If you are someone who only need a decent place to rest at night while you roam the city by day this one of the place for you! As my title suggests, you pay for the things you need and nothing you don't! The hotel is clean, roomy for HK, has free internet, and just 3 blocks from the closest MTR entrance. It doesn't have a giant lobby or a hotel front which you don't need anyway. Note there is no swimming pool which is something you may like to have for a vacation. The only down side is there are a few pub downstairs which can get a bit louder even for HK. In the area I've tried, the Marco Polo Prince, The Mira, and the Bauhinia Hotel. The Prince is your standard 4 star hotel roomy and great location in the middle of the shopping mall, but it doesn't have free internet and cost twice ($200-$300) as Butterfly. The Mira is trendy and most W like, but when you take a step back, its an older 3 star hotel layout with a giant face lift decorated into a 5 star boutique and cost like a 5 star. The Bauhinia is a bit farther away but I find it to be a even better value than Butterfly on Prat in terms of the quality of the room and price!

Reviews.Title: “Small but cozy rooms =))”
Reviews.Author: jet g
Reviews.Content: I like the scent of green tea when I entered their lobby...room was accommodating, my kids love the room because of the microwave oven...but it's really great for honeymooners not a family of 4. Staffs were nice they even let us leave our baggage even though we're already checked out. Small walk to the MTR...overall, we enjoyed our stay =))

Reviews.Title: “Great locations, decent rooms, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jcb193
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location in Kowloon. Tons of walking areas, food, shopping. Nice, modern room. Nice amenities. Helpful staff Quiet Close to MRT Cons: No breakfast Rooms are a little small if more than 2 people (but that's Hong Kong) No bathtub Smoking rooms not descented that much Have to take a taxi from airport shuttle, or use MRT (very close to stops, if you aren't carrying a lot of luggage). Great hotel, great location, I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Paulina I
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for last new years and I would always recommend it to my friends. It's a small hotel but definitely great service. Rooms were very clean as well. You'll notice that the entire place smells a bit like elizabeth arden perfume. Even greater was the location. It was near the shopping district and bars in hongkong. I appreciated the free internet use most of all. They even printed our disneyland tickets for us. Most 5 star hotels would charge a fee for using their internet and computer.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great shower but noisy”
Reviews.Author: AndrewThePiper
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Kowloon shopping and nightscene area. Room was ok sized, but the shower was really good : roomy and powerful. Free WiFi was a great feature to have. However.... the noise on the street was sometimes hellish at night. We stayed on the 12th floor, but 2 of the windows were designed to open, so the seals are not very noise proof. The metro station entrance was just round the corner, but to get to any meaningful place you needed a 10 mins. walk underground to the correct Metro line.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Ray_9476
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights after reading recommendations from Tripadvisor. Took Airport Express and then hop onto free shuttle bus number "K4". Alighted at the first stop (Opposite Park Hotel at Cameron Street). Prat Ave is just on the next street and only about 5 mins away. Butterfly on Prat is directly opposite the Guangdong Hotel. As expected, the lobby is filled with a nice frangance. Too strong at times. Requested for high floor, got one facing the back of another building. The room is slightly smaller than what i have expected. (Previously i stayed in Nathan Hotel which is slightly bigger).Room is clean and free wifi. The see through glass is really not so nice when you want to use the toilet. Nearby, there are numerous eateries and cafes. Thus no worries about breakfast. Can try Tsui wah Restaurant , Tao Heung Restaurant for good dim sum. (3/F., Carnavon Plaza, 20-20C Carnavon Road, Tsim Sha Tsui). 24 HR Mcdonalds is just next door. Very near to MTR station too. Take "D2" or "A2" exit. Would stay at this hotel again if i comes back provided the price does not goes up. Paid SGD634 for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel not great”
Reviews.Author: unclepatto
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and enjoyed it but didnt love it. Dont get me wrong, im not saying that I didnt like it.Its just that it didnt blow me away or have any wow factor that I was looking for. The room wasnt huge though I understand that in Hong Kong thats the norm. Location was great and you coudlnt fault that. Very easy to get to and from the airport or even jump on the ferry. Rooms are clean and well looked after. Head down to the markets and do try and get some cheap bargins. Grab a bite to eat at the many street kitchens, dont be afraid the food was great and very cheap. All in all good hotel but not amazing like I had hoped.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden beauty”
Reviews.Author: Melovechocolate
Reviews.Content: I didn't give the hotel 5 stars because there were some repairs going on our floor, at least they allowed us to sleep well. This hotel was clean, people at the front desk were EXTREMELY helpful and friendly, always making sure everything was in order. We had absolutely no problems (other than changing some doors and fixing some patches of carpet on our floor to make it nicer--a good sign). Also, since we have 2 pre-teen boys, the free wi-fi access on the computers near the elevators were a BIG plus! Lots of things to see near the hotel. My soon had a tummy ache and I was able to get him some tasty PHO accross the street. We would definitely come again! NOTE: this hotel is actually in Kowloon, and easy to miss

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in the Heart of TST & Friendly Staff...”
Reviews.Author: ChelseyTS
Reviews.Content: Ive been here twice & i love the location just outside the hotel are bars, restaurants & many shops. 1 minute walk is a 24 hour mcdonalds. all the rooms in this boutique hotel are queen size bed only. internet in the room is free. room size is adequate but the price are more expensive compared to other hotels in the area. when u enter the lobby it smells green tea & everywhere in the area are kept clean. would not mind staying back here again if the price will be affordable and not too high.. was here last dec. 2010 & april this year.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and adequate, not as great as reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: Jay_2408
Reviews.Content: The Butterfly on Prat is a very functional and practical hotel. If you are looking for space and a lot of facilities, this is not the place. But if you are looking for a "right in the heart of everything" clean place, this is your destination. First the positives: Walking distance from the Tsim Sha Tsui station, shopping all around and a very couteous and efficient staff are the pluses. You will not miss a restaurant with enough and more options all around. There is an electronic safe in the room, free WiFi and resonable sized space. As a family, we always felt secure. The room was neat and fairly clean. The staff is especially courteous and helpful. What does not work well is the absence of privacy with see through glass in the bath/toilet areas. This gets a little challenging if you are traveling with a family. While the bathrooms have adequate space, the sleeping area is especially small. The biggest drawback of the hotel is its value for money. For the money you pay, if you research enough on the net, you can get accommodation in hotels with many more facilities in the same area. All in all, it is fine as long you you spend most of the day out and use the hotel only to freshen up and sleep. A tad expensive for that though!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: pulltabhere
Reviews.Content: We had the most fantastic stay at the Butterfly on Prat last week. The rooms were lovely - not too small at all (very very comfortable by Asian room standards!) The bathroom (despite the odd glass panel!) was very large with a wonderful shower. The staff were incredibly kind and attentive. We discovered on our last night that we were actually on a smoking floor (and we don't smoke!) but the hotel was obviously so well designed that we never even smelled cigarettes! The free wifi in all the hotel rooms was another great bonus. But the reason I will stay at the Butterfly every time I return to Hong Kong was the location. Incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBrian
Reviews.Content: The Butterfly is in a great location. Close to everything, including Nathan Road and the subway. The rooms are very well appointed with great mattresses and lovely modern decor. The staff is friendly and attentive. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Modern”
Reviews.Author: bzchrmr
Reviews.Content: Booked on Agoda 1 night in late July, and we were upgraded to a fabulous suite. For the $ we paid, the suite was fantastic, and included a rooftop deck (overlooking a busy street, but hey, it's HK). Suite had multiple closets, a kitchen area with coffee machine, sink, and microwave. Lovely dining table for two with place settings, and comfortable lounging chairs. Location is perfectly central, easy to access all of HK from this area. Lots of food and bar options in the vicinity, so we didn't try the hotel restaurants. We obviously had a fantastic time, but it's hard to say whether we would have found the value of the standard room to be as good, since we were upgraded. I suspect the fact we booked on Agoda had something to do with being flagged for upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: isateresa
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend joined the Standard Chartered marathon last February 2011 and he decided to get this hotel. It's in Tsim Sha Tsui, near his starting point of the race and it's near the train station. The hotel itself is easy to find. We did the Airport Express, then the train to Tsim Sha Tsui. It only took us a few minutes on foot before we found Butterfly. It has a small but welcoming lobby, the front desk and concierge are so helpful and the rooms are clean, well equipped, quite small but it's value for money. We had no problems going around because the front desk staff is ready and able to assist us. It's an ideal boutique hotel, but the only problem is they don't serve breakfast. However they're near a lot of good hole in the wall restos and diners that you can't wait to explore. This is near a lot of malls too, but this is Hong Kong, so that's normal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in TST!”
Reviews.Author: gianfranc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this great boutique hotel. For it's price, the location, room quality and cleanliness cannot be beat! One tiny gripe is that the air-con thermostat in the room didn't seem to work (even though we turned it up to 30 degrees) and the room was still very cold.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmchelle
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location. Easily accessible with public transportation, ie cabs & MTR station nearby. Great shopping places and restaurants all around, especially Nathan Road and Granville. Prices were good for the area as HK is generally quite an expensive stay. Busy bustling streets everywhere. Room was good, size just nice for 2 but bathroom is quite in a decent size. Most importantly clean and cozy and equipped with free wifi & hotel amenities. Staff were friendly and always smiling. Service was good, A/C working fine, overall design was modern and interesting. We got the room facing the main street hence it's quite noisy throughout the whole day. Otherwise, this hotel is fine. Good stay in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again”
Reviews.Author: sheryl0202
Reviews.Content: stayed there in May, close to MTR station, plenty of street foods nearby, clean and reasonably sized room, friendly staffs, good service, what more can you ask for? I will consider staying here again for my next visit to HK.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: Ewa E
Reviews.Content: I spent in this hotel 3 nights. I can reccomend you this place - rooms are clean and hotel has good location (close to metro station, ferry piers). Workers are nice and helpful. Only price is a little discouraging, but HK is generally expensive place :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: SergC
Reviews.Content: Very competitively priced for the convenient location. Rooms and interior of the hotel are very modern and very clean. The staff were very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “A fragrant oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: Chestnuts
Reviews.Content: As soon as you enter the cool, calm fragrant reception you can breathe a sigh of relief. The staff our pleasant and helpful, the hotel is quiet and calm the perfect antidote to the madness and mayhem outside. Great location, easy to get to the metro and the star ferry terminal and of course Nathan Road and the great boutique shops of Granville Road. We stayed 4 nights at the Butterfly and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “small but good apartments in good location”
Reviews.Author: traveller_spain
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights during one trip to HK that I used as base to travel also to Macau, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, ... The building is in Tsim Sha Tsui, very near from the metro station with the same name, and at a walking distance from Avenue of Stars and boats to HK island. There are plenty of options to have lunch/dinner or buy some food. The room is small, but comfortable, clean, with free wifi. You have an small fridge and microwave with tea facilities. Is better to become the rooms not facing the street as it may be loud at night. Staff is friendly and helpful to help you to organize your free time in HK and give you the information you may need. I think is a good option to stay in a central location at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “stayed connected”
Reviews.Author: JAndrews10
Reviews.Content: That was what I experienced when I checked in. A typhoon was raging back home and it hit Hongkong after two days. I got in touch with my family and of course got update of the weather through unlimited WIFI at the Prat. It was my trip to HK for the nth time and we used to stay in this location. Cameron road and Humphrey ave. have changed a lot and I like these areas better than it was many years back. As suggested from previous posts, I requested for a room on the higher floors. There is a German pub two doors away and a karaoke bar. Can't hear a thing up on the 15th floor. There is a grocery on the basement of Kundamal House a few meters across the Prat. And do try this dessert place (the name is in Chinese). You won't miss it with long lines specially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ivan C
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for anniversary. Very competitively priced vs location. Exterior was unimpressive, same as other buildings adjacent to it. Interior was modern, clean, chic. Staff were couteous, polite and kind. Room was reasonably sized given its excellent location. Bed was comfortable, clean. Toilet was modern and clean. Good for couples and business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, in great location”
Reviews.Author: Craig O
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, and it was a lovely hotel, the room was modern and new. The location was just off Nathan road, and there were plenty of bars and cheap restaurants within walking distance. It is also very close to the MRT station, which was convenient for travelling. We were on the 15th Floor, and did not hear the street. Overall a lovely place to stay, will be back when next in HK

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Loves2travel036
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Tsim Tsai Tsui (fantastic shopping and eating district) with an abundance of good eateries/7-11/K-Circle nearby. There are also a lot of bars nearby but we always felt super safe. There are 18 floors in the hotel and we stayed in room 1709 not facing the street and luckily we experienced no noise from the streets/karaoke bars as mentioned by a few other reviewers. The walls are definitely thin where we heard the hallway noise clearly (doors shutting, people talking etc). Rooms are tiny but the bed and stand up shower makes up for it. The bed is super comfy and the rain shower head is really relaxing after a long day walking in the humid/hot weather. The carpets are due for a steam cleaning as spots were visible throughout. A major negative point to the room was the glass window that views into the bathroom. It was awkward and unnecessary. Luckily I was travelling with my significant other but I don't see myself staying at this hotel with anyone else solely based on that see-through window. Housekeeping was good however during my 9 day stay they came to my room on several occasions asking me if I ordered lunch or if I ordered laundry service, which I didn't and I'm assuming they got mixed up with another room. It was annoying to be woken up for these mistakes so the DO NOT DISTURB sign went up for the remainder of my stay. The MTR is a 10 minute walk away and was our preferred mode of transportation, super easy to use and got us to all of the popular destinations efficiently. It is a boutique hotel (small and unknown hotel to most taxi drivers) with a teeny tiny lobby but it had all the necessities of a large hotel and its location can't be beat for the rate we paid, the overall quality of this hotel was fantastic. We definitely will be back to Butterfly on Prat.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and trendy”
Reviews.Author: Wand3rlust
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon in HK and Macau. It's a nice boutique hotel that appeals more for the young and trendy. The hotel is very modern and new. It is conveniently located in the middle of Nathan road so it is very accessible. There is a free breakfast and if you want to try the local cuisine there are tons of restaurants nearby. At the corner there is food stand that has always a long line. They serve the local street foods. So if you are adventurous enough you don't have to look far. By the way, if you are not a couple you might need to specify a room that has no glass bathroom. Their bathroom has glass doors so if you have business you don't wann share this will be a big problem.Overall we enjoyed our stay. We will definitely stay again,

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and in the middle of the city..”
Reviews.Author: sheeba4gs
Reviews.Content: It is a small but extremely comfortable hotel. It is very near the MRT and right next to a pub (for those interested in karaoke) The beds were comfortable and have all the amenities required. Has a very small Thai restaurant next to it. A must try. Helpful staff and very near some shopping malls and restaurants.. Indian, Thai etc. A good deal any day.

Reviews.Title: “Very good except for the gang fight outside hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerthMel
Reviews.Content: Nice clean new hotel. Love the design and bathroom concept (opaque glass wall). Can't find any fault with the hotel itself. Nice location, it's near Tsim Tsa Tsui MTR and K11 mall with lots of yummy restaurants. However, at night things can be quite noisy. We were in level 16 and can still hear noise from clubbers going home at wee hours in the morning. Worse, on a tuesday morning around 3 am, there was a gang fight right outside our hotel. It felt like someone swearing right outside the room for a good 5 min. Someone (most probably the hotel staff) had done a good job calling cops straight away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean and Nice Rooms, Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aileen I
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the family. We occupied 2 rooms, which were adequately sized. The hotel is located convenienly near a Metro station and walking distance to Nathan and Granville Roads, which are major shopping areas. Hotel staff is very courteous and helpful. Rooms have coffee/tea service, a safe, and even a microwave oven. Being a boutique hotel, rooms are not that big, though adequate enough for 2 people. What is lacking though is a coffee shop and breakfast which is not included in the room rate, so you need to go out everyday for breakfast. Good there is a McDonald's a few meters away, and a bakeshop near the Metro Station. The hotel lobby is quite small too which can get very crowded when guests are checking in or out at the same time. What I like about thr lobby though is that it smells pleasantly of green tea all the time. Can stay in this hotel again but would also be open to trying others.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: chiongmaya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a deluxe room Aug 27-30. Lobby by far the smallest one I've seen. Checked-in within 10 minutes, so there is absolutely no need for a large swanky lobby with chandeliers. Staff were cheerful and most efficient. For security, guests will have to swipe the key card to activate elevator buttons. Room was bigger than other HK hotels. The room exudes cleanliness. Not a smudge on the mirrors and glass partitions. Water pressure very strong,heater is fine.Shower handles, faucets all glistening without any trace of fingerprints.There's daily free bottled water, coffee and tea stuff, shavers and shampoo, LAN cable, travel adaptor, wireless phone, iphone/ipod dock,soft queen sized bed with more than enough pillows,a long working table below the LCD tv, power outlets for your laptops and other gadgets, electronic safe (netbook will fit, laptop won't), bigger-than-usual ref, a microwave oven, and free Wi-Fi !!! There are 2 Mac desktops in the lobby. I printed our boarding passes for free. Really helpful people. Taxi can be a bit difficult in certain hours, but they will let you wait inside the lobby as their staff would flag one for you. There's a 24-hour basement supermarket diagonally across. 7-11 and Circle K stores ,K-11 Mall, MTR, and bus stops along Chatam are all just a few steps away. Butterfly doesnt offer free breakfast, and it's like telling you to explore all the restos around the place. There's a food kiosk around the corner where you can try the "hong kong street food" popular amongst locals.Great for midnight snacks, specially with the microwave in the room... Highly recommended. Already booked for my return next month.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern and trendy”
Reviews.Author: Timo-J
Reviews.Content: Modern and trendy hotel in excellent location at walking distance from places like Knutsford Terrace, Nathan Rd and bit further Avenue of Stars and Star Ferry. Street that hotel is located can be a bit shock for a first timer in Hong Kong, lots of ad’s and people. But don’t worry they won’t bother; they are the part of Hong Kong’s atmosphere. Lobby service was helpful, not the best in the city but better than average. There isn’t much space in lobby but it’s well organized and trendy. We lived on lower floors windows facing street. Room was bright and modern looking with good sized bathroom with shower. It was quiet, no noise from street or neighbor’s. Room was serviced daily, bathroom was well cleaned and room all ways made up. Certainly a good place to stay when you visit in Hong Kong, we definitely will return when we’re next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Ilo1960
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. We selected this hotel for the location. We wanted to be close to our American friends who stayed just around the corner. The most important for us was the price, the location and th efree WiFi in the room. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel is situated close to the MRT and next to a great Italian restaurant. There is a ballroom dancing studio just a few streets away in case you are looking for a ballroom opportunity. Next time we visit HK we will stay again here or try one of the other Butterfly hotels. No need to look for any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean and cosy!”
Reviews.Author: Aza501
Reviews.Content: the hospitality is above expected. whenever we want to go for sight seeing, the reception staff are more than willing to show us proper directions in term of transportation i.e: by bus, mtr or walking. i remembered the front desk asst manager, (Patricia) if i'm not mistaken. she showed us the direction to get our bus to the airport and she really made an effort to ensure that we take the right but at right stop! thanks all. we will back!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Proxity
Reviews.Content: Good location with variety of restaurants surrounding. Just walking distance from TST MRT station. Front desk are friendly and good command in English. There is free in-room internet. Also, there is microwave oven installed in room which is quite impressed me. Bathroom is see-thru window style (and no curtain !). It may cause a little uncomfort for sharing room among family members or officemates.

Reviews.Title: “We will always stay here when we are in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: knoller70
Reviews.Content: It is a cozy small hotel, very small lobby but clean. The room we got on the 7th floor was big compared to other hotel rooms in HK. It was clean but not much furniture, eg. sofa, coach, etc. It was a queen size bed with side table. The reception staff were friendly and very accommodating. Our flight out of HK was not until late at night, they kept our luggages at their storage, we went out to shop some more, then we were able to stuff our luggage at their lobby. We will stay there again next time we are in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: kyapjoco
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because our friends highly recommended it. The room looks great as it is a boutique hotel. It has a refrigerator and microwave - great for storing and reheating tarts and other goodies you can get within the area. It is very clean and they do a great job cleaning it up every day. The bed is very comfortable so you're sure to have a good night's sleep. We stayed on the 13th floor and was facing the one side of the building so we did not have any problems with noise from surrounding establishments unlike others. The bathroom is well-appointed with shampoo, conditioner and shower gel, toothpaste and toothbrushes. The free wi-fi was very convenient. We chose the hotel because of its location. It was a few blocks away from malls and street shops. If you're not going to shop for luxury goods in Harbour City, this hotel makes a great starting point every day. You're not far from the MTR either. There's a lot of restaurants, food stalls and convenience stores in the area too. The staff does things very fast and can speak good English. They are also very helpful if you'd like help on finding certain things like restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated if you ask me”
Reviews.Author: dartagnanaguilar
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the room. It's smaller than I imagined with very basic amenities. The toilet is tiny, to think that the Japanese hotels I have stayed in are tiny as weel. But there's something about it that's just not right. Maybe it's the towel rack that fell when I pulled a towel. Maybe it's the towel that's not exactly clean. Maybe it's the shower that acts weird and can't make up its mind whether it serves hot or cold water. It could have been manageable if I didn't stay for 6 days. The front desk wasn't warm either. Maybe they should drop 'boutique' from their description so that I'd find all these bearable.

Reviews.Title: “A good value, well designed hotel. Worthy of the description 'boutique'”
Reviews.Author: Sculthorpe-Pike
Reviews.Content: This is the third HK Butterfly hotel we have tried. it is as good as the other two but we didn't like the location as much, as Kowlooon isn't as trendy/classy as the Island. However, for folk who like that area or who have to stay on the mainland for other reasons, this is as good a boutique hotel as you can get. Service was excellent at reception and the rooms were well maintained and very attractive. Ours was a larger room than we have come to expect from this category of hotel in HK and the shower was positively cavernous. In our view these three hotels sit nicely between the big international groups and the somewhat seedier four and three stars, in both comfort and cleanliness - and price. Good for business travellers too with excellent free wifi and enough space to work in comfort. Do not expect room service/buffet breakfasts - and why worry anyhow, when there is a very acceptable Delifrance on the corner and dozens of Chinese breakfast restaurants or street food stalls available nearby. You'll be unlike to leave this hotel disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: michael b
Reviews.Content: The hotel was always a pleasure to come back to after long days of shopping and eating. Rooms were contemporary and had ample space. Housekeeping did a good job with making up the room. We will book this hotel again on our next trip to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: irishfanmn
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice boutique hotel, providing exactly what we sought. Comfort and convenience. It's not a luxury property and doesnt pretend to be. Corporate rate resulted in this being an exceptional value. Room was average size (the norm in HK), but nice layout with stylish bathroom. We were on 9th floor with a street view, and yet the noise wasn't a problem for sleeping. Everything was quite clean. Lobby is small - almost kiosk sized, but always with 2 or 3 Hotel staff on hand. Friendly and able to provide local info. A few PC's for guests to check e-mail. No breakfast option on premise. However, we found many resturants within very easy walking distance, some within half a block, and we (unlike other reviewers) found nice breakfasts, lunches and dinner places.. Since everythings open so late, one might have a problem finding breakfast at 7AM.... but an hour or two later and you'll be fine. Nice stay and I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this or other Butterfly properties in the future. I was going to rate this overall 4 stars, but each of the 4 factors I rate, 1) service, 2) value 3) sleep and 4) cleanliness all get excellent therefore overall has to be a 5. Again. its not luxury, but our overall stay was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Ok value, but not enough to make me go back”
Reviews.Author: ManilaAreWeThereYet
Reviews.Content: There were only 2 rooms left -- a Deluxe Double (HK1500) and Superior Double (HK1300). The rooms looked the SAME! Perhaps the only difference was that the bathroom of the Deluxe Double had a tad more privacy. Note to people who need privacy in the bathroom: the bathrooms have clear, no curtain or blinds or anything windows that open up into the room! There is no restaurant in the hotel, no robes in the room, free internet, underwhelming experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: ThePenangTans
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Monday to Friday night first week of August. The rooms are new, modern and comfortable, we had a superior room for 2 and a deluxe room with an extra bed for 3 for our kids. Comparing the two rooms, it is worth paying a little extra for the deluxe as the overall rooms, wardrobe and shower areas are bigger making for a more comfortable stay. The bathroom has a glass pane that looks into the bedroom area and vice versa. In the deluxe room there is a blind, but there is no fixture for this in the superior room. This can be a bit disturbing for people who need a bit of private time in the loo. In room wifi was very fast and consistent, no complaints there. The super powerful, super hot showers was very welcome relief after a day on your feet in the Hong Kong dust and heat. The location is fantastic, walking distance to main shopping and eating areas. After a whole day of shopping, it's nice to know that the hotel is only 5 minutes walk from the MTR station. When approached, the reception staff was very helpful and gave us useful pointers on good places to eat locally, but in general we had very little need to deal with reception or housekeeping staff as we had no complaints. The amenities (extra towel, water, toiletries) to go with the extra bed was always available without us having to remind them as is often needed with other hotels. The only comment is that my daughter was ill one day and we put the 'do not disturb' sign on the door for her to get some rest, but housekeeping and management staff kept calling on the phone and coming in to the room anyway. I am hoping that this just means they are concerned about their guests rather than being overly suspicious. Overall highly recommended for a fuss free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location & Good Facilities!”
Reviews.Author: mangopudding10
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel at around noon and were swiftly directed to our rooms, the rooms were slightly small, but nevertheless well fitted with appliances like a microwave, mini bar, DVD player, torchlight and kettle. The bathroom first appeared rather small, but as we entered, we found that there was a large, spacious shower tucked away inside. As conscientious travellers, we were also delighted to know that there was a 24 hour gym in the hotel. Though it is located on the 5th floor, we had a little trouble locating it, after being wrongly directed by a housekeeper. Eventually, we found the small gym that is equipped with a cycling machine, a treadmill, a weights machine, a yoga mat, a set of dumbbells, a television and a water cooler. It was a fairly good gym, and we were undisturbed as we worked out in the evenings. The hotel's free internet was also a bonus, as there was internet access in the rooms as well as in the lobby on Apple Macs which were set up. The internet is fast and good. The receptionists were also rather helpful in telling us where to go to find things and giving their personal opinions on where to eat. Butterfly on Prat is located in a very popular district in Tsim Sha Tsui and has an abundance of restaurants, cafes and bars to eat at, though choose wisely, as some restaurants' food is pretty bad - no worries, there is also an abundance of 7-Elevens & a Maccas on Prat Avenue itself. Located near an MTR station and a brief walking distance from Harbour City, iSquare and Sogo, Butterfly on Prat was a good experience and if I come back to Hong Kong I will most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: dcp772000
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in a small street of central Kowloon, it is in the middle of teh entertainment and food area of this part of the city. Five minutes walk from the underground station, and 10 from the waterfront with view onto Hongk Kong. The rooms are not huge, but big enough for the standards of this part of the world. Nicely funished and decorated. The bathroom was actually quite big with a huge nice shower. The shower has a glass panel towards tegh room, but as it is of a matt orange colour, you do not actually see anything. Most hotels in asia give you a wide array of toiletries, but I found particluarly nice the complementary colured slippers. They do not do breakfast, and the lobby is as big as the room toilet, but they still found a corner for a pc, in case you need to check your emails. Kowloon is not HK, the first feels a lot like tourist-land and you definetly notice a different buzz across the water, but in this area the hotels seem to be cheaper and we would definetly use it hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but need improvement on cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Shannahs_SG
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about 5-7mins walk from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. Just opposite Guangdong hotel. There is many eateries, pubs and shops located next to hotel. Room are spacious (enough for 2 huge luggage & plenty of walking space) and excellent in room facilities (safe, fridge, microwave, DVD player and power adapter provided). Bathroom is spacious but part of the wall built with a clear glass (near basin area) where one can peep in to the bathroom. The bathroom wall facing bedroom is frosty with color panel but it is not visible from bedroom. WiFi internet worked in the room and 2 Mac book available at reception area for free access. Hotel staffs are helpful in giving public transport direction and can assist you to book airport-hotel transfer (*must arrange in advance) or negotiate cab fare with the cabbies when traveling to airport (*luggage on cab is charged at HKD$5 per piece). Cons: Bedsheet are stained, bathroom towel/mat are worn out and damage. Hotel is always run out of fresh towels and throughout my 3 nites stay, they forgotten to replace fresh bathroom towels and other supplies, it also took them quite a while to send up. Stayed on Level 10, not affected by the noise from the pub on street but you can hear voices when one walk pass your room (room soundproof is bad), especially those guests returning to their rooms after clubbing. Though the hotel look new, it felt a bit filthy already with dirty counters, stained shower area and torn curtains. Time to consider renovating and replace all bedsheets & towels!

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joshbaz696
Reviews.Content: The Butterfly on Prat was a great boutique hotel. It was a refreshing change from some of the larger hotels that I stay at. The room was very trendy simple but nice. I really enjoyed my stay there and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location and a comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: nzkiwicouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Butterfly on Prat for one night and were impressed by the hotel's location; the friendliness and service we received from the staff; and the soft, comfy bed. Our flight to Hong Kong arrived early in the morning so I had requested an early check-in time via email a few days prior to our arrival - the hotel staff kindly let us check-in a few hours earlier for which we were most grateful! We would stay there again for the central location on Kowloon - less than 5 mins walk to the metro and close to Nathan Road, malls, restaurants and local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible location”
Reviews.Author: kangarooHZ
Reviews.Content: They have an accessible location but I dont really like the crowd around the hotel. many shabby figures around but that is also because of the pubs. nice eateries is a plus there too. the hotel staff is friendly and helpful. My sleep was always disrupted by inconsiderate "neighbour"

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, great shower”
Reviews.Author: ushela03
Reviews.Content: Arrived early in hong kong and they had a room for us by noon. Nice large bed, tv had some English channels. Room looked out over the street with no noise down below. The shower in the bathroom was huge with clean tile, good water pressure and nice shower head. Probably the best shower I had in Asia. Neighborhood has restaurants, 711, mtr stop and easy access to museums and Nathan road. Coming and going to the airport is easy... Train to airport express bus that drops you off around the corner at the park hotel. Only downside was no wifi on the room. It worked in the Lobby and there are 2 apple computers you van use too.

Reviews.Title: “All mod cons in middle of TST”
Reviews.Author: KateE006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 10th to 14th of June 2011. I had room 1605, a Deluxe Queen room. The hotel is modern with spacious clean rooms and excellent in room facilities (safe, fridge, power adapter as standard). Satellite TV included english language channels. Air conditioning worked well (adjustable within room). Pros: Wifi internet worked in the room, Large bathroom (walk in shower) with good toiletries, staff were very attentive and helpful. Good location in central Tsim Sha Tsui (TST). Cons: No catering on site (but plenty of breakfast options nearby, including Delifrance on the corner), TST is a busy night time spot so expect some noise at night. Butterfly on Prat is one of three 'Butterfly' hotels in Hong Kong - I suspect they are all very similar, so if you are not sure on Tsim Sha Tsui as a location, definitely consider one of the other hotels (in Central).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrientalKyoko
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Butterfly on Prat for 6 nights and upgraded to a delux room on the 17th floor because I was told that the room was better and I would be less likely to be affected by street noise. The room was well equiped, very clean and had everything that I needed. Internet access was good quality and free but only via cable. There is free wifi in reception but you lose the signal after about the 6th floor. The hotel is in a great location and there is a great Thai/Vietnamese restaurant about 5 doors down if you turn left coming out the hotel. Good security in the hotel - no lift access without room key. Reception staff were great - couldn't have been more helpful and were great for directions/suggestions and general help. I would certainly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location but otherwise not great: unfriendly service and dirty”
Reviews.Author: starfruitsalad
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location Relatively big rooms Modern decor Macs with free internet at reception Cons: Reception staff always seemed really rushed and busy, and weren't that friendly No lounge or lobby area at all and no restaurant / coffee shop - there's literally nothing at the hotel besides the sleeping rooms. That makes is feel more like a upmarket hostel While the rooms seem to have been renovated relatively recently, the hotel felt a bit filthy already: dirty counters and a dead cockroach in the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Quality boutique hotel in TST”
Reviews.Author: feedmethai
Reviews.Content: Good location, helpful staff & clean comfortable room. Good shower & bathroom. No Wi-Fi in rooms but there is LAN. Wi-Fi is available in lobby along with 2 Apple computers. When I booked the room I requested a "feather free" room. All the bedding was duck/goose down. They didn't get the request or have never heard of such a thing. They had no other pillows or comforter...I just had to suffer thru the few nights. All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mommymomo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Prat Suite during transit and the spacious room was a delight for the night despite us having to wait a couple of hours for the check-in. The Prat experience was indeed unique as intended as everything was adequate and without fuss, perhaps a new kind of concept away from the usual hotel standards that the spouse is acquainted with his frequent stays in Ritz Carlton. There is no pillow selection but we were quickly offered creative solutions to the too-soft pillows. The location is just great for us - it is surrounded by food and shops. We are unsure if it will get too noisy over weekends though, since when we stayed over a Monday night we could hear croonings from the Neway karaoke next door. All in all, it was an interesting stay on the Prat for me.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cathea
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my 3 days at Butterfly on Prat. This was my first solo trip abroad, and I felt so safe and well-located in this hotel. The folks working the reception desk were welcoming and helpful, always answering my requests immediately and giving me good advice. The shower was wonderful, which is great because it was so hot outside that I ended up taking two or three showers a day. The bed was perfect, especially the four pillows, to the extent that I asked for purchasing information. I enjoyed three different National Geographic channels - in English! The hotel doesn't offer breakfast, a lobby area, a pool or extras, but the location is a breeze for public transportation, restaurants, shopping, and everything you could want. Even though the location is in the heart of the action, I didn't hear a thing in my room.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rhapsyblue
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel; very friendly and helpful staff. Room is small but well appointed. And the location is great, smack in middle of shopping, great street food, and steps from underground.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: popcorn_delight
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and we enjoyed it very much. We took the airport express and took the free shuttle bus K4 from Kowloon station to Park Hotel on Cameron Road since the shuttle bus do not stop in front of the hotel. Once get off from Park Hotel, walk back to Chatham Road South and turn right to Prat Avenue, they are on the left side of the road. Check in was a breeze, we were upgraded to deluxe room. Rooms have free bottled water and microwave, fridge. They have free internet inside the room. The shower room is spacious. Water in the shower is strong. Now for those who feel unease about the transparent glass, u can request it to be covered. Now the down side, i don't like the water basin, we find it too shallow, after washing your hand or brushing your teeth, the waters are all over the place. We were in the 9th floor and we can still hear noise in the street. So suggest to request for higher floor. Location wise, no complains, just 5 mins away from the TST station. We had our 1st meal at a local restaurant downstairs (a noodle shop at the corner of the street) which is very good. There a Mcdo too just few doors away.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Good Value in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: BostonEsan
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a little more over my stay at the Prat based on their feedback on TripAdvisor. What I can say about this property that it is excellent value for the money! I spent many hours looking for a well located hotel at a reasonable rate. This was the only property that I came across during my research. They are centrally located, comfortable rooms, well priced, clean and have friendly staff. However, they are missing the wow factor that I have come to enjoy at boutiques and this is why they didn't win me over. Next time I am back I will most likely try to book a stay at one of their sister properties that look like they have a little more flare.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, no views, dirty area”
Reviews.Author: AdventureLive
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, clean and modern. Prat Ave is busy and dirty but also handy to everything. My personal preference is something with a view in a cleaner area, I wouldnt stay again due to no view and I would prefer an nicer location (these are just personal preferences).

Reviews.Title: “Despite the street (Prat Ave) may looked like a mess, it is a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: is_madi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my trip (13 June - 17 June), and stayed in a deluxe room on the 17th floor of the hotel. (2 adults + 2 young kids). Initially, when the taxi drove into Prat Ave, it is a small lane with shops surrounding it. Frankly it may look intimidating. However, once you settled yourself into the hotel, it is a Safe and Convenient stretch of road. There are a 24hrs McD, Delifrance, convenience stores, a supermarket, little minutes away from MTR & shopping belts of Nathan Road etc etc.. When at night (we return back to hotel as late as 12am everynight after supper/coffee), it is a safe road to walk on even though there are pubs/ disco along the road. The "people there" didnt give a hood to us. There just mind their own business. To make it better, almost everytime you can see a group of policemen walking along/ stationed themselves along the road. The hotel staffs there are ever willing to spend an effort to help you, without a 2nd thought. For the hotel room, there is a free WIFI connection in the room, no password req'd. Or at least for the room I am staying. In the room, the shower is great and if you are concern about the glass window overlooking the toilet, just ask the staff and they will use a paper to cover over it. As easy as that. The microwave (very rarely avail for hotels) is a great help too, esp with kids around. I would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone..

Reviews.Title: “Not that great..if anything, it's the location”
Reviews.Author: miracle21
Reviews.Content: The location is really good...walkable to K-11 and tsimshatsui station...! Plenty of food around...size of room is ok for hk standards but my main grouse is...the bed's too soft for comfort, pillows are too flat..I ended up with a neckache after the first night! The lane is a tad messy...filled with bars and pakistanis that loiter around the hotel. Not the safest of all lanes to be I'd prefer Hotel Benito over Butterfly on Prat anytime!

Reviews.Title: “A value for money stay, but I'd consider elsewhere for my next visit”
Reviews.Author: Spacein
Reviews.Content: Stayed at butterfly on prat for 3 nights with friends in several deluxe rooms. Good: The location was in the middle of everything, though it's about a 7minute walk to the subway entrance. The room was clean and spacious (could open up a full sized luggage on the floor). Toiletries such as toothbrush, shower cap, soap shampoo and conditioner were provided. The room also had a microwave oven, hair dryer, LAN point and cable. Other than a tv and DVD player, they had a small iPod/iPhone dock with speakers, which was great as we didn't have to unpack any cables to charge our phones. Bad: We arrived at 10am was told our non-smoking rooms were not ready. We left our stuff in our friend's smoking room, and went out to return at 3. 1hr after the stated check-in time, our rooms still weren't ready. Since it was a short visit for us, the delay and return trip to the hotel just to find out we still can't check in, messed up our packed schedule for the day. By the time everyone else checked it, it was about 4pm. To make up for the service loss, they upgraded us from the superior to the delux room. Another gripe was the noise. After a whole day out, we couldn't sleep in past 9am. House keeping woke everyone in the group up between 8 and 9am. If you forgot to put the "do not disturb sign" on the door, good luck because they would be pounding on your door for a good 10minutes - multiple times. And if you did put the sign on your door, it's useless because not only can you hear house keeping pounding on everyone's door (I don't get it, it's not as if they tried opening the door after knocking for so long!), you will also hear the crew chatting with each other whilst cleaning across rooms, and thumping their cleaning gear against the walls. It's a pity that though the room was comfortable, we couldn't get any rest while in it as the insulation was very poor. Also, no wifi in the room. You see everyone huddled in the lobby tapping on to the wifi on their iPads and iphones. There LAN access points are already there, wiring wise it shldnt be too difficult to hook up wifi access on the floors! we really gotta thank our neighbor who set up a wifi hotspot in the room nxt to us on his laptop, and 'hokwong' jewelers that didn't encrypt their wifi ;) we also did our research on places to visit by visiting the m1bar nxt door, asking for the password, and surfed whilst sipping a beer. Overall the hotel was comfortable and the staff (especially the door man) was helpful when needed to be. But because of the poor sound insulation, I would have to say I would want to look for an alternative place to stay if I'm ever visiting hk again!

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Heart of Tsim Tsa Tsui”
Reviews.Author: Robbie_Francisco
Reviews.Content: My partner, best friend and I stayed at the deluxe room of this hotel facing Prat Avenue across Guangdong hotel. Although the staff was friendly, helpful and accommodating, the area can be a bit too wild and loud especially on Fridays. The bathroom was big and the beds were comfortable, but the noise outside was unbearable. You'd have to be extremely exhausted to be able to sleep even if you are staying on a high floor. We stayed on the 9th floor but the honking horns of the taxis and the drunken crowd outside made it difficult for a light sleeper such as myself to get good nights sleep. This no-frills hotel is perfect for those who want to walk around to shop, eat and drink on this side of Hong Kong. Two dizzying blocks away is the MTR and the harbor is an easy 8 minute stroll away. For the affordable rate and convenient location, this hotel is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: c12fish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back to NZ from Europe so were a bit over hotels by then, but this was clean, in a good location for restaurants, transport, shopping and sightseeing. I found the room a bit small for two adults with lots of luggage and it would have been great if the wifi worked in the room too. But it was great that there was free internet in the lobby, the staff were helpful when we asked them questions, and it's a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rahul_jain6
Reviews.Content: Butterfly in Hong Kong is at an excellent location - a 5 minutes walk from the Tsim Tsa Shui station. The staff is very courteous, free internet, great sized rooms, lovely bathrooms etc. The location for me was fantastic as everything was relatively close by. Many shops for snacks etc in the same street as the hotel. Overall, value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Breath of Fresh Air”
Reviews.Author: JennaandPatrick
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel with a really great location! What we liked about it was that it was very modern, they had free internet, great sized rooms, lovely bathrooms stocked everyday with new shampoo and conditioner etc. It was very very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful-upon arrival they upgraded our room to the deluxe room from a superior room which was a nice touch! The location for us was fantastic as everything was relatively close by. Many shops for snacks etc in the same street as the hotel. It was a bit noisy but nothing to worry about, I can imagine everywhere in Hong Kong to be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stopover”
Reviews.Author: The_TravellerSg
Reviews.Content: Having been to Hong Kong several times but never had the chance to stay here. Took advantage of the promotion and stayed here for 3 nights for a short break enroute from work. Location wise, would not consider the best as it is about 5-10 mins walk to Tsim Sha Tsui Station and the good point is that it is surrounded by good food stalls which is what I am in Hong Kong for..... Check in was efficient and fast and they do have bell boys to assist with the luggages despite being a boutique hotel. The only negative aspect I can find of this hotel is the KEY!!! Guess it has been a long while since I used a key to open a hotel room and the funny thing is that they do provide a card to activate the power supply in the room but no card key system, guess they should invest in one as it is trouble some to return the key to the reception everytime you go out and also you start to worry of dropping it when you are out with it!! Room wise as expected in all rooms in Hong Kong is small but comfortable, definitely not the smallest I have seen but I like it very much as it is clean and modern. The standing shower was good as it is spacious, in short, nothing that is lacking for this hotel in terms of the amenities! Even the in room fridge is huge enough though of course it is empty and the room also comes with a microwave oven, something most hotels do not provide with. Sound proofing wise is something that can be improved as you do hear some noise along the corridor and also outside of the hotel but is bearable. One minus point most travellers commented on was the lack of Wifi which is true but they do provide with LAN cable in the room which is good enough for me. In general, this hotel is highly recommended for tourist on shopping trips as it is near all the good spots and as usual, I can't wait to go back to Hong Kong again....

Reviews.Title: “Plus for the location”
Reviews.Author: topolnic
Reviews.Content: Spend 3 nights there in a superior room. The hotel is new and clean. Judging by the surroundings I was not expecting it to be that good. Rooms are modern / stylish and quite large. Lots of bars around so no need to worry about lack of breakfast in the hotel. As other wrote you are spoilt by the number of eateries and all going out options around. Very close to MTR and airport. Big plus for it!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidT08
Reviews.Content: Went with my spouse to HK for the second time and decided on Butterfly on Prat due to it's location. Unfortunately, I didn't quite manage to get a complimentary upgrade as other travellers have mentioned in their reviews. Apart from that, the hotel is pretty no-frills. The rooms were clean, and cosy (despite it being small) with a reasonably sized bathroom. Pillows were too soft for my comfort but my wife seemed to have no qualms about it. We had an unforunate incident where our door knob was damaged (and so were many others on the same floor) and had to get the handy-man to come fix it. We pretty much waited an hour for him to get it done which I felt could have been better handled. Plenty of restaurants around the hotel for you to grab a bite and the location is merely a 2min walk from TST MTR station. WIFI was only available at the lobby (which is a major inconvenience) and there are only two imacs for travellers to use. The staff spoke good english but when a crowd amasses, they seem to lose some composure due to the small space. Finally, given the price we paid (around USD90 via hotels.com), the location was superb but I would only return because my wife liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Debs076
Reviews.Content: Staying alone while on busines this hotel was a great location and walking distance to Nathan Street for shopping, restaurants and bars and also the waters edge to see the Hong Kong skyline in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a secret weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: Taipeiworldlywise
Reviews.Content: warning, if you are sharing the room, make sure its with someone you feel very comfortable with. the bathroom doors are clear. i booked online, it was easy and a fairly good price. stayed for two nights for a friend's birthday. it was a great location for my needs. the facilities were new and well maintained. i didn't really need the staff for anything but check in and check out was easy and smooth. didn't hear street noise. though the room was small, the bed was really comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean & modern, rooms quite large by HK standards”
Reviews.Author: Simon_and_Susan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a 'Superior room'. The hotel itself has very few facilities (no restaurant or bar), but right outside the hotel you are spoilt for choice of places to eat and drink. Our room was very comfortable and newly decorated, and quite large by Hong Kong standards. There was no problem from noise either, but then we were on the 13th floor! Overall if you want a centrally located, clean and modern hotel, but aren't bothered about things like a hotel bar or having breakfast in the hotel, then I'd definitely recommend the Butterfly.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: khitin
Reviews.Content: We had our family vacation last December 2009. Excellent hotel, very convenient to MTR, walking distance to famous mall, night markets, nathan road, restaurants and bus stations. You will have a spare time to go shopping at night after day tour :). Plus factors for microwaves, electric kettle, and lots of complimentary drinks in the hotel. Their staffs were also very accommodating and not strict with no. of pax.:)I always recommended this hotel, my friends and relatives really enjoyed their stay too... Negative: Bathrooms are see through/clear glass(doors) :( hallways are very narrow and smell cigarette smokes no wifi But still recommended this hotel for reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay - great location”
Reviews.Author: mars27
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking to Hong Kong and we decided to stay at Butterfly on Prat and are glad we did. We were upgraded on arrival, which seems to be a common theme according to previous reviews, without having to ask. Rooms are very clean and come with amenities such as shampoo, conditioner, toothbrush & paste, showercap and complimentary slippers. The room was a good size with a microwave and safe. Location was great, 5 min walk to TST MTR, Nathan Rd and then only a few more minutes to Canton Rd and Harbour City shopping centre. Close to some cheap great restaurants (see other reviews) which made it all the more convenient. We found the staff to be very friendly and informative.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel I would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: AnishaIndia
Reviews.Content: Its a small hotel on a busy street. The lobby is small but the staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms aren't too large, however, very modern and comfortable. The metro/tube station was walking distance and plenty of bars/pubs/stores around. The staff was extremely helpful- and yes english speaking!! Also, Tsim Sha Tsui is where one should stay when in Hong Kong!!

Reviews.Title: “SMALL BOUTIQUE...? MORE LIKE DIRTY HOSTEL....”
Reviews.Author: Sam1734
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 6 different hotels in Hong Kong over the past 3 years for work and pleasure and this was by far my worst experience. I booked the deluxe room and when I walked in the room forget the fact it was on the small side everything was dirty stains on the floor, drinking glasses dirty bathroom not cleaned, furniture all damaged and the towels thread bare. IT ws also VERY noisey as they do not have double glazing so you could hear everything from the busy street 24hrs of the day. I went down to reception after our first night and spoke to the manager. I took pictures on my phone of the dirt and grime and showed him the problem It was alarming to hear the reson for the room being so dirty was they are just 'too busy with bookings to keep the rooms so clean'. What is that supposed to mean...? He agreed to upgrade us to a suite which was very gladly accepted and I thought this would be the end of our problems. We entered the 'Suite'.... and it was bigger of course but exactly the same problems! FILTHY FILTHY FILTHY.... chipped furniture blah blah By the 3rd day in the suite it was clear that the so called cleaner had done absolutely nothing in the room apart from make the bed -literally...that was it so I called the manager to the room to show him in person at the grime. The Hotel is meant to be under 1 year old and the furniture in the rooms is already chipped and stained...towels old...and fillhy. The location was great however that was about it.... definately nothing Boutique about this place

Reviews.Title: “Super stay.....”
Reviews.Author: Amitlapasia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We were upgraded to a deluxe room on check in. Check in was also fast. The rooms were quire neat with very comfy pillows. There was some noise from the streets even though we were staying on the 13th floor. The microwave oven was of great help. overall very nice neat and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient to Nathan Road and markets”
Reviews.Author: ARIandAMANDA
Reviews.Content: Hotel was what we expected and read about on tripadvisor. No surprises. Boutique type small hotel with modern decor and bright foyer. Easy to find and well signed. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Spoke English. Always provided a map and marked where we needed to get to. Take a hotel card to assist the taxi driver get you back . 2 Macs available near reception. Subway was very close. Ladies market and Temple street night market are fairly close. Taxis are very cheap. We were first timers to Hong Kong, so the trip to the hotel from the Airport was daunting. However, we were put at ease as soon as we cleared immigration. There are Tourist kiosks with fluent english speaking staff. She was very helpful. A taxi was an option, but there was a fair at the expo, so it was suggested that we take the airport train to Kowloon station, then look for the aiport shuttle bus (free) which takes you to key hotels. Butterfly on Prat was around the corner to a drop of hotel, so it was very easy to find. Front desk desk were very helpful and friendly, even the cleaning staff acknowledged you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: Opieizz
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights based on the great reviews on trip advisor. We were not dissapointed and it lived up to the reviews. We were upgraded from a double room to a suite with balcony. It was excellent for us for we had our two little children with us. There was also a halal eatery on the sgame block so we managed to g etvt our daily meals there. We had good long strolls to the harbor. A good place to be based in within the tsim sha tsui area!

Reviews.Title: ““BUTTERFLY ON PRAT, YOU ARE NOT THERE YET !!!!!!””
Reviews.Author: wang49026
Reviews.Content: Fire alarm rings but no one answer my call to reception, and no one just proactively explain what was going on untill I ask for. AND THAT WAS A WRONG RING! I just can't imagine how can this hotel manage to handle any incident at all. I just lose my faith to be there again. The hotel is definitely not there yet for being a service provider!

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel for a very good price.”
Reviews.Author: RCrS
Reviews.Content: A funky hotel which has excellent delusions of being a boutique hostel. They dont quite pull if off but the rooms are great and the staff helpful. Excellent location and a fun place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Chic & Charming Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarkRevan
