Reviews.Content: Make sure you get the name of the hotel in Chinese our taxi driver from the airport didn't know where the place was but luckily the taxi supervisor/attendant at the airport did, it was only after checking in that the hotel gave us a card with the hotel name translated in Chinese. The fresh fragrance that deodorises the small & very trendy lobby (Elizabeth Arden's Green Tea??) is refreshing and slightly intoxicating. The lobby desk is always manned by staff and a doorman who's so reliable we must've only opened the hotel's front door a handful of times in six days. For our first 3 nights we stayed in a superior room which is adequate but small. There's an LCD TV with a small selection of English channels, a clock radio with Ipod integration, a DVD player, safe, microwave, fridge and kettle. The ironing board needs to be requested from the front desk. Shower is large and spacius, no bath though. We found the small glass window to the bathroom to be very unusual (it allows a view of the shower and toilet from the wardrobe end of the room). Make sure you ask for extra pillows as we found their pillows were so soft they provided no head or neck support whatsoever. The hotel was kind enough to upgrade us to a deluxe on our second round of 3 nights after we spent one night in Macau, the layout of room is the same as the superior but there's a good half-metre extra walking space around the bed and wardrobe corridor which made the room feel less cramped and let us pack\unpack our suitcases much easier. In-room Internet is provided free of charge via the LAN cable sadly there's no free WIFI. There are two Macs in the lobby providing free internet just beware they run Safari not IE or Firefox and you have to use them standing up. There's a small fitness room on the 5th floor with a treadmill, bike, rack of small weights, multi-exercise machine, LCD TV and stereo but note that there appears to be hotel rooms on that floor as well so keep the door closed if blasting up the stereo volume. The hotel is perfectly situated between the TST and East TST MTR stations with entraces to the sprawing underground subway to either station only a block away. There are countless shops, restaurants, bars, karaoke clubs all around the hotel though mainly to the west. The Avenue of Stars can be reached by walking south down Chatham road and over the garden footbridge that spans Salisbury road.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: naill
Reviews.Content: I expected the rooms to be small, but the room in this hotel was spacious, and the bathroom was a good size. I love the bedsheet, it was really lovely to sleep in. The only downside was the noise at night! We stayed over the weekend and on Friday or Sat night, you could hear people chatting taxi honking until early morning about 4am. The hotel room we stayed faced the main road. The location is great - lots of eating places, tons of shops etc within walking distance. My recommendation - stay in this hotel if you are given a room that doesn't face the main road. It would be great if they double glaze the windows. Free wi-fi is only at the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -good price for Hong Kong/Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Whadders
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews on I think that the overall consensus is correct a good hotel in a great location. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful and there always seemed to be at least three of them on reception. The room was clean and adequate in size and the price is good for Hong Kong/Kowloon. Best of all the location is great with restaurants, bars and shopping very close, it's also not far from Nathan Road or the Star Ferry piers. One tip is that if you get the Airport Express MTR and then use the free shuttle from Kowloon although it doesn't go directly to Butterfly it goes close enough to wheel the luggage around,

Reviews.Title: “BUTTERFLY ON PRAT, YOU ARE NOT THERE YET !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maxizumrudy
Reviews.Content: Fire alarm rings but no one answer my call to reception, and no one just proactively explain what was going on untill I ask for. AND THAT WAS A WRONG RING! I just can't imagine how can this hotel manage to handle any incident at all. I just lose my faith to be there again. The hotel is definitely not there yet for being a service provider!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Poor Poor Hotel, Guest life not safely”
Reviews.Author: PangYin
Reviews.Content: In the evening around 3:00 am, Fire alarm in the hotel, I call to Reception & Duty Manger, have result no answer or busy on line. I came down to Lobby, only one staff stay in counter, but she can't tell to me What Happen! In the evening, this hotel only one staff on duty, if some accident happen, how to protect the guest safely. I don’t unstained hotel stand in Hong Kong. How to protect the guest's life. Whole night I can't sleep for the above case, I suggest all customers don't booking this hotel. Very, Very, Very Poor

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheNewRoots
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place was perfect except for the location. If I had to do it again I would stay on Kowloon Island near Soho which is so quaint and adorable! That said, it is pricier over there so for the price, Butterfly wins! The rooms were so nice, clean and modern. I know some griped about the window in the bathroom but that really never bothered us. Our friends stayed in an identical room and had blinds on their bathroom window. As an American in February I was cold and had to ask for a space heater as their is no central heating (even though there was a thermostat on the wall). Also I didn't think the hair dryers provided were nearly powerful enough to get the job done quickly.....so maybe bring your own with a converter if you are concerned. So many little things that just add up to American comforts and while on vacation in Hong Kong this place was perfect! The staff was so friendly and helped us with places to eat and bars nearby the first night we were there. It was so close to transportation and cabs are so cheap we used them often. (correction we stayed on Kowloon, Hong Kong Island is the quaint area that is more expensive) Kowloon provides more Chinese culture. Butterfly on Prat was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in a good location, but not suitable for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Hokey78
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in March 2011. Make sure you know the exact address before getting into a cab, since taxi drivers in Hong Kong don't seem to know its exact location. Can't blame them, the place is pretty small and tucked into one of Tsim Sha Tsui's many small streets. Location was nice. The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from TST station, so it's convenient without being too busy, especially at night. We arrived at about 10pm, and despite booking way in advance, we were given a disabled- friendly room in a corner of the 8th floor. While I'm all for disabled access, this meant that our room had a shower that would go no more than shoulder height, and a tiny sink the size of a salad bowl at thigh height, with no vanity or anywhere else to put stuff. I don't know if this was the last room or if all rooms are like that (I hope not), but the staff should have at least checked with us before giving us the room, or informed us of this at the time of booking. This made an otherwise pleasant stay a little bit uncomfortable. Beds are also small, so if you are travelling with a child, make arrangements. 2 plus 1 just don't fit. On the plus side, staff were pleasant and proficient in English, and the place looks great. I would come back, but I'd sort out the disabled room issue ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ryanchangy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is decently priced and well located. Only a few minutes walk to Nathan Rd and the metro. On the metro it takes only minutes to get to central. The room wasn't large but larger than I was expecing for Hong Kong. Cleanliness could have been better but wasn't horrible. For example there were hairs all over the bathroom floor. That was probably the worst of it though. Overall a good place to stay if you don't want to kill your budget but have higher standards. The staff were friendly and helpful. No wifi but Internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in a clean, modern and comfortable hotel, close to all the action!”
Reviews.Author: ScottJM
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Butterfly Hotel. The room was quite small but it was incredibly clean, modern and provided real value for money. A small room is not unusual in Hong Kong. At check-in, everything was perfect and our room exceeded expectations with a little fridge and a microwave provided for you too. The hotel is based on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong and is a 10 minute slow walk to the waterfront where you can walk along to catch the ferry to the other side. It is also well placed for access to the fantastic underground system they have. Also around the hotel is a number of shops, restaurants and 7-Eleven's for the essentials. We recommend a Thai place round the corner for a great meal!!! All in all, thoroughly recommend this hotel. Will stay here again in future HK visits.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hidden Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Robbiespierre
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel with my girlfriend after I read horrid reviews about the first hotel I booked, and as it turned out, that spur of the moment decision would pay off very well. I got to Hong Kong ahead of my girlfriend. I immediately went to the hotel to check in my things. I also requested that they put in the room a little present I bought for her for our anniversary. Then I went to pick her up from the airport. When we returned for the check-in, not only did they accommodate my special request earlier, they even gave us a free room upgrade without us even asking! The check-in was very efficient. The reception team was very friendly, approachable and helpful. The lobby had a relaxing atmosphere that put ke right at home. The room was a lot biggest than I expected. The design was conducive to relaxation. There was a nice flat screen TV, a microwave oven, a water heater for coffee. The bathroom was also spacious and well-designed. The room was definitely beyond what I expected for a hotel of it's price range. The location was also very good. It was close enough to the train station, the shopping malls along Nathan Road and Canton Road, and good variety of restaurants. Overall, I am very happy with my stay at Butterly on Prat. Just two things I wish it had: wifi in the rooms and thicker curtains to block out the lights from outside and from the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in a most convenient location”
Reviews.Author: inecekvar
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my 7 night stay in HK based on the reviews here, location, and value. It didn't disppoint on any count. Three emails I wrote before arriving were answered immediately(2 other hotels I was considering lost out because they never bothered to answer the emails, bad sign in my opinion). My request for a room on a high floor was honored. Checking-in was fast and the front desk staff was uniformly efficient, polite, and always smiling on all shifts throughout the whole stay. The room was modern, clean, and a good size although it could do with a more comfortable chair at the work desk besides the hard wood one that is there. There is plenty of storage space as well as many drawers. A full size microwave and a small fridge, instead of a mini bar, are welcomed amenities. There is a Circle K and & Eleven down the street to stock up on milk, yogurt, etc. to have for breakfast or in the middle of the night. There is an in-room safe but not laptop-size. The bed was comfortable. Bathroom a good size. I didn't like the design of the bowl-like sink that is hard to wash your hands without getting the surroundings all wet. Amenities include soap, shampoo, conditioner, bath foam, toothbrush and toothpaste, shower cap. Two bottles of water are provided everyday free of charge. there is a tea/coffee kettle in the room as well as free internet with DSL cable provided. The internet always worked well. I didn't visited the adjoining restaurant but breakfast is not included. The gym is very small but it is open 24 hours and it does have a treadmill a bike, some weights. Enough for anyone who wants to maintain a fitness routine while on vacation. I found the hotel's location perfect for me. I was able to walk most places and there are several entrances to the MTR station. Plenty of restaurants and shopping options within a few minutes walk. If you arrive by the airport express to Kowloon station there is a free shuttle # K4 but it drops you off at the Park Hotel one street over. The walk is only a few minutes but depends on the amount of luggage you have. I didn't mind on the way in, but since I had extra luggage on departure I opted to take a taxi to Kowloon station which was only 37 HK dollars. I will most likely stay at this hotel again next year when I return to HK. My only complaints are the hard wooden chair at the work desk in the room; the safe that's not lap-top size; and the lack of a decent view from the room but maybe that was just my room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cathygogo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in butterfly during early feb, I booked a superior room for a pretty nice rate, and I was luckily being upgraded to a deluxe room! I've stayed in various HK hotels before and the room are usually small, butterfly was no exception but the. y have wisely utilized the room space, very comfortable setting n spacuous feeling, it got a gorgeous view through the window to the HK racecourse. If you are looking for a hotel with good value and comfortable design, its your choice

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location....”
Reviews.Author: Kordobachi
Reviews.Content: It was a quick walk from the mtr to our hotel upon arrival (free airport shuttles are within 2 mins. away). We arrived around 10am but our rooms were not ready yet so we left our bags and took a quick stroll around the block. Lots of places to eat very nearby. We returned around 11am to get a jacket from our luggage and to our surprise our room was ready (lucky ^_^). The room was nice and clean albeit the bed is a little small if you plan to stay with someone other than your partner. The bathroom was clean and everything was in order. The internet service was adequate and only slowed down occasionally. The room had a nice lcd tv although there weren't much channels to watch (though we really didn't plan to watch that much). The microwave in room was a plus, could heat up food late at night like food I bought from causeway bay. The staff was super helpful, instead of using the internet to check for attractions and routes to take, just ask the friendly people at the front desk the always have maps ready to draw up the best route to take. They even can suggest spas and reflexology places nearby, though a bit more expensive it is a welcome suggestion (can't put a price on peace of mind). The location is just tops. We could do our shopping and return to leave what we purchased at the hotel rather than lugging it around all day. Overall one of the better visits I have had to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sakon_m
Reviews.Content: Sorry a bit late to review this hotel but overall very impress with the service, the price, and the location. The hotel located right in the central of Tsim Sha Shui, 5 mins walk to MRT and many shops. Room is clean and new, size is what you expect in Hong Kong. We got the room on the higher floor so there was no problem with the noise on the street. Love to come out and grab a bites along the street, very delicious. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A package of great value, service and location..”
Reviews.Author: TravelChicPh
Reviews.Content: This is so far the best hotel in Hongkong- it exceeded my expectations! Butterfly on Prat Hotel is located right in the heart of Kowloon, surrounded by MRTs, so it was accessible and easier for us to go back to the hotel without worries when our feet got too tired from whole day of walking. It is surrounded by shops and restaurants, and a Wellcome Convenient store is just nearby. The hotel caters a superb customer service with a smile Ü (we were politely and courteously welcomed by the staff when we arrived exhausted from our trip due to delayed flight). From the very first time we entered 'til we checked out, we noticed this sweet smelling scent, this signature scent that lingers.... We stayed in the 13th/f of Butterfly on Prat for 4 nights, fortunately we had a good night sleep, not bothered by any noise from a nearby disco pub (lucky "us"). The very clean-tidy hotel rooms were quite big compared to other hotels in Hongkong ( we got 2 deluxe rooms as we're a family of 5)..and oh! by the way I love the rain showers! I just hope they would install blinds or something that would cover the glass bathroom walls for privacy to those who are not couples. Every morning, rooms were cleaned, bottled water served with the toiletries, and with new beddings and towels. And, an added bonus is the microwave oven in each room, so we were able to bring Subway sandwiches and noodles for midnight snacks and heated some left-overs for breakfast! To sum up, this is a great value hotel just worth the price range and i would definitely come back and recommend it to my friends. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: emmainsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers good value for money, for Hong Kong. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms and bathrooms spotlessly clean. The rooms are small, but comparable to those you find elsewhere for this kind of price in Hong Kong or other big cities. The beds are comfy with great linen and crisp sheets. It has a funky reception, with free intenet access. There's not much of a view, with rooms on both sides of the hotel facing directly onto other big buildings on the other side of the roads. The location is also good, very close to Nathan Rd and all the shops, and walking distance to the Avenue of Stars to view the spectaular Hong Kong skyline. My only negative point was the noise from the street at night, which could be heard in our room even 16 floors up. Granted, I was suffering from jetlag, so struggling to sleep, but some earplugs are useful if you are a light sleeper. Also, the rooms don't have heating and so are very cold in winter (I had onlt been to Hong Kong before when it was sweltering hot so hadn;t imagined how cold it could get), but the managment immediately put a heater in our room on request and it was toasty in no time. There is no restuarant in the hotel, so breakfast and room service is not available, but there are loads of foodie places and restaurants nearby, so this wasn't an issue. This was a good little hotel and hte only reason I haven't marked it higher is that we stayed in several other hotels on our travels which provided more facilities ( swimming pool, restaurants, massage etc) on site.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the Price in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: TwoGuysCalgary
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in this price range. Very modern and clean rooms, with up dated bathrooms and great bedding. The rooms are small but very well designed and for Hong Kong the rooms are wonderful. The location cannot be beat in Kowloon and you are in walking distance to everything Hong Kong has to offer. Great hotel and I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “if not for street noise would have rated this Hotel very good”
Reviews.Author: leopoldmelborne
Reviews.Content: nice boutique hotel in Kowloon which is very good value for money. Unfortunately endless street noise at night even in winter means getting a full nights sleep is almost impossible without good earplugs or plenty of alcohol. OK sized rooms (For Hong Kong) and staff very helpful. Cannot quite see how it gets best of rating but I suspect for the price.Many business travellers and backpackers. Next time I think I would find something on Hong Kong Island.

Reviews.Title: “They KNOW what Service is about!! HOME AWAY FROM HOME!”
Reviews.Author: DangerousDD
Reviews.Content: Ok so i was not SURE i believed the reviews BUT they were TRUE. What a nice place. THe lobby is fun I dont know why people said it was small. IT's not large but it's fine. A couple iMacs there in a corner...it's cozy. The room was as excepted for hong kong. Not large but larger then most. The shower was nice. Ok now the important part. THE STAFF WAS WONDERFUL! I never missed receiving a SMALL even at 5am. Even the young door guy, JAY, was always helpful and friendly offering tips. They all did. Tips or travel, massage locations, food etc. You know how a nasty person can ruin ur stay at the best hotels? Well these people MAKE ur stay! They all speak great english, are friendly, and will do ANYTHING u can imagine to make ur stay feel warm. Thanks for making our stay so nice! The street is hoping, it's a great area. The train stop is right there at end of street. And on the corner u will find a sort of outdoor street food place. TRY IT, the good was good and cheap. Really nice to grab and go back to the hotel at 2am. So this was a great location. Went to many markets, and shopping. I cant say enough about our stay. There were no CONs. I also felt the price was very fair. Book in advance to get a good rate. I saw it really went up on fri/sat because it's a great night life area, and it's a kind romantic place. Only minor other CON is the free internet in the room does require u to log back in sometimes at what seemed to be odd times like 6am. So if u were leaving ur voip phone connected u would be disconnected without knowing while you slept. FREE INTERNET IN ROOM is a GREAT touch for those of us needing to be connected for work, or look things up. There is also wifi I think in lobby but I didnt know till later. You will not be sorry with your stay here. And be nice to the staff! Karma Karma :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chung1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and within a 3 min walk to the TST MTR. Lots of nice restaurants around it. It is also only a 2 min walk to the Airport Express bus stop at Park Hotel.. The lobby is very small but it is modern and nice. Most imporatntly, staff staff were simply great. They were helpful and warm. There is also a very nice smell at the lobby. The complimentary internet access in the room comes in handy. The deluxe room I stayed in was big by HK standards but it was not much bigger than the superior room., so I think I will just go for the superior room if I stay there again. The cleanliness was impeccable. The only thing that I did not like was the curtains in the rooms. The currains were not opaque and the morning sun light shines directly into your room everyy am. This should not be a problem if you tend to get up early. Hope that they can improve on this. Overall, a good and comfortable stay. However, please do note that there were no facilities like fitness centre, swimming pool, etc. This is just a no frills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: janualin
Reviews.Content: the staff of butterfly is helpful and appreciated for their help when i seek for 24hrs clinic in the midnight. i love the fragrance of the lobby and it made me feel comfortable everytime i step in to the lobby. It located at the heart of TST and walking distance to several tourist attraction. However i could hear the noise from main road in the midnight although we had stayed in 17th floor. if could have wi fi in the room would be better

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: S0212
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Butterfly on Prat. Location was perfect and staff was wonderful, always very attentive and helpful. The room was very comfortable and quiet. The bathroom was spacious and spotless. We really enjoyed our stay, and highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: tanyaf85
Reviews.Content: nice hotel: clean, helpful staff (Monday recommended a great dim sum restaurant down the street), comfortable beds, convenient location, free internet in lobby. my only complaint was the noise from the street. I can't remember the floor we stayed on (10th?) but we were quite high up in the building and it sounded like the action was right outside our window.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Irena44
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel twice, both times got a very good rate on the internet. First time, we stayed in deluxe room and it was perfect - nicely decorated, big, airy, with DVD and tea&coffee facilities. Bathroom was big and spotless clean. The window overlooked at another building and in the night we could hear noises from the street and clubs below - but it wasn't very disturbing and we didn't mind. Next time we stayed in a regular room - it was much smaller, but still big enough, with shower instead of a bath tub. The only things to complain about were glass door and wall between the room and the bathroom...this was very strange and felt like having no privacy in the bathroom. We loved the location of the hotel - close to MTR and within the walking distance to the Avenue of Stars and shopping. No breakfast is served there but with Starbucks and other cafes around the corner this was not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Boutique Hotel in Middle of Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: travelfacets
Reviews.Content: After spending one week at a companion hotel, Butterfly on Wellington, stayed at this first of the three current Hong Kong Butterfly hotels. The hotel is around 3 years old, but not showing the wear very much. The staff is very helpful and wanting to ensure guest comfort and support. The location of the hotel is excellent, in the midst of busy Kowloon. There are plenty of eating locations nearby - within walking distance. There are also many stores and public transportation easily accessed from the hotel. The rooms are nicely appointed with good quality fixtures and very comfortable. Having experienced two of their hotels now, I can say that the Butterfly group of hotels are very comfortable and a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Near perfect location on Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: mark_SydNSW
Reviews.Content: Our group (3 people in 3 rooms) stayed here 8 nights and didn’t have any gripes. All front desk staff spoke English and were very helpful. There are complimentary PCs in the lobby and internet access by cable is available in the rooms. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant (Al Dente) one night and the food and service were excellent. The main reason for selecting this hotel was the location and it didn’t disappoint - close to an MTR station; you can walk down to the Avenue of Stars to see the light show at night; buses run down Chatham Road at the end of the block (good for a trip to Stanley); the Museum of History (highly recommended) is only a couple of blocks away; the ferry piers are a 10 minute walk; the Airport Express shuttle to Kowloon station has a stop on the next block; you can either walk or MTR to the Temple St & various Mongkok markets. There are also a large number of eateries within a few blocks. I had Chinese breakfasts at a shop a few doors down the street for about $A3 – there were enough options on the menu to have a different choice each day. If you prefer a Western breakfast Delifrance and McD are at the ends of the block.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: charleyandtonia
Reviews.Content: a nice modern hotel with a fantastic location - only a few minutes walk from Nathan Road and the Star Ferry. Room was spacious and clean - lovely comfortable bed. Bathroom was good - only negative was that it had a glass door so I wouldn't share a room with someone you didn't already "really" know. Apart from that we were very happy with out stay and would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: markwriter
Reviews.Content: We found the staff at Butterfly on Prat were very helpful. I 'lost' my wallet while on the metro. Immediately they rang the station, and after we had left HK they collected the found wallet, and sent it to me in Australia at no charge. Throughout our stay they were very friendly. Comfortable rooms with cute decor. Very handy location. The rooms at the rear are quieter, as the street has several bars.

Reviews.Title: “Price fluctuates, but a very good hotel in the middle of great young shopping!”
Reviews.Author: stephanieahensley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice for the price! The rooms are clean and modern. The best feature of this hotel for me is the location. Great shopping for trendy clothes only 2 blocks away on Granville Ave and Cameron. If you do stay at Butterfly on Prat, I would recommend Ebeneezer's (right down Prat St. on the same side as the hotel) for great Middle Eastern food, and Granville Identity for gifts and Rise Commercial building for great trendy clothing and accessories shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value--but no heat!”
Reviews.Author: Charlie Sierra
Reviews.Content: This highly rated hotel, located in the southern part of Kowloon Island within walking distance of museums, ferries, shopping, and entertainment of all kinds, did not make a good first impression. We arrived in 50 degree weather, checked in, and unpacked in our 7th floor room while we waited for the heat to warm up the room. After 15 minutes or so, with the thermostat turned to 30° Centigrade, we called to see what was wrong with the heating system. The desk clerk informed us that there was no heating system; the hotel only has an air conditioning system. After the initial offer of a couple of blankets was rejected, we were offered an electric space heater that could be plugged into the wall outlet. This solved the problem--but management should, in cold weather, point out that there is no heating system and offer the space heater upon checking in. If you arrive in warmer weather, you can expect a conveniently located hotel with an exercise facility, in room microwave and mini fridge at a very reasonable price and a very friendly staff. Rooms have direct Internet access with the cable provided, plus a hair dryer and all the normal toiletries and then some. We recommend you try an upper floor to escape the noise that emanates from the nearby bars, and be sure and get a receipt from your cab if you choose that route from the airport. We didn’t read the guide book closely on our two night stay, and were ripped off to the tune of $444 HKD coming in, as opposed to about $240 going out. Don’t let a dishonest cabbie fool you even once; the desk clerk urges a report to the cab company, but we didn’t get a receipt and didn’t write down the cab number. This is a reflection on our neglect rather than the hotel. We can recommend it highly, but beware in cold weather.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCJULIA
Reviews.Content: Great value and very good location hotel. The room was nice but cold, no heating in the room, but heater was brought immediately. Small and uncomfortable lobby. free internet so no complaints there. Stayed only 1 night but would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing!”
Reviews.Author: TDR085
Reviews.Content: Small room, very clean, very nice staff, nice bathroom. But I can't believe no one has mentioned the fact that there is NO central heating! I woke up freezing in the middle of the night, called downstairs to find out why the room was so cold (it's in the 50s fahrenheit in Hong Kong right now.) They sent up a blanket. There is no way to adjust the heat in the room -- all they have is air conditioning. I really recommend staying somewhere else if you are in Hong Kong when temperatures are in the 40s and 50s.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel Choice for Exploring Kowloon & HK Island!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bette M
Reviews.Content: We travel rather extensively and are picky and frugal about our hotels. We were more than pleased with Butterfly On Prat for our visit to Hong Kong. We found the room to be in very good condition, nice size (not huge, but not too small), comfy bed and good shower. The location is great. Very near the metro, Nathan Road, lots of options for local food (good congee and noodle shops nearby). The staff were pleasant enough for our needs and interactions. Two computers in the lobby for complimentary use. We stayed over Christmas week, but got a good rate by booking well in advance. Certain the rates are even more frugal travel friendly during off peak seasons. It is not a hotel where one relaxes poolside or in a lobby lounge. So, if you are seeking hotel environment with pool, spa, lounges, etc. This is not what you want. If you are in Hong Kong to see the sights and dine out at night then it is perfect. We did not have breakfast included, but never found it to be a problem. With the savings on our room rate we enjoyed wonderful breakfasts at the very nearby Mira & Langham hotels. This even made it possible to start the day with a double espresso with very nice buffet breakfasts. Clean, modern, affordable and very well located. A very good hotel choice for exploring Kowloon and HK Island (easy walk to the ferry terminal too).

Reviews.Title: “Stinky toilet, weird bathroom set up but nice staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaSommers
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give this hotel a higher rating because one can see that the staff are trying quite hard to please but I can't. First of all, we checked out early from Anne Black (see my other review for the complete story) and moved in here earlier than booked (on booking.com) and they were helpful though the direct rate was 10% higher. For the first night, we stayed in a double room - it wasn't very convenient cause I was travelling with my young son. For double rooms, the bathroom is completely transparent. With other hotels like Novotel which use the same concept, there's always this option for one to so called "lower the blinds" but this one can't!! The next day, they asked us to pack early and moved all our luggage to a twin room while we were out. It was nicely done, and like I said, the staff were great! In both rooms though, there was this strong stench from the toilet bowl and the draining holes in the shower. At first, I thought it was from my son's smelly socks but we confirmed later that it was from those places. On the last night, we shared this with the front desk and they sent in someone to do the spraying but the smell returned in 20 mins. In addition, though we were on non-smoking floors on both occasions, we could smell smoke all the time, waking up with dry throats and coughs. On sharing this with a local friend, he told me that the drains in Prat Avenue and Hart Avenue have always been smelly. It's not just my hotel. On one of the nights, we ate at the restaurant next to the hotel - Al Dente (excellent food by the way and very good price, amazing!), we got the same smell coming from the hallway leading to the kitchen!!! So, my conclusion is that - this is not the hotel's fault, it's a problem of the area. The location is wonderful, the streets in the neighbourhood are lined with pubs, restaurants, convenience stores, new malls and whatever else you can think of, it's wonderful if you don't mind the smell!! I also have the feeling that this Butterfly hotel is not built to last - cheap bathroom doors and furniture. In 2 years, you might not want to stay here anymore...

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but can be expensive for the level”
Reviews.Author: popoaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: i stay for my 1st time the room was quite nice only problem too cold air conditional and my room had no access to the window. as well no BF they don't have any restaurant but in HK yu can find cheep food every were any time.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: lah0
Reviews.Content: We went to visit our son in college over the Christmas break and this was centrally located to everything including the MTR. The hotel was very nice and reasonable for the area. I would have to say the queen bed was great and the decorations were trendy. The staff was always very helpful. I made reservations on line and the whole trip when very smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, great name!!”
Reviews.Author: Bongo_Craigy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It's right in the centre of Kowloon, perhaps a little noisy at night but we were a bit jet-lagged so it didn't bother us. There are many bars, clubs, restaurants and shops very close by and it's a short walk to the Star Ferry for Hong Kong Island. The room was very nice - and orange and perfect for our short stay. And I really liked the huge shower cubicle and the toiletries which were replaced every day.

Reviews.Title: “My 3rd hotel stay in Hong Kong and definitely the best!”
Reviews.Author: tasiwaffle
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, excellent service and great coffee house down the road! Close to Nathan Rd and walking distance to Star Ferry with some nice places to eat nearby. I was fortunate to get a top floor room and didn't notice any street noise. The only negative I could find was the air-con was left on freezing after daily room servicing, but easier enough to adjust back to a comfortable temp. My accommodation included free internet which was quick and very easy to connect with.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Rooms look exactly like what you see in photos on their website.”
Reviews.Author: controlalt
Reviews.Content: Short walk to the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station. Great location! Reall nice-looking rooms. Also very clean and still new-looking. Good linens and towels. Comfy bed. Very clean and modern bathroom. Amenities include a very useful microwave for breakfast. Curtains include a black-out one for sleeping and a thin one for more light. Small room but enough space to move around comfortably. Good service, fast, warm and efficient. Good value. Cheap for Hong Kong prices. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with a great service”
Reviews.Author: hawick
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights with Butterfly on Prat recently, what left a great impression was the friendly front desk service that greeted us whenever we return to the hotel. Having stayed in 2 other hotels in HK before, Butterfly does look boutique to me. With its trendy lobby, though small, but it still look stylish. Though there were some hiccups during check in, due to the confusion from the booking system (when booking), but the friendly night shift staff was efficient and friendly enough to make sure that we can check into our room as soon as possible. The twin bedded room i stayed was pretty big, consider the unique small space in most HK hotels. There is in-room internet connect (via Lan cable) and free WIFI at lobby only, thus usually i will sit in the lobby to check my emails on my mobile. That was when i will ask the front desk staff where and how to go to the destination i'd planned. The front desk staff was friendly and kind enough to google for me the location and direct me to the place. The bed was pretty tough, some may not like it but still ok for me. But the pillow is way too soft and i did had some uncomfortable nights with the soft pillows. Location wise Butterfly is located 5mins walk from Tsim Sha Tsui MTR exit A2, along the walk there were lots of shops and bars so i don't feel the walk that boring. For someone who had travelled quite a fair bit and stayed in hotels from 2-5 stars, i find that butterfly is worth staying and I do wish to come back again for the great service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Butterfly on prat is an average hotel. but what makes it wonderful is the location!”
Reviews.Author: kim0404
Reviews.Content: We got here by 10pm from HKIA after a very tiring and long journey(8 hours for my hubby and 13 hours for me so you could imagine) and guess what, when we were in the lobby the bellhop didn't even took our big heavy bags! the check in was fast though but done without a smile on that dudes face. we feel like we are not welcome. the lobby has a cute, artistic designs to it, even the lift. you'll see orange and purple there.the check in counter is quiet small so it gets crowded sometimes. Anyways we got a deluxe room: The bed was nice and comfortable, very toned down colors like chocolate brown is the theme of the room. the bathroom is spacious enough and we have a microwave to cook those stuff that you get in 7 eleven or circle K. all in all the room was clean, not so big but enough for two people to move about. nice closet with many hangers to hang clothes in. This hotel lacks amenities like a pool or gym. we havent really got to explore the whole hotel. BUT: The location is just awesome. you would never get hungry here even in the middle of the night. Just walking distance is burger king and in front of it is a KFC and beside that is a a mcdonalds. 7 eleven is practically everywhere including circle k. and if you enjoy indian food with reasonable prices try ebeneezers just a few steps away from butterfly and it is open from 11am-5am.. there are some restaurants as well but we didn't try them. If you are in to bars there are a lot to choose from. From posh to casual hangouts its all just walking distance. Walk some more and you will be in that electronic street.. forgot whats its called, where theres sony, canon shops etc. check the map to get to the avenue of stars just by walking. it's really not that far.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: retiredandtraveling
Reviews.Content: We were 7 adults, 4 rooms. Everyone was happy with the choice of hotel. We had hired a private van from the airport (it was cheaper than 7 train fares!). Our rooms were somewhat small, but clean and quiet. We had asked for a rear rooms to ensure no street noise. The shower pressure was great! The glass-type doors to the bathroom were a non-issue for us as it mostly faced the hallway, not the bedroom area. Reception area is small, but fully staffed and helpful. We ate breakfast at the Deli France across the street. Location is great - an easy walk to Nathan Rd. Lots of restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Superb modern hotel, with the heart of Hong Kong at your front door”
Reviews.Author: need_a_h0liday_n0w
Reviews.Content: Wonderful and courteous staff, always willing to personally help whether asked, or not! We stayed in a deluxe room, but it was on a low floor, next to a really bad karaoke bar. Was a bit noisy until early morning due to this, but this was the only issue we had. Close to shops, MTR, food, everything you could want from HK. Great base to bring your shopping back, check your internet on their cool macs. In-room WiFi would have been perfect. Rooms are very modern and spacious, will be back next time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean hotel, situated in the heart of Kowloon.”
Reviews.Author: bandet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night en route Saigon/Vancouver and just loved it. It was spotlessly clean, the staff were pleasant, efficient and helpful and the location was just super, right in the middle of a very 'happening' area. The room, while not overly large, was adequate and the bed was very comfortable. I would highly recommend it. To get to the hotel from the airport, take the express train into Kowloon Station (140 HK$ for two people each way), catch the K4 free shuttle to the Park Hotel (first stop), walk back in the direction the shuttle came from, take a right, then another right onto Prat and the hotel is on your left.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: puaroger
Reviews.Content: Special Thanks to: Emma Chan (Reservation Officer) & Jacqueline Chan (Sales Manager) As stated, the room provides: Free High speed broadband internet access ,Branded mattress & quality bed towels Stylish bathroom amenities & quality towels ,Spacious wardrobe, Electronic safe, Hair dryer, LCD TV with satellite & cable channels, DVD Player , IDD and voicemail , Microwave oven Electric kettle , Refrigerator, Large cabinets for storage, Central air-conditioning with individual control . Pros: Comfortable Bed, Cozy Room, Friendly & helpful & Friendly staffs (Very Efficient), good location with shopping mall, convenience stalls, cafe, Delifrance, Pubs. Cons: Pillows are too soft. Overall, its a very nice place to stay and it's just short distance away from Tsim Sha Shui MTR station. Thumb Up!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Scent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lesnsal
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with the smell of the hotel. It smells like Elizabeth Arden's green tea perfume. I even bought the perfume at the perfumery near the hotel. They were really helpful to me and for this price, its one of the best in Hk. Even though the room was not that spacious, it suits all my needs. They don't offer breakfast, but the room has a microwave. So what we do is, we buy food the night before, put it in the ref and heat it up in the morning. That's what you call breakfast in bed! :) Has lots of shops and restaurant on the way to the hotel We always get out from A2 or D2 from the mtr station to the hotel. Its just a couple of minutes walk. Overall, the hotel is one of the best in HK

Reviews.Title: “best hotel on hong kong I suppose...”
Reviews.Author: petcal007
Reviews.Content: I went severals times to HKG but I can tell in regards to the price you pay, this is one of the best hotel i ever stayed.The aera is very exciting, a lot of thing to do, restaurants and shops.You have shuttle who bring you directly to the airport for free.Rooms are extremely modern, access to wifi for free...excellent!

Reviews.Title: “as advertised”
Reviews.Author: RodneyBD
Reviews.Content: great location in Kowloon, super helpful staff, smallish room, which is normal for Hong Kong, but great layout with efficient built in desk and drawers with counter space and good closet space. best part: bathroom was fairly roomy, no problem for dad, mom and baby (and as americans we are used to large bathrooms!). Staff very nice and helpful. one note: we didn't love Kowloon, way to touristy, next time we'll try the butterfly on hong kong island..

Reviews.Title: “Great location and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Rosemaree
Reviews.Content: I stayed at BF on Prat for a total of 8 nights. The overall feeling of the hotel is modern and clean. Great location for shopping and eating options and very helpful staff. A special thanks to "Monday" who was working on reception the night I arrived. On arrival at the hotel, I found I had left my laptop on the K4 bus! Monday kindly phoned the bus company and within an hour I had picked it up from Kowloon Rail Station Lost Property Dept.....just goes to show how honest people in HK can be!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Gorby
Reviews.Content: The location is great - it's 2 blocks away from Granville where women can get the most out of their shopping money while taking home great fashion finds at a cheap, if not reasonable price. There are restaurants just a few steps away - Japanese, Italian (just outside the lobby - good food and you get 10% discount if you're billeted in Butterfly!) and of course, Chinese (don't be afraid to try the Chinese restaurants. Even if they don't speak English, there are pictures in the menu that you could point to). We stayed on the 18th floor in a superior room which was a good sized room with enough walking space with our luggage. However, since we had an extra bed set-up, walking space was a bit cramped. Also, the bathroom doesn't have any privacy since it is constructed with some glass and not solid walls. Nevertheless the room is designed nicely. The refrigerator is empty which we appreciated because we were able to fill it up with what we wanted. There is no shortage here of nightlife. Bars are found all around which makes for a good location to stay if you intend to party out once in a while. Although the location is good, it can get a bit noisy at night. But then, if you're tired from shopping all day, maybe the noise won't make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: iworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: This place has everything you need to stay in Hong Kong. Highly recommended hotel, but a few thing you need to know. First thing is that the lobby has a strong perfume smell when you enter, but didn't bother me at all. Secondly, the bathroom door is sliding window, unless your staying with your partner, you will see each other butt naked when you take a shower or taking a dump. There is also a see through window next to the bed into the showers, so it will be quite awkward while you're using the toilet or bathing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. fancy interiors would love to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Fran1510
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located is within walking distance to Tsim Sha Tsui shopping district. Breafast was ok, I was very much satisfied already :) ahahha I love the smell of the lobby, smells like Elizabeth Arden's Green Tea perfume . One comment though. The washroom have see through glass walls, kinda awkward. Good thing I was sharing a room with my sister.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best stays in HK”
Reviews.Author: vicksMumbai
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, small but very clean from the beautiful franganance in the loby to the clean room everything was very good, Good service. a sure recomandation for travellers to HK. located very well lots of bars around the area shopping a few mins away. Its a small hotel with decent size rooms but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “interesting hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: viral236
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is perfect as its right on the city's most lively street... it is a tall building and hence on the top floors theres no noise.. the whole property is very clean and tidy.. the ambience is trendy and feels fresh.. the rooms arnt huge but are comfortable.. the most interesting part in the hotel was that the bathrooms are quite visible and hence theres no privacy in the room.. hence very suitable for honeymoon couples.. there is no breakfast and also the staff members are not up to the mark.. but the whole experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tinetan168
Reviews.Content: Very trendy design hotel, their interior decorator did a very good job, i liked the fact that the small room did not feel cramped at all. Free wired internet, wire is provided in all rooms. Wifi and 2 laptops are available at the lobby for guest use. We also loved the fact that the elevators were so fast, we never had to wait more than 3 minutes to get to our room. Service is excellent, the front desk staff seems eager to please. I do hope they install black-out drapes in the room, sometimes the curtains were not enough. The door locks and the keys were a little problematic at first, but once you get the hang of it, it gets easier to open the door. The mtr station is about a 6-8 minute walk, not exactly the nearest but good enough. Great little hotel, will definitely recommend! Definitely merits the Trendy Hotel award! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for citytrip”
Reviews.Author: SpongeRob
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at Butterfly in October. Hotel situated near Nathan Road, in a street with some bars and restaurants. Many things to do in walking distance (walk to Star Ferry only 15 mins). Hotel lobby small but very clean, friendly welcome (at 22:00 pm) by all the staff, and luggage brought to our rooms. We booked a superior room which are on the lower floors starting at 6th. We got room 608 which appeared to be a room for disabled people, so the bathroom was different and adapted, and had a smaller wash basin. But no problems for us at all. Room very clean, bed very good, flatscreen, and the roomsize is big enough. The room was at the back of the hotel away from the street, but at friday evening we heared a little bit the music from the bars. If you want a fully quiet room, ask for one at a higher floor, it didn't bother us. Only downside: no wifi in the room, and only 1 laptop for internet in the lobby. Great hotel for a trip to Hong Kong: central, clean and modern rooms; we would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sandybee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept for two nights. Rooms very good and much larger than expected. View from window not so good as looking out the back of hotel onto another tower block which appeared to be half derelict, but did not retract from the Hotel. Staff all right. did not eat at hotel as used Patisserie Francais at end of the street. Location very good if you want to stay in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean - would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: eyelanddoc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7D6N stay at BOP, and I must say thank you to all previous TA reviews because I was extremely pleased with this hotel. The location was so ideal: 2-3 min walk from airport bus A21 ($33HKD one way, used Octopus card) drop off/pick up on Chatham Rd (east end of Prat Ave., many restaurants/bars for breakfast (DeliFrance - English breakfast $19-30HKD), snack (7-11 few shops away), Marketplace by Jason's (Western grocery store on basement level of shopping complex 18 Hanoi Rd, 2 streets or so away), close 5 min walk to TST MTR (a must in HK) on Humphreys/Nathan Rd (exit A2 closest to hotel), tons of shopping/malls, easy taxi access, safe location (never felt unsafe the entire time in HK). The hotel staff: very helpful (one pulled my suitcase to the end of Prat Ave to show us the exact location of the bus stop) and English speaking. (Before arriving to HK, I emailed back and forth with the staff regarding tedious details, and I so appreciated a response, for one, and timely, too!) Small lobby, but who spends time in the lobby??? Loved the free internet access in the rooms, although not wireless. When booking on the hotel's website, I requested, thanks to a previous review, a non-smoking superior room, away from the elevator, on the back side of the hotel away from the street, on a higher floor (in order to avoid the reported street noise), and my request was fulfilled - well sort of. They "upgraded" me to a deluxe room (little larger than superior, w/ microwave and mini-fridge - no complaints about this) on the exact opposite end of the elevator, 12th floor (room 1207), but the only downside is that I was on the street side facing G. Hotel. I was prepared for the street noise, mild for the most part, used ear plugs so I had no problem, but my friend, a light sleeper, wasn't as pleased. Enjoyed the room, very clean, perfect size, bathroom was great with soaking tub and separate shower (loved the shower head, but yes, the water temp can flucuate and scald you, so be careful). The A/C was a little cool but needed to be on to circulate the slightly smokey air wafting in from the hall. For flat-sheet loving people, the bed has a fitted sheet with a duvet covered comforter but no flat sheet. To solve the problem, my friend asked the room maid for an extra duvet cover. All in all, BOP exceeded my expectations, and I would recommend this hotel to travellers requiring a clean, comfortable, well located place to stay. Thanks again to TA and all reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe and Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: deltaalpha
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon Butterfly on Prat while researching for places to stay in Hong Kong on agoda. It seemed lovely with an affordable price. I booked a superior room and checked in for a 3D2N stay. We're really happy about the cleanliness of the place, we thought something would be compromised like service or amenities but everything was excellent. Front desk told me that they were all booked up (this was during check-in) so they upgraded us to a Deluxe. The room is relatively smaller in the sense that there's no receEveryone was friendly and helpful, and they gave us a room that fronted Guangdong Hotel on a high floor. Although the view wasn't really that great, we really didn't mind as we were rarely in the room. And honestly, how important is "view" when you're out exploring the city, anyway. We'd definitely stay at Butterfly on Prat again.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to great local bars and MTR. Very trendy hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: ahuynh
Reviews.Content: Butterfly on Pratt didn't seem like a high end hotel from the outside. Surrounded by a Karaoke bar and a few restaurants beside it, I was very surprised at how modern and clean it was once I stepped in. The air conditioning was a much needed welcome along in the strong cologne-smelling lobby which I had no issues with. Both the bell hop and staff at the front desk were very delicate and polite giving ample suggestions on our situation (our rooms were not quite ready). My room, although largest on the floor, was very spacious including an in shelf microwave and smoked sliding closet. The glass shower stall could fit at least 4 people. Each room has a small LCD and access to a DVD player and twenty some channels to view. I did find, however, that turning up the heat (from a default of 15 degrees celcius) causes moisture build up and an eventual mold smell in the room which can be corrected by turning down the heat. The other complaint I had was the shower water temperatures were never consistent. It would be warm then extremely hot which I had to turn down the temeperature which would eventually turn cold all of a sudden. This hotel provided a small gym which had enough equipment to do cardio and weights. A nice touch was Butterfly on the Pratt offers complimentary umbrella's in the case of rain. Booking tours (We did the 360 Lan Tau tour) was simple and straight forward. The same goes for check-out procedure. The lobby always provided maps and suggestions on locations of local attractions. There was at least 4 MTR station entrances which was a godsend since the MTR is the lifeblood of this city. Spas, hair salons, local eatery's, jewlery stores and local boutiques were also within a walking distance (off of Nathan road). Trying to hail a taxi was not a problem outside the front doors of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: TorotravelerNyc
Reviews.Content: The location, the staff and attention was very good. Great service and friendly staff. location was perfect the only down thing was they did not have Wi-fi available at the hotel- however they had two laptops in the lobby area available for guests. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Colorful Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SmilingGuy
Reviews.Content: It's a nice, very colorful hotel and we very much enjoyed our stay there. The location is great, it's near to almost everything you can think of. The service is great, though some of the housekeeping staff are weak in English, and hence can appear to be rude. The rooms are as spacious as you can find in HK, and are designed for long stay. A bummer though, they do not offer wireless connection. They do offer LAN connection at the rooms and have 2 kiosks at the lobby. Tip: The restaurant downstairs might be the only western style food place in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: MrBl0nd
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay in this fine boutique hotel. Our room was in the 17th floor, had a very modern interior, a very good bed, the bath room had a rain shower. The room was equipped with microwave and fridge. The staff was always helpful and friendly. We always had breakfast in the Deli France on the corner. Central location is great to explore HK; 3 min walk to the subway. We didn't have problems with the clubs downstairs, maybe due to the high floor. The windows in the bathroom were covered with blinds, so no problems there either. I wish they had wifi on the room, the two free-to-use computers in the lobby were occupied most times. Got myself a prepaid SIM card with data plan.from 7-Eleven (they're everywhere) to use in my UMTS mobile.

Reviews.Title: “9 of 10”
Reviews.Author: holiday-yihui
Reviews.Content: This is my first time stay based on TripAdvisore review. Thank you for every body who has been give review about this hotel. I was so worry when my friend (tour guide) told me, this hotel will be 10-15 mins from MTR. Actually just about 5 mins. We arrived there about 1 pm and room not ready yet. So 2:30 pm they asked us to go back and they upgraded us to Deluxe room since we was waiting quite long for our room, but at lower level (6th) and smoking room (not as requested). Luckily no smoke smell. The room was spacious for hong kong hotel room and the toilet was clean enough. I found melt grape below the wash basin. But still can accept. The shower was very good. They have microwave and DVD player. Not until an hour we stay, my hubby was having cramp in his left body. Tried to take paracetamol but still not work. The hotel was very helpful, they have wheelchair and bring him to the doctor about 50 meters. And they still asked about his condition on the next day. The cleaner was so kind also, she put some magazines in our room since she know I brought magazine to there. And changes the towel every day. It's FULL SERVICE. You receive what you pay. Negative : The room door and wall not thick enough. You can hear another people talking and can wake you up when people in front of your room close the door. Night time can hear sound (night live) from the surrounding area and horn from the street AC too cool No WI-FI (they give internet wire but please ah.. now is Wi-Fi era)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent room - pity about the tipping shake down”
Reviews.Author: jg161
Reviews.Content: Pretty much the same as Butterfly on Morrison on the island - good price, new, functional hotel in a great location. Restaurants, bars, clubs and pubs on every corner on the streets around the hotel. Looking for a place to crash after a night of partying - look no further. As noted elsewhere, Pratt street has a lot of clubs itself, if doof doof and people noise (until quite late, maybe 3am) worries you, you might want to consider somewhere else - or just bust out some earplugs - or join them. The only thing i didn't appreciate was the tipping shakedown - i am not North American, you get a tip if you are excessively polite or do something other than the minimum (providing i have some notes of suitable size). Mr Bellhop who felt it necessary to even inform the taxi driver that I didn't tip you for simply opening the taxi door and then refusing to do anything for the rest of my stay - maybe now you know why people don't feel inclined to tip you.

Reviews.Title: “Simple acceptable hotel”
Reviews.Author: calabogie
Reviews.Content: First the positives: excellect location. Close to the subway, Nathan street and lots of shops on the street. Very clean rooms. Most of the staff are excellent. good shower. Negatives. Clear glass looking into the bathroom. I'm not a prude but I like to go to the bathroom in private. I think this is absurd. VERY small rooms. I paid for a larger room and I think they gave me a standard, as least I hope it was! I complained but they said it was the large deluxe room. Carefull! I think I would recommend the Benito instead.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in tsim sha tsui”
Reviews.Author: Balihgh
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights, despite of not having a proper restaurant for breakfast everything is perfect!!. services from the time of reservation to check out is great!.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: owls9383
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end March/early April 2010. Although rates were a little higher than some other hotels, still value in terms of service. One particular checkin male receptionist was very courteous and upgraded me onto 13th floor (I think). Other counter staff were courteous & helpful as well. Free internet & laptop for use at reception area (although they should provide a more comfortable highstools). Room was spacious & shower/toilet were very clean, comfortable firm bed, good airconditioning, flatscreen tv, etc. Housekeeping was good . Hanging closet actually provide wood clotheshangers not "wire hangers". Only fault is non provision of sofas for waiting guests at lounge/check=in cause area is a little small but this is negligible.. Location wise == fantastic. 5 minutes walk out to Nathan Rd facing Kowloon Park. For self exploration on foot out either way up Nathan as far as Mongkok or down to Avenue of Stars. Easy connect to MTR via station at Kowloon Park to anywhere. Guangdong Hotel located opposite Butterfly. 5 or 6 drinking holes and a couple of cafes for quick lunches on same street but this branches out onto many shops & streets later on.. Safe to walk back to hotel from MTR stations even upto midnight. I'll be back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel with one of the most convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: shinzanmono
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days with boyfriend for our first trip. Wanted to stay at TST due to convenience and could not believe we found such a nice hotel at the price we paid! We booked through hotelclub for 75+tax/night! It's unbelievable deal but we did book 4 months ahead of time. The staff are really nice and tried their best to fulfill all our requests. We love the microwave in the room so for the food we could not finish at the restaurant, we could pack them back and heat up for brunch the next day. Check in and check out were very efficient. There's no surprises at checkout! There shower was really nice and I love that pressure. Some people complain about the noise and that the room is small. It is HK and it's expected that the room is quite small; therefore, we actually found the room bigger than expected. At least the room was much bigger than the hotel I stayed at when I was on vacation at Tokyo! As for the noise, just ask for a room facing the back and it should be fine. We did not hear anything because I requested a room facing the back after reading the previous reviews. However, there're two things that I hope they could work on. 1. The air condition in the room is way way way too cold and could not be turned up (we turned the nob to 28degrees but it's still freezing cold). Ended up we turn it on everyday when we leave the room and turn it off after we come back. It would be nice if we could adjust the temperature. 2. The feathered pillow is a little too prickly. I'll definitely be back when I next visit HK!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Bobby_Lam
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we visit HK. The hotel is near MTR, shopping area... The staff here are very friendly and helpful. The room is new and clean. Everything is just perfect. We would highly recommend this hotel to everyone who travel with limited budget :D

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-but take care on your belongings”
Reviews.Author: karott002
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a business trip. The hotel is really nice, almost a boutique hotel. It is really better than bigger and more expensive hotels like f.e. the Eaton Hotel or the Nathan Hotel. BUT: My external driver disappeared during my stay. I haven`t put it in the safe as I couldn`t imagine, that someone will take it! But it happened! Ridiculous, because he/she hasn`t taken my Mac book! I`ve informed the hotel about this, but nothing happened. No excuse-nothing! I`ve already stayed in HK about seven times in several hotels, but I`ve never ever made such an experience before! So someone has now all my files! From now on I will hide all my belongings! Aufgrund einer Geschäftsreise, habe ich dieses Hotel gebucht. Es it um Einiges stylisher als die großen Hotel wie z.B. das Eaton oder Nathan Hotel, allerdings gibt es hier keine Restaurants oder einen Pool. Nachteil: Während meines Aufenthaltes verschwand meine externe Festplatte. Ich habe sie nicht in den Safe gelegt, da man ja eigentlich nicht davon ausgeht, daß jemand heutzutage so etwas nimmt. Das Mac Book war allerdings noch da! Trotz mehrmaligen Nachfragens während meines Aufenthaltes und danach, tauchte diese nicht mehr auf. Er erfolgte auch keine Entschuldigung oder Ähnliches seitens des Hotels. Ärgerlich! Ich war bereits ca. 7x in HK und Derartiges ist mir noch nie in einem anderen Hotel passiert! Von nun an werde ich wirklich alles verstecken!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Racq
Reviews.Content: The hotel room and toilet were clean. They only have a small reception area but the staff and the doorman was very courteous and helpful. Service was adequate. They welcome anyone who asks for directions and always have a map on hand to show the way. For breakfast, you can choose from 2 sets, one with a piece of hot dog and the other with a burger. You can eat toast, jam, butter, cereals and drink milk or juice as much as you want. The downside is that they served breakfast at the basement, using a Japanese style bar. So, if you are early for breakfast, you'll still find cigarette butts and leftover drinks and food and dirty tables and floor. The breakfast place was very dark in contrast to the hotel rooms. I find it inappropriate to use this place that looks like a dungeon. However, the lady serving us was very friendly and courteous. I hope the hotel management can find a better place where they can serve breakfast. On the small lobby beside the elevator are 2 computers where you can use it for free, maybe just to check for emails. They have no toilet on the ground floor which means you have to go up to your room if suddenly you feel like using it. There's a restaurant opposite the hotel serving chinese food at very reasonable price, adequate food serving and really tasty meals. A few meters away from the hotel is a small grocery selling daily needs lower than 7-11 and K convenience store. A few blocks from the hotel is a Catholic church called Rosary Church. English Sunday mass starts at 8:30 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, simple and good value - appropriate for a couple or single traveler”
Reviews.Author: TrustedOpinion
Reviews.Content: Butterly on Prat is well intended, and for the most part it gets the job done. The rooms are comfortable and simple; the bathrooms are modern and a good size. There is no breakfast, but you won't miss it; there are enough other small conveniences such as good size refrigerator, tea pot and teas, a microwave too if you wish. This is not a luxury hotel; it is an efficient little hotel with an almost 80s modern twist. No views here, so don't expect a room with a view. The location is not the greatest on Prat Avenue, but it's not bad either and offers more for the price than properties on HK island. It is also close to the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: arthursiew
Reviews.Content: I mainly booked the Butterfly on Prat because of the high reviews, price, and location. The hotel was located in Tsim Sha Tsui in between Tsim Sha Tsui station and East Tsim Sha Tsui station. It is about a five minute walk to Tsim Sha Tsui station and 15 min to East Tsim Sha Tsui. It is also very close to Nathan Road where most of the major shopping malls are. The rooms were very clean and somewhat small. However, there was enough space for me to put a queen sized air mattress in front of the queen sized bed. I booked the Deluxe room which was why there was enough space. The Superior room loses the space in front of the bed which is a little larger than a queen sized bed. The shower takes a considerable amount of space in the bathroom, but the bathroom did not feel cramped at all. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows were way too soft. The service was good. Everybody was friendly and they always showed a bright smile as we walked in. Service was fast. What I don't like is that they don't have luggage trolley. Overall, I would recommend the Butterfly on Prat to people who are looking for a place to stay in a good location. Just be sure to request a higher floor facing away from Prat Ave. It can get somewhat noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in a shopping location”
Reviews.Author: Vivi2009
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great.Good shopping and MTR around the corners with bargain from hk100 and above.This is not a high class location with big brands around but you can get fashionable buy around the blocks(street wear).For bigger brands you can get it at the other side of Tian Sha Tsui near habour front.You can just walk around 15mins or take cab about HK 30.NoteD that shops open late about 12pm tro 11am.Room size is big compare to other hotels which I stay before at habour front.At night it is a little sleazy with pubs nearby(HK teenages with gold hair!) but it is pretty safe. The front desk Carine is very friendly and goes extra miles to help you with any Rsvp or information you need.So is the Bell boy who inform us taking a cab to airport is the same rate around HK 250 as taking MTR.So just take a cab from airport! Rooms are what you seem in this web page.For the price you are paying you really cannot find fault.However if you are looking for a relax location with great view this is not for you go for a five star hotel facing the habour or Central area hotels facing the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but all budget facilities”
Reviews.Author: AnujG
Reviews.Content: People have already spoken about the decent location of this hotel but I also want to point out the downsides. It has a very unimpressive lobby and rooms typically face other buildings with no view. Breakfast is minimal with no inhouse restaurant and served at an overnight pub. I will suggest avoiding this place and booking a better place by paying a bit extra.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love the Butterfly”
Reviews.Author: Mabelheng
Reviews.Content: From the many and great reviews on TripAdvisor on Butterfly on Prat, my partner and I decided to stay here for 5D4N. Aren't we glad we did! 1) Value for money (very affordable within the HKD6-700 per night range). Don't expect a huge room (then again, most HK hotels are not very big). You'll be out & about anyway... 2) Excellent location (restaurants & bars all round, 7-11 within a stone's throw, 3 minute walk to MTR station, 10 minute walk to Habour City, 13 minute walk to Macau Ferry). 3) Great amenities (didn't mind the glass toilet, microwave indeed useful when you want to heat up those portugese tarts, LCD TV with too many channels to choose from although half are news & documentary, bed is very comfy except pillow abit too soft, aircond is very cold and there's free internet usage). 4) Service (front desk is very very helpful. Thanks Tracie and Calie for the pointers! Very accommodating and gave us a high floor room. If you don't mind, can be noisy if you're lower floors as bars and all around. Karaoke just right next door). Great boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel close to everything with a helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: randy_asia
Reviews.Content: great chic hotel and close to the subway, do it! staff more than helpful and english speaking. rooms were huge and modern

Reviews.Title: “Great choice and very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jntz
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay at Butterfly on Prat. The rooms are good, a bit small, but we were out most of the time and it really didn't bother us. It's a great location, we walked every where and didn't have to take a cab. Nice food and bars in the street. Although wouldn't recommend the breakfast which is served by a Japanese restaurant next to the hotel. The breakfast is very small and not good value for money. We also didn't have any problems with noise.

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: NikiArif
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through agoda and got a really good rate. The location on prat avenue is awesome, 3 minute walk to the mtr station and has many nice restaurants and cafes around. The room is larger than the standard rooms in HK, they even have a microwave oven in the room to heat up any takeaway food. The front desk staff is really nice, and could answer all our enquiries abt travelling around hk and other general stuff.. the lobby is a bit small, but its clean and they have this aromatherapy thing goin on so everytime we step into the hotel, there's a nice smell ligering in the hallway. they have free internet in the lobby on 2 laptops, since the quantity of computers are limited, they limit ur usage for only 15 mins per use. although i dont think they would chase u away if u stay longer than that. The room size is good, modernish fixtures, with an lcd tv and dvd player (you can even borrow dvds for free @ the reception counter). we liked the bed, very nice and comfy. a lot of people complained about the coldness of the room, but we thought its ok as they have a tempreture regulator near the toilet door. the toilet door is weird. its glass and u can see through everything. maybe ok for couples but if you go with friends or colleagues u might have to be extra careful when u shower lol. water pressure in the shower is awesome too. we didnt order any room service, so cant comment on that. we saw the menu and they only have a limited number of choices in the menu. but who needs room service when there are so many restaurants a few seconds away. i will definitely come back to this hotel! tip: get the airport express tourist pass, (1 or two trips on airport express and 3 days unlimited mtr use).

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: expat_in_Japan
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through Agoda and got a reasonable rate for this boutique hotel with an excellent location. Just a quick taxi ride from the Hung Hom train station, Butterfly welcomed me courteously and even upgraded my room to a deluxe. The room was very clean, and I didn't have any noise issues as I was on the 17th floor. The room was stylishly decorated, and in the deluxe room the bathroom is not visible from the sleeping area (although that wouldn't have bothered me as a single traveler anyway...) Free internet, great shower, comfortable bed, easy walking distance to shopping in Kowloon, the MTR, and, slightly further away, the Star Ferry, and a multitude of good restaurants nearby. I have no reason to look for any other accommodation in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in HK”
Reviews.Author: beau3636
Reviews.Content: Although I only stayed here for one night with my gf prior to an international flight, I was very impressed and happy with my stay at Butterfly on Prat. It's located in a very trendy and "happening" area with lots of shops, eateries, and restaurants surrounding it, and makes a perfect "home base" if you want to explore the Kowloon area. We ate at the Italian restaurant Al Dente which is located just off the lobby. It was very nice and the food was very good, which was evidenced by the fact that every table was full on a Tuesday night at 10 pm. It was reasonably priced, with the two of us eating with app for around 330HK ($40 US). Check in was a breeze after booking and paying for my room on Orbitz (for only $83 US). The room was very clean and, while not large, had plenty of room for my gf and I. It looked newly renovated and included a flatscreen, dvd player, large fridge, microwave, and free WIFI.
