The bathroom was large and clean also, but be prepared it does have smoked glass doors which can be see through. The best part of the room was the bed and linens. The bed was very soft and comfy and the pillows were perfect, both a rarity in Asia. The only thing that I would do different next time is request a room at the end of the hallway on a high floor. We were on floor 13, and could still hear some road noise. Also, we were given the room directly opposite the elevator (maybe 6 ft away) and heard a few drunken tourists arriving late into the morning. We still slept well though because of the great bed! One last note, upon check in I asked the single doorman if there would be taxi's available at 7 am the next morning and he assured me he would personally have one waiting. I assumed he meant he would call and reserve one. When we rolled out of the elevator the next morning the same bellman grabbed our luggage and had it loaded in the taxi before we even completed the check out process. Very friendly and great service from a hotel that had two employees working in the small lobby! I will use Butterfly on Prat from now on when I travel out of HK, and feel confident in recommending to others.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ashlibrooks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent two weeks at Butterfly on Prat and loved it! As all previous reviewers mention the rooms and bathroom are great and spotlessly clean. The set-up is perfect if you're staying for awhile like we were. The location can't be beat and although there are some complaints here about noise, we didn't have any trouble on the 12th floor and I think a bit of noise is to be expected with an awesome location in HK because afterall HK is a BUSY city! As for the A/C...definitely is cold, but not being used to the very hot and humid summers of HK, it was a welcome relief each day we came home as was the relaxing music in the lobby and nice smell! The staff were helpful and those who spoke English the best were very helpful and friendly to English speakers (obviously). We were impressed to receive an extensive and very well organized World Cup schedule on the first days of the games. It's so nice we took it home to continue following from the US! Were also pleasantly suprised that they had movies you could borrow for free which was great for a couple of rainy days. Some tips--there is a great Western-style grocery store called Jason's at K:11 a shopping area a block or two away and with the fridge and microwave this can be a great way to save. There is a Chinese grocery store on the same block below a horse race betting place across the street. Our favorite restaurant for food and service was hands-down Two Thousand Villages Thia/Vietnamese Restaurant on the same block (same side). Was also suprised how close we were to the History Museum and a bus that takes you directly to Stanley Village on Hong Kong Island. In sum, if we were lucky enough to return to HK we would definitely stay at Butterfly on Prat and would highly recommend it to all friends/family! Probably our favorite hotel for what we were doing!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, perfectly located boutique hotel with massive shower”
Reviews.Author: jenzer
Reviews.Content: I only stayed 1 night at Butterfly but was very impressed with this boutique hotel in the heart of the tourist area of HK. It does not have an impressive facade but the porter and check-in staff were friendly and efficient. My room (I went for bigger area) was large (for HK) with a massive shower in the bathroom. The room was spacious, spotlessly clean and well equipped with microwave, fridge, tea/coffee, tv and LAN. The bed was really comfortable. I only have 2 small gripes: - the curtains are not black-out and the traffic noise during the day was very intrusive when I needed to sleep during the afternoon; the breakfast provided in the Japanese (??) restaurant next door was not that good and I would not recommend anyone to book the breakfast. Otherwise, an excellent stay and I would definitely go back to Butterfly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it All...except....”
Reviews.Author: LisaLNy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is chic, colorful, and the staff is very inviting... Except the lobby is Always cold.. The Room is small but good size, they have a microwave and refrig and the shower is glass, you can see right through...Except... to figure out how to work the blinds and open the door requires a specialized degree...and the beds are Hard... The internet connection might be free, so inquire with the help desk. The Breakfast is NOt...worth the extra fee... you get soo little that it is worth it for you to just walk right out of the hotel make a right or a left and your option are endless. Me, my boyfriend, sister and brother in law loved everything about Butterfly and HK and we look forward to our future trips to HK. We will def. be staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of choice in HKG!”
Reviews.Author: Manila_Mango_Man
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Location was perfect. Walking distance to malls, restaurants, the Star Ferry, the Space Museum. 2. Room was very nice - from the design to the mattress and the pillows. My wife was also able to book the farthest room from the elevator and on the 15th floor so no noise at all. We all slept like babies. 3. Friendly staff - All very eager to help. 4. It looks, smells and IS clean. Cons: 1. Air con was way too cold - even if set at 30C. Must be broken. Shut it off for our last 2 nights and slept very comfortably. 2. You will need to take along those how-to-get-there cards (which the hotel provides). Not everyone knows where Prat st. is. 3. Had a minor leak problem in the bathroom, but nothing that inconvinienced us. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: bea2006
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right in the heart of the action. Great restaurants nearby. Steps from bus stops, block from train line, a nice 4-5 block walk to ferry terminal. Clean, polite staff. Modern decor. Small lobby/check-in area, but rooms were very nice. Quiet. Clean. Great choice, and reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel with good location in Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: NT01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Butterfly on Prat from May 27-30, 2010. Ten persons, including 3 kids 10 years old and below. While we initially had problems with checking in - the rooms were supposed to be available by noon, then 2PM, then 3PM, the front desk staff were generally patient and friendly. We finally got our rooms set up almost 5PM as there were requests for extra beds. Main reason for the delay was that the hotel was booked full the previous night, although I think it was the lack of housecleaning staff that aggravated it. Butterfly on Prat is primarily ideal for couples, or those without children. There are about a dozen rooms on each floor, and children running along the corridors can be quite noisy. Make sure you request for a room on the higher floors, as the street downstairs can be noisy with cars honking their horns loudly when there's traffic along Prat Ave. There are a few convenience stores less than 3 minutes walk away, and you can buy food supplies and snacks as the rooms provide a refrigerator (empty) and microwave. The hotel provides 2 bottles of distilled water (380 ml) daily, but it is recommended you buy your own at 7-11 to refill in case these aren't enough as Hong Kong is hot and humid in May. Some pet peeves... not all rooms have opaque glass panels in the bathroom door and the bathroom itself...out of the 3 rooms, one had clear glass panels (!!!) instead of the opaque panels...which is exactly the reason why the place is ideal for couples or individual travelers. It is quite a hassle to ask the hotel staff to paste Manila paper on the clear panels for the occupants' privacy. Another reason this is suited for couples is that the room is quite small, and adding an extra bed doesn't allow much moving space. Among the hotel staff, the front desk personnel (especially the ladies) are the most professional. They speak good English and are courteous. However, it would be difficult to make requests from the housekeeping staff as most of them barely speak English except the basics - "Thank you, good morning, etc.". Along Prat Avenue, there are a few reasonably priced Chinese, Vietnamese and Thai restaurants that serve great tasting food...the best bargains are during mid-day as they offer specials that include meals plus drinks. Overall, if you don't expect too much from an establishment like this compared to full service hotels, Butterfly on Prat is considered value-for-money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dave_jacobson
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a four day vacation with my wife, kids, and parents. We stayed in two rooms. This was my second time in Hong Kong. The previous time we stayed at the Mira. The Mira is a nicer hotel but we paid more than double the rate at the Mira. Butterfly on Prat was a much better value. Here is my summary of Butterfly on Prat: - Excellent location - Nice and helpful staff - Nice rooms - Very large refrigerator in the room with a working freezer - Comfortable bed with nice sheets - Microwave in the room - Modern bathroom - Nice size room for Hong Kong standards My only minor negative is that you should be prepared for awkward doors in the lobby. For some reason they installed heavy narrow doors so it's hard getting luggage through the doors in the lobby. Other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Period!”
Reviews.Author: TheSk8Guru
Reviews.Content: I just returned to the United States from a 14 day China trip. I always end a business trip with an overnight in Hong Kong to relax, take photos, shop a little, and enjoy the people. I've stayed for years at the Marco Polo Gateway, the New World Mariott and the Sheraton, and even the Ibis on North Point. In planning last trip, I wanted to give Butterfly on Prat a try, because of it's price, it's location, it's website and some of the more positive reviews on TripAdvisor. I think I can agree on everything said in all the reviews, , including the weird smell in the lobby. However..... Checked in on a Friday afternoon after arriving by rail from Dongguan. 2 minute cab ride - a breeze. Dropped off on the street, not a problem. 10 meter walk to the lobby door. No staff to open the door for me. Narrow stiff doors were kind of akward. Got in, dropped bags, stepped right up and checked in. Only to find that...they were full. But, I had a reservation! No problem. They had a room waiting for me, it was the largest in the hotel, room 1808. That's a suite. That's right. Walk in, look left, bedroom. Look straight ahead, KITCHEN! Look Right, living room. Even had a little breakfast table. AMAZING. The bathroom was I am sure larger than most in the hotel. Clean, clean, clean, and after an all day worth of meetings and rail travel, that shower looked great. Shampoo was citrus and the best smelling hotel shampoo I've come across in 15 years of Asia travel. Sound like a small, dumb detail? Try some shampoo that smells like a mixture of gasoline and rice wine and you come to appreciate the little things like a nice smelling shampoo. Water pressure was great. Flat screen in the bedroom. Flat screen in the living room. No utensils nor glasses, as you would find in the kitchen of let's say a Residence Inn by Mariott - but this is Hong Kong ! Who would need a kitchen? Noise? Forget about it! 18 floors up. I was out cold anyway from such a long trip. And SOFT bedding. Never got to eat at the adjacent resturant called Al Dente. Will next time. Butterfly on Prat is going to be my new favorite hotel property in Hong Kong/TST! Also, Staff was cute, smiling and never, ever *****@*.

Reviews.Title: “good location but can not sleep well”
Reviews.Author: New007
Reviews.Content: price ok , staff very friendly, good location , lobby very small , just only 2 internet computer at lobby not enough I have to wait about 30 minute for use it , can not sleep well at night but anyway still good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great value, even if it has minor flaws.”
Reviews.Author: dakine77
Reviews.Content: For the most part, the Butterfly On Prat was a good value stay in a prime location (for sightseeing, not necessarily for a getting a rest; more on that later). I booked a 3-day stay for just over $300 US, so I'm not quite sure why some reviewers claimed it's expensive. For a great location in the heart of a major city, I consider this to be quite reasonable. It's only a couple blocks away from the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station on Nathan Rd as well as Kowloon Park. Lots of restaurants nearby with a couple convenience store as well for the off-hours. Anyway, checked in and was told I had been upgraded to a deluxe room. It was clean, modern and quite spacious with a microwave and fridge. Free movies to borrow to your room. 10% discount to the restaurant next door (didn't partake). As for the negatives, first, I was right across the elevators so I could hear people talking while getting on/off, as well as the constant "ding, dong" of arriving at the floors. Not too big of a deal though. The other thing is that I was on the street side of the building. Prat is a pretty lively street at night with some small bars. Friday and Saturday night especially, there was a lot of noise coming from the street below (people yelling, cars honking, etc.), and I was on the 11th floor. Can't imagine what it would have been like on a lower floor. But again, wasn't too big of a deal for me. If you're a light/early sleeper, be sure to request a room on the back side of the building! Lastly, no internet access in the rooms (there are two computers in the lobby). Had to buy some WiFi from nearby. As far as the staff, I had minimal interaction with them (just check in/out). They were friendly enough but not overly so. In summary, the Butterfly is a solid choice in a great area. Would definitely stay there again if in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: mesquite69
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Hong Kong, and I found this hotel to be a good deal. The noise came from the hallway and the next room. All this is dependent on the quality of neighbors you have. I heard no street noise as I was on the backside of the hotel Other than the noise, the hotel was great, a bargain in Hong Kong. The bed was comfortable, unlike most others I have encountered in Asia. They are usually too hard. The internet was free and worked quite well. The room was a bit small and I think for two people it would be too small. The neighborhood seems a wee bit sleazy, but not too sleazy. I never felt unsafe at all. There are some nice cheap restaurants right by the hotel, including a coffee shop, a Thai Vietnamese restaurant and a middle eastern restaurant that has great gyros. The staff was quite friendly and helpful, but not overly so. Their English was fine. They helped me get to restaurants, the ferry terminal and the train station, all of which were easy to find. I would stay at this hotel again, but I'd bring some earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Major, major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lefty330
Reviews.Content: To summarize for those who don't want to read: 1) Expensive 2) Small - even for HK standards 3) Overpowering odor in the lobby 4) Slow elevators 5) One key per room (unacceptable for a $150/night place) First, we overpaid. And it was a Tuesday/Wednesday night that we stayed. This hotel should cost, maybe $80 - at most. We paid over $150. Sure it was a few nights before, but still, we stayed at the BP International with a night's advance notice and it was far superior. The aroma in the lobby was so awful, that I literally felt nauseous when I spent too much time there. The lobby was also incredibly cramped. Sure it was HK, I understand that, I used to live there. But It still felt cramped. The rooms were the only redeeming factor. They were good. For an $80/night place. One of the most annoying things was that I went out at night and my gf did too. But she'd go home early. And so, when I'd return at night, I couldn't get in the room because there was one key per room. So I had to wait for the maintenance guy to show up at my room. For $150/night...that's completely unacceptable. They stored bags outside in the lot...under a mesh net. Real safe. Staff wasn't overly friendly. Internet had a page that said it was $150HK per 24/hrs so I didn't use it, only to find out the next day that it was included in the room. This. Place. Sucketh.

Reviews.Title: “Luggage storage outside hotel and disappointed with staff service upon checked out!”
Reviews.Author: Bunnytoon
Reviews.Content: After reading all the good reviews posted by travellers, we decided to give this hotel a try. While checked in to the hotel, the male staff at the counter was very polite to us. We were there at around 1pm, but the room was not ready yet, so the staff asked us to come back after 2pm. As we have 2 haversacks, the staff offered to keep them behind the counter. We felt that it should be quite safe to put our luggage inside the hotel rather than outside as we noticed that the hotel would park most of the luggage outside the hotel. When we entered the room after 2pm, it was clean, neat and as expected it was not spacious and the bathroom was a totally can see through glass. It seems suitable for couple, but ops, some might concern if sharing the room with someone. The window view was unpleasant as it was facing the back of an old building. Prior to our check out, we would give this hotel a rating that slightly above the average with that amount we paid. However, we have downgraded our rating for this hotel as we were quite disappointed with the service provided by a lady staff during our checked out . When we checked out at 11.30am, we requested the lady staff to look after our haversacks as we were having an evening flight and so, we requested to put them behind the counter as we can see there was still some empty space behind it. However, she insisted us to put our haversacks outside the hotel. Even though we raised our concerns that we felt uncomfortable to put our haversacks outside the hotel as unlike other bulky luggage that parked outside the hotel, our haversacks seems more easily grabbed by public. In fact, we explained that the haversacks won't take up much space if put behind the counter, however, she still refused to let us to put them inside by telling us she needs to reserve the space for other coming customers. We felt that the staff suddenly changed her attitude and become so inflexible after the billing has been done. The service provided seems totally different from the day we checked in where the staff offered us to keep our baggage inside the hotel lobby. However once we have settled the bill, it seems that the service was ended there, and the priority would not be given to us anymore. After a while of negotiation, the lady staff gave in unwillingly and with harsh tone to let us to put the haversacks behind the counter. This was really an unpleasant experience that we have and I think I won't recommend this hotel to others as the staff attitude and after sale service need to be improved a lot.

Reviews.Title: “value for money,good experience, but freezing aircon temperture.”
Reviews.Author: theawesomethings
Reviews.Content: Stay was pleasant. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Room is value for money, given that its a 3star hotel. To our delight, there was a microwave oven and bigger than usual fridge. But the aircon was too cold, despite adjusting to the lowest fan speed and 30 degrees, its still freezing, and the weather outside was only 20 degrees. so we switched off the aircon for the 3 nights of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice new and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trane&Trane
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very centrally and there are many bars, restaurants and shops in the area. We had booked a superior room (biggest) which was very nice but with absolutely no view (which we had not expected either). Very nice bathroom with a huge shower cabin and lots of space. Internet was included in the room rate although it looked like we were going to be charged when we logged in. There is no breakfast restaurant at the hotel but in the basement there is a Japanese restaurant where the breakfast is served (at HKD 55). The breakfast is a full English breakfast and a buffet with cerials etc. The waitress was surprisingly good at English for Hong Kong and it turned out that she had lived in the UK. Serivce level at the hotel was fine and we liked our stay there a lot.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is incredible”
Reviews.Author: canciara
Reviews.Content: Flying in from New Zealand on our way to London, we chose the Butterfly Hotel based on amazing reviews. As we got out of the taxi, a staff member rushed out to take our bags and we checked in without any hitches, the hotel took British Pounds as a deposit. The staff then took our bags up to our room. The room was exceptionally clean and considering the size, felt quite spacious. We had plenty of room to stow away luggage and spread ourselves out. I had requested a room with a covered bathroom when I'd originally booked and that wasn't a problem either. Speaking of the bathroom, the shower was AMAZING. The best shower I have ever had the pleasure of using in my life. The shampoo etc was restocked daily and of reasonable quality. Whenever we left the hotel, we would be greeted and someone would usually get the door for us. We also made use of the free internet in the lobby which was very useful and not constantly in use. Overall, the Butterfly was incredible. We are thinking of going back to Hong Kong so we can stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Triccie
Reviews.Content: The rooms were aesthetically pleasing. I didn't mind the glass doors on the bathroom as I am a solo traveler, but this might be a concern for some. However, the room was very good, equipped with the usual amenities guests look for such as shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, shower cap, etc. Bedroom slippers and toothbrush/toothpaste were missing though, but these are just minor things. The room also includes a microwave, an LG flat screen television and a safety deposit box. The hotel is only a five minute walk away from the Tsim Sha Tsui train station, which makes it convenient for the traveler to move around Hong Kong. It takes about 20 minutes to go from TST to Central HK via the MTR, and a little bit longer to get to Causeway Bay. The hotel is around a 20 minute walk to Harbor City mall via Humphreys and Haiphong Road, the famed Nathan Road and the Kowloon Park. The Science Museum and the History Museum is also a short walk from the hotel. The staff at the front desk (at least the females) were very friendly and accommodating. They spoke English very well and it wasn't a burden to communicate with them at all. Staff in charge of the baggage and rooms were friendly and helpful as well. There are two Toshiba laptops with free internet access in the lobby; guests can just use them whenever they're available. The maximum time of use is 15 minutes. When you check in, they give you a Butterfly Club card which you can show at stores/restaurants partnered up with the hotel for 10-20% discount. The hotel will provide a list of the establishments they are affiliated with. The hotel offers assistance in reserving a shuttle bus en route to the Hong Kong International Airport for HK$140. Overall, I had a great stay at BoP and will definitely recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Trip Advisor Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: globalgourmet
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone who took the time to write a review and recommend this hotel. Not only was this place just what I was looking for, but my stay was enhanced by all of your recommendations. Notes: 1. Take the Airport Express Train from the airport to Kowloon station, then catch the free K3 shuttle, get off at the first stop (about a 12-15 minute ride) walk back in the direction the shuttle came from, take a right, then another right onto Prat and the hotel is on your left, across the street from the Guang Dong hotel. 2. I requested a quiet room on a high floor, at the back and away from the elevator--and that's exactly what they had reserved for me. 3. I was prepared for a tiny room, given some of the comments here. What I found was a room small by American standards, but not much smaller than an average Asian or European room. 4. The free Internet with my offer worked great all the time. 5. The Tao Hueng dim sum place just a couple of blocks away was excellent. (I was the only Caucasian in the whole place, usually a good sign.) Very reasonable and excellent food. 6. A good Vietnamese place just down the street and the First Cup in the other direction both give 10% off if you show your Butterfly Club card the hotel gives you--and the First Cup serves a good full English breakfast all day long. 7. For a break from Asian food there's German pub just down the street with several Pilsners on draught and some very good Nuremburg sausages with sauerkraut. 8. I found the Airport Express ticket that includes three days of unlimited travel on the MRT very handy. The three days don't start till the day you first use the card for the MRT, not including your ride in on the Airport Express. 9. Oh yes, back to the hotel, the bathrooms are good size with a large shower with a good, adjustable shower head. 10. The whole place is clean and modern. My standard (""superior") room had a fridge and a microwave, complimentary coffee, tea and two bottles of mineral water left every day, a desk with a broadband outlet and cable, a luggage rack, a good size closet with lots of wooden hangers, a safe and plenty of storage space. 10. It's not the Mandarin Oriental, or even the Marriott or Sheraton, but it was half to one-third the price of those places. Again, thanks to all who recommended the Butterfly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: LennyLenz
Reviews.Content: Great experienced ! Nice hotel and all staff, clean and also near to the MRT, shopping mall, etc. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Roston75
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four night in the Butterfly on Prat. It's nicely located in Tsim Sha Tsui, even though located on a street which none of the taxi drivers we had knew. So it might be good if you have a map where you can show them it's location. We booked on asiatravel a deluxe room for three nights (3 for 2 offer) and a superior room. On our arrival, we were told that we can stay at the deluxe room for all four nights, very nice. The room was super clean, modern but a little small for a deluxe one. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom very nice and big. Our room was on the ninth floor and it was a little noisy from the bars down at the street. There is no wifi internet in the room, but a fast cable connection which was included in our room rate. There are some pc's for free use in the lobby. The staff was excellent, very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: WalkersSkiing
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small, but they are clean, comfortable and well equipped - combine that with friendly staff an excellent location all at a reasonable rate and you have the perfect budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: Luey9189
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms (there were three adults and two children) and I couldn't believe how friendly the staff were, how new the fittings were and how great the location was. The two rooms on the 7th floor were pretty quiet for being so central. The rooms were a little different, the one at the end of the floor was a little bigger (we had to fit in an extra bed so it worked perfectly). We had a computer and an ethernet cable so we didn't have to go to the lobby for the internet (and it was all free). We left our luggage all day as we had a very late flight (no concerns at all). Lastly, I have to mention the restaurant at the bottom of the hotel, Al Dente, which had a delicious set menu for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bractullo
Reviews.Content: As expected Trip Advisor came up trumps again. Stayed for four nights stop-over on way to New Zealand. Not much to add to previous recent reviews as all seem accurate. Great location to explore Kowloon and Hong Kong Island (only ten minutes walk from Star Ferry). Even on 12th floor bit of background noise from street. Main intrusive noise is horns and police sirens but guess that is just Hong Kong and they will be there no matter where you stay. Usually like to eat "local food" but this time not a good experience. However, Al Dente restaurant next door was excellent with 10% discount. Only wish we had used it from day one. Happy hour up to 7:30 means wine is affordable. Only opened for one month and owner/staff were very friendly. As said hotel was absolutely fine but, in my view, not outstanding. Just a good place to lay one's weary head. There was a microwave but no plates or cutlery. Also a couple of cumfy chairs would have been nice. But look on this as constructive criticism. Would most definitely stay again but ask for room to rear.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location..”
Reviews.Author: supersteve01
Reviews.Content: Yes all the things said are true, thanks tripadvisor for another top notch hotel in the middle of the action. We had a delux room, our friends paid $400 for a room at the Hyatt which other than size and view had little more to offer. Brand new rooms with everything you need, a pleasant surprise in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joost-Hanna
Reviews.Content: We stayed two night in Butterfly on Prat. This hotel either fairly new or just been renovated. Everything seems to be brand new. The hotel is conviently located on the Kwoloon island. Hong Kong is an expensive city.....we paid 120 EURO for a double room per night. Compared to other hotels in Hong Kong this is still fairly good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good location but too small lobby”
Reviews.Author: jakrapop
Reviews.Content: we were there for 3 nights staff very friendly room clean but they have just only 2 computers I have to wait so long time for use internet and lobby very small in the night time can't sleep well if you stay in the room close to the road you will hear somebody talk all night

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful stay in Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: ninapod
Reviews.Content: Very close to Tsim Sha Tsui (TST) station, but inside the room is peaceful and quiet. Compact room, modern decor with dark wood and nice warm colors, comfortable bed. Through an online deal I had free wired internet, though connection was sometimes weak. Bathroom sink splashes out water very easily. Staff were very courteous and spoke English fine. Great doorman who always saw me going out or coming in and greeted me. You can take the free airport shuttle bus from Kowloon station to the Park Hotel, which is right around the corner. Good value for the quality and location.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: irwish__jc
Reviews.Content: January was my fourth stay at this hotel in 13 months and it has only been open that long. Like many newer HK Hotels the rooms are small, a convient location, but no view. The rooms are useable but not spacious. Flat Screen TV, Ref, Micro, DVD Player, and Electric Kettle offer some homelike amenities. Great Bed, a shower that always has not water, and free internet too. Note there is only one bed in each room. The hotel staff in very helpful but sometimes English is a problem but they will do anything for you, with a smile. On business, you are close to the TST/TSTE business area, bout 10 minute walk from the MTR, and cabs are readily available and inexpensive. There as a vacationer the MTR will take you just about anywhere you want to go. Around the hotel there are pleanty of inexpensive places to eat, grocery shopping is about five minutes one way or the other, and Seven Eleven and Circle K within a 2 mintute walk. Assuming their rates don't go the way of many HK Hotels once they get known, I will stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, in fact pleasant for price”
Reviews.Author: LeSnob
Reviews.Content: Very clean, tiny, modern, pretty hotel at a good price. Room probably too small for 2 people. Make sure you get a nonsmoking room facing the back (it's a bar street). There was still a faint smoke smell in the room. Breakfast is in a run down Japanese restaurant next door and quite frankly disgusting. Recommended for budget minded solo travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: travelguy94941
Reviews.Content: Standard rooms are a bit on the small side but well appointed with a long writing desk, microwave oven, and a flat screen wall mounted television. The bathroom is modern and clean with a roomy shower. A plus is free WiFi as many other hotels do charge for it in Hong Kong. We had a room on the ninth floor by the elevator, no view, just some hall noise from other guests coming and going. The best thing about Butterfly on Prat is the staff. All were professional, courteous, and helpful. The hotel is located in an alley, as most things are on the Kowloon side, smack in the middle of lots of action. A short walk will get you to just about anywhere you want to go (Nathan Lane, MTR, warlf). We will return to the Butterfly On Prat again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel at an awesome location with a great pricetag!”
Reviews.Author: vivacircus30
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying here, and would definitely come back! I got there through bus service Vigor, which cost me ~$20sgd per way (to and fro the airport) as I’m too lazy to lug my luggage on the MTR. So there was I on the doorstep to the hotel! I was there for a week and from day one when we were there, the staff has been fabulous with their service. Helped was always offered to carry our bags when we return from our shopping spree and small gesture like walking slightly faster than us to get the lift really warms our heart. Even the cleaning staff was always ready with a smile, greeting us in the morning. The lobby and rooms were very modern (has a very nice clean fragrance to it) and clean. Loved the raindance showerhead furnished in the toilet! Ha! 2 laptops for internet access are located in the lobby. Cable TV are available in the rooms and DVDs are available for free rental if you get bored of TV! But the toilets had translucent and transparent bits, so not really suitable for all. Located on Prat ave, with bars and ktv around its always abuzz with activity. But I had no noise issues, staying at level 6. Either that or I was just knocked out. There are 2 convenient stores in the vicinity. I found it relatively safe. Only ~6 mins walk from TST MTR (from there u can get ard TST easily through the various exits) and with nearby Granville road, location is very good. Lots of food stores that open till late, so you will never go hungry. It is also a stone throw away from the harbor and museums. Overall, it has been a great stay for me, value for money with an awesome location and great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but average rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: qian08
Reviews.Content: we chose to stay @ BOP after reading the fantastic reviews given by fellow travellers on Tripadvisor, but felt the hotel was rather overrated. granted, the location is good, and is just a short walk from TST MTR station. this made it convenient to travel ard the different parts of HK. room wise, it was small, but that was expected of HK hotels.the pillows were too soft for our liking, so was the mattress. there were also no bedroom slippers, and we had to request for them. the decor of the toilets are very modern and chic, but we thought the design of the sink/tap wasn't very ergonomic. water would splash out everywhere, and the glass countertop would always be wet. water pressure from the showerhead was also extremely weak, and we had to resort to removing the head, and showering directly from the hose. i guess it was due to the water filter in the shower head. however, we received good service from the staff, who were always helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with Easy access!”
Reviews.Author: Mike9570
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location in Tsin Sha Tsui.. Dont bother to go look for a hotel in Nathan road casue those are really overrated and pricy. BOP is not only reasonable but the best thing is that the room is spacious for Hong Kong standard. Stayed 5 nights there and i definitely will go back if i'm heading to Hong Kong. Only one downside is that the room does not have heater and it,s freezing during winter time. For the rest of it, this boutique is simply cozy and clean. You can find great food along the streets, groceries shops are only a stone away. lots of place to for leisure downstairs such as spas and bars for chill. The staff are friendly and are able to answer my every enquiries confidently.

Reviews.Title: “Trip-advisor reviews say it all”
Reviews.Author: Colywobbles
Reviews.Content: Spent a lot of online time looking for a reasonably priced but nice hotel. Hong Kong has so much choice This is one of those tripadvisor gems that you come across after putting the time in on researching. The hotel is pretty new and so is still in great condition. The hotel basically consists of just a small lobby and then just rooms. In Hong Kong not sure what more you would need. The rooms were small but well furnished with flat screen tv, fridge microwave etc. Real comfy bed and great power shower. Right in the middle of things 10 minutes walk to waterfront. 5 mins to MTR. Reception staff very helpfull with directions sightseeing info etc. Paid just £50 per night. absolute bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Dollar”
Reviews.Author: ursula13
Reviews.Content: I am sure there are plenty of other hotels that are much nicer than BOP, but for the price, it's a steal in Hong Kong. The hotel is very easy to reach via airport express train and the free hotel shuttle to The Park hotel. I would suggest carrying a street map though so you can sort out which way to walk once you get off the free shuttle as we wondered for a bit and everybody, including our shuttle driver, gave us the wrong directions. We tried to check-in a couple of hours early but were not able to. Instead the bellman gave us the suggestion to have dim sum breakfast at a nearby restaurant and it was absolutely amazing and cheap! The best food we had in Hong Kong. (To get there, take a left out of BOP, right onto Camarvon Road and it will be in the building just past the bank on the left hand side, take the elevator up to the restaurant.) Once we checked into the hotel, we were upgraded for free. Our room was on the 10th floor and small, as we expected. I can't even imagine how small the regular rooms are. The room seemed very clean, bed was comfortable the decor was modern. Shower was big enough for 3 people. There was also a microwave and fridge. The only problems we had was the noise from the karaoke bar downstairs until 4am and the lack of a black-out curtain (bring an eyemask). We received 2 free water bottles on the first day only. There are 2 free laptops in the lobby which we used to get restaurant suggestions on TripAdvisor :) I highly recommend this hotel. Helpful Staff. Good Area. Just bring an eyemask for the light in the morning and earplugs for the karaoke noise. I still give it 5 stars for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: incagirlIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel i felt was overrated. The rooms were quite small and noisy. I felt this hotel has a fast turnover, literally heads on beds. Under the bed was not hoovered, there were cobwebs near the curtains and the walls were marked from luggage. This hotel was not worth €90.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “You get way more than you pay for!"”
Reviews.Author: speroli
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel that is well-located and reasonably priced for a boutique hotel. We booked on asiatravel.com and got the 3-nights-for-2 deal which got us a deluxe queen room for approximately $180 USD total for 3 nights. The room was quite nice with a comfortable queen bed, television with international channels, a good sized closet, a microwave, a refrigerator, and a FANTASTIC shower. The hotel itself is new and clean with a contemporary feel to it. The staff is quite nice and helpful, although there seemed to be some confusion about when the subways run. That said, the service was typically excellent. For example, a bellman went out of his way to make sure we made it to the nearby K3 bus to the airport. One note: if taking a taxi in from the airport, it helps to have the directions to the hotel printed out (in Cantonese preferably) as many of the taxi drivers do not yet know the hotel or Prat Avenue. Previous reviews cited a concern about a window to the bathroom: No worries, there are now blinds covering the windows although bathroom doors are quite thin. A note on clothing tailors: We followed a friend's suggestion and a guidebook to nearby Sammy's Tailor and were somewhat disappointed. While competent, the staff did not want to get all of the details correct. If you have been to a top quality tailor, you will not be pleased. For my boyfriend's suit jacket, he was not given a choice of styles and the quality of the liners first offered was like that of a coat bought in a bus station. We had to ask, and pay extra for, a decent lining. For my suit, the staff was not interested in getting the details perfect- They kept arguing that an improper drape or loose fabric was supposed to be that way, but any girl knows better. My off-the-rack suit from Theory fits better than this custom one, even after additional alterations were made when I got home. Their attitude was more that they were doing us a favor by being there. It was not a very customer-friendly or customer-oriented place, BUT my boyfriend did come out of it with some awesome pants. Back to Butterfly on Prat: I would HIGHLY recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, good service! Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: MrsM-7
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the Butterfly on Prat. Rooms are neat. Location is fab! The staff is wonderful. The room was very cold, but we got an extra heater from the hotel which solved the problem. Many nice restaurants around ( Happiness Dim Sum, a small restaurant around the corner on Hart Ave, Tao Hueng etc..). Good places for a massage nearby; Top Comfort, Tai Pai Ref. Body & Foot Center). And I mean real massage for aching muscles. Perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Convienent, good value and clean”
Reviews.Author: Notcomingback
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night as a stop-over on a long journey home. Check in was very efficient and although my room was not ready at around 11am they promised to have the room ready ASAP and when I came back at 2pm (official check-in time) it was all sorted. I had a deluxe room on the 12th floor which faces Pratt street. Very clean and comfortable but very small. Internet was included in the price. Other features were a microwave oven, in-room safe, LCD-TV and bar fridge (but no mini bar) and small work bench. Bed was comfortable. As other writers have noted Pratt St is a very noisy street, with lots of night clubs etc. but I wasn't unduly disturbed at night. Bathroom was small but clean with standard amenities - shower was good and the water pressure strong. I couldn't find a hair dryer in the bathroom nor was there any power plugs so shaving with my electric razor was a bit of a problem! (Or did I just not find them???) I didn't notice any breakfast facilities and others have referred to limited in-room dining service but I'm not sure what this entailed as I couldn't find a menu in my room. Plenty of dining options within metres of the hotel Location is excellent very close to Nathan Road, Star Ferry, MRT stations. Overall a pleasant stay and recommended!

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: starjen
Reviews.Content: Once you enter the hotel premises, you will notice the modern design of reception area and the good scent of air freshener, I really like the scent, its so relaxing... the room is in average sized, but no blackout curtain, its a silhouette type curtain, you can see the sunrise and if its night, I am afraid that its visible from the outside when your lights are on. the bathroom is clean, well equipped room, one thing i do not like here is the key, typical room key, its better if they change it to electronic card which used by most hotels nowadays... the hotel has a good location, its near the MTR, the shopping mall is nearby, five minutes walk to Harbour city mall...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and new rooms.”
Reviews.Author: nicklasi
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Just a few minuts walk to the action in kowloon. The room is nice but was very cold. The heating system was broken when we stayd there and the staff didnt informed us when we checked in which was pretty anoying.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loves_Travel_CA
Reviews.Content: The hotel was definitely not what was expected--though that isn't necessarily good or bad. The room was small (which wasn't necessarily bad, just worth mentioning) and linens were ragged--some minor stains on the white comforter and the towels were shredding on the sides in the bathroom. (The ragged linens bothered me far more than the size of the room.) The hotel seems like it's going to be huge and gorgeous based on the website, but it's not. The lobby area is very small. The staff were helpful enough, though the English spoken was so-so. I couldn't believe no one had mentioned that the "free" shuttle bus to the airport express isn't actually at the hotel--you have to walk with all of your luggage to a stop down the block, around a corner, and down another block to get to it. Plus, the bus never even showed after we did all that, so we wound up in a taxi afterall. Taxi to the station is definitely the way to go and then the airport express from there. You can check your luggage at the airport express station, so that's the best route. The hotel was noisy with construction outside, even though we were on the 10th floor. The area was clubby and there was a lot happening for expats--if that's your scene, great. If not, then it's definitely not the area for you. The hotel is within a quick walk to the metrostation. I'd say it's great for people on a budget who want a clean hotel and who plan on spending most of their time out of the room anyway. For us, this hotel was the last stop on a 24 day trip all over China, so we were probably ready for a bit more luxury. However, considering the prices in Hong Kong, you definitely don't spend as much for this hotel as you would for others in the area. The hotel provides free computers in the lobby with internet access which is a huge plus. There's room service, but a very small, select menu. Laundry in the hotel is expensive. It was a good, budget hotel...though if I had more money, I admit I would have stayed in a different place (whereas with some of the B&Bs we stayed in, money wouldn't have mattered--they were so good that I would say in them regardless).

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel, pretty near to all the action, not sure I'd stay again though”
Reviews.Author: artistoz
Reviews.Content: The hotels trendy, new, clean - but feels a bit 'minimal'. Not sure about the glass wall so that if you're lying in bed you look straight into the shower, and a glass door so you can see the toilet. Depends if thats your thing or not! The in room internet was expensive - although theres a couple of free to use laptops in the foyer. I asked for a high up room on purpose because I knew thered be an amount of street noise - but even on the 18th floor we got woken up often and kept awake by music at the bar outside. The MTR is very close though, as is the shopping and night markets. Star ferry is only 7 minutes or so walk. Make sure you visit Aqua bar on top of number 1 peking road by the way - singularly the bet view I've ever seen from a bar - including those in KL and Bangkok. Get there early and get a table for the 8pm light show! 'First cup coffee' over the road, where you get 10% off on showing the key card, was really good to be honest, despite what it looks like.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel that is great for shopaholics”
Reviews.Author: Gemjewell
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated just 3 min walk of the MTR station, nearby there are lots of local restaurants and you just walk a little bit away to see those shopping malls. There is a karaoke and pub next to it so at night there is a bit noise, but overall the experience is good. Staff are friendly and room is good for 2 people, they only have double bed. Their baby cot is new too. A little downside is the toilet, which seems that the staff didn't clean it properly, but the shower space is ok. Will stay there again for more crazy shopping if I have chance!

Reviews.Title: “Has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Prodessa
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel on the best location possible. Kowloon is from a tourist point of view much nicer to stay then HK island. Rooms are clean and new. Because the serve NO breakfast, the room has a cooker and a microwave. But just go around the corner to have breakfast in one of the bars / restaurants. Recommended !!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel as its brand new”
Reviews.Author: corvinaSingapore
Reviews.Content: excellent hotle stay - brand new rooms and very good ambience...good for honeymooners, as well as newly weds..great interiors..keep it up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Spacious and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Catlazy
Reviews.Content: I do find Butterfly on Prat is valued for money as the room is big in Hong Kong standard. The room is clean maybe because it's new. The hotel lobby may be small but trendy. Location wise, I won't say it's far from MTR stations but still a walking distance. If you are traveling with elderly, you may find this hotel is noisy during night time as there are a few pubs along the street. There's a 24 hours restaurant few doors away, which is convenient and Neway Karaoke is just next door. I'll definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends...

Reviews.Title: “Truly Convenient in a Busy HK City”
Reviews.Author: tripaddicted
Reviews.Content: Butterfly on Prat is located in a dense populated area TST, it has a great transport link from/to airport by bus or MTR. The room was clean, tidy and simple - a door-lock problem was occurred when we stayed there, the door-handle was loosed and the key cannot open the locked door - but it was repaired immediately. There are in-room safe box, refrigerator, microwave, LCD TV and free internet connection for deluxe room (although, there is a problem at the first night which caused us to move to the next door room in order to get a plug-in internet connection). Bathroom was small but clean with standard amenities - rain droop shower was good and the water pressure was strong enough to release your fatigue after long flight trip or a hectic day. Pictures tell us a lot, so trust them :-) - overall, it is a recommended one and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the basics in luxury comfort”
Reviews.Author: DLPA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice for travellers looking for comforts. The bed and hotel was very clean, no funny smells at all, with everything brand new and a luxury showerhead (raindance shower!). Amenities like showergel and shampoo (decent smelling), hairdryers, in-room safe and kettle were available, but unfortunately no bedroom slippers which is a big no-no in my books. The TV was nice and big enough to watch from bed. Downside was the lack of free wired or wireless internet access. If they were catering for business users, this would be a real disadvantage. Don't bother having breakfast included - if it's anything like the room service menu, I wouldn't touch any of it. The location was convenient, close enough to the MTR and Nathan Road. Prat street is a bit sleazy, with several swanky karaoke bars lining the street attracting various young and loutish clientele - can be noisy at night. However it's not dangerous and feels fairly safe both at night and in daytime. The hotel is closer to the main room than Luxe Manor and about 2/3 the price, so it's much more worth it! Overall I wouldn't mind staying here again but I'd have to bring my own bedroom slippers and the lack of free wired internet would put me off. However kudos for the great shower, convenient locations and comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky room, poor service”
Reviews.Author: KAPE9
Reviews.Content: The location was ok. but what was frustrating about my stay in this hotel last month (November 2009) was the way they handled our complaint about the foul smell (human odor) in one of their rooms, probably from a previous guest. The room we checked (2 beds) had a very foul smell! So we asked to be transferred to another room. However, they told us that they can only transfer us to a smaller room with just one bed. Since they made it appear that we had no choice, we agreed and just asked for extra comforter sheet. But what they gave us is an old blanket. It was very poor service! And they should have air purifiers in their room!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Traveller17HongKong
Reviews.Content: I booked BOP upon seeing the numerous raves and the affordable price. I guess I went there with too high expectations and ended up being a tad disappointed with the service provided. Check-in was done efficiently. No complaints there. The lobby smelt wonderful but my room stank of smoke. I realized later its a smoking room so no choice there. The room was of a gd size with basic ammenities provided. Internet access was fast. My grouses: Slippers werent provided. I almost wear slippers around hotel rooms as I feel most guests walk ard the rooms with their foot wear which made me very uncomfortable as to exactly what I was stepping on before I hop onto bed. Hence, I was a little perturbed as to why this wasn't provided. Secondly, the 2 complimentary water bottles provided were only applicable on day 1. I find this a little stingy as most hotels and Im not talking bout 5star hotels actually supply their guests with a daily replenishment of complimentary water. I did call reception to enquire on the 2nd day and on 3rd day, they replenished it for me after which I had already bought 2 huge bottles from 7-11 (waste of time and money). Thirdly, outgoing calls to Hong Kong numbers were chargable at HKD5 per 15mins block. My friends in HK told me usually this is not the case. More often than not, outgoing local calls were complimentary. Even their local mobile calls were free. So I did not get why BOP wanted to charge us. Fourthly, location. It's a double-edged sword here. The location is good, within 5 mins walking distance to MTR but noise at night is really undesirable. The honking of cars and clubbers swearing, cursing, yelling and beer bottles being thrown around could be heard way into the night even when I'm staying on the highest floor! Fifthly, room cleanliness. The towels were clean but they appeared like they have been used umpteen times, a bit dirty looking. I think more bleaching needs to be done. We told the reception to change our towels on the 2nd day and when we returned later in the night, ONLY the towels were changed. The bed was not made and toilet was the way we left it in the morning. I wonder if they misunderstood us. On 1 of the days, we left the room at 10am in the morning. When we decided to return at 1plus in the noon to put down our goodies, the room was still not made even when we did hang the makeup room tag. I was quite surprised there. I guess they are understaffed. In conclusion, my experience at BOP was below par. I probably would try another hotel next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Meg52
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Butterfly for 3 nights, and was really pleased with it. Well located in a lively area, nice room (just as shown on the website), comfortable bed, good shower, helpful staff, free internet access in the lobby. The breakfast wasn't very exciting, but otherwise no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Boutique Hotel in Tsimshatsui, Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: jackson_cecilia10
Reviews.Content: This is my first time in this hotel. A small but colourful lobby with smiling face on all their staffs. The room was spacious and clean, a comfortable bed which liked sleeping in a deluxe or 5* hotel. They got a spacious washroom, I need to highlight the strong water pressure which was one of my concern when staying in a hotel. Although it only have cityview, its location was extremely convenience for me to access different part of HK. Shopping Mall, dining places, bars, subway & pier all were within walking distance. The most important thing was valued-for-money. I paid a 3 to 4* hotel's rate but enjoy a 5* service which I never had this feeling from the same types of hotel I stayed before.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, and great for your money.”
Reviews.Author: iheartsc_01
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel past midnight, and I was happy to find that our check in information was there and was correct (we made our booking through a third party website). Upon entering the room, I was pleased to find that the room and bathroom looked exactly like it did in the website pictures. The room was clean, the bed was big and comfortable, and the closet was pretty (the lights came on when you opened the sliding doors). Sidenote: there weren't any flat sheets on the bed, but we found that this was the same at the Venetian in Macau and in another hotel we stayed at in Wanchai. Our room also came with an safe and a hairdryer, both which are essential when we travel. We stayed at BOP for three nights and then in Wanchai for two nights at another hotel. I would highly recommend staying in Butterfly on Prat. The location was great (just a few blocks from the hustle and bustle of Nathan Road), and for the price (it came out to $90 USD per night) this hotel cannot be beat. Hotel staff was very helpful in writing down menu items in Chinese and making dinner reservations. If they keep their prices reasonable, I will definitely stay at another Butterfly when we return to Hong Kong. We saved our money for eating and shopping! :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the thick of Kowloon - well appointed”
Reviews.Author: nbason
Reviews.Content: If you want a budget price hotel with high standards of cleanliness and good service, this is it. Our room on 11th floor had twice weekly linen changes and always was well cleaned. Daily bottled water and free use of computer in the foyer were nice touches. Do beware, as this hotel is in a lively area of Kowloon, it means it gets noisy at 4am when the clubs kick out. Otherwise location couldn't have been better; no views but how long can you spend looking out of your hotel room in HK when there's so much to see and do outside? One of a chain in HK - others not tried, but I guess similarly appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel for decent price”
Reviews.Author: misstokyo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as the sister hotel (on Morrison) was booked. I took the Airport Express to Kowloon Station and the free shuttle bus from there to a hotel around the corner - very quick and convenient. Upon check-in I was upgraded from a superior room to a deluxe room without asking. The room was spacious and clean and although it seemed to be missing a few amenities, I'm confident they would be sent up if I had called for them. The bed was large and comfortable and the room had huge floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom was large and bright and the only see-through door was that to the shower, not to the bathroom itself. The shower tiles could probably be scrubbed more often but for the price how picky can you be? The computers in the lobby were great for checking email and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful when I encountered them. They also made sure I was in a cab safely when I headed to Butterfly on Morrison for the rest of my stay. The taxi was only 80 or 90 HKD if I recall and was the best option as I didn't want to lug my suitcase on the MTR. The nearest MTR station is really close, 5 minutes on foot or 10 if you take granny steps. Overall I was impressed by the hotel and thought that what I got was equal to or more than what I paid. I got a better rate for the sister hotel, so would recommend staying there if you're looking to save a few bucks (booked both on agoda).

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: gleb90210
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatelly could not experience full range of hospitality of the hotel. On arrival it appeard that though our booking record is confirmed there is no availble rooms for that day. Staff asked us to go the sister hotel "on Morrison" (not even offering any transportation - we actually arrived at midnight) and then "to come back tomorrow", otherwise cancellation fee will be charged for "no show". 30 mins of argue - we had to grad taxi and go to that sister hotel. Only thing we managed is to agree that they will not charge "cancellation fee"; no word is that this mess was caused by their side. Terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, shame about the sheets”
Reviews.Author: arsenalfan888
Reviews.Content: The Good: -Very helpful and polite reception staff who are only too willing to help. -Very pleasant smelling reception -Location wise is very good as it's near to TST MTR station, Nathan Road and ALOT of restaurants. -Free internet access , although there is always a wait for the two laptops The Bad: -The area can become very seedy at night with girls hanging outside of bars and is always noisy with music, especially at night. -Questionable stains on bed sheets Overall our stay was good but wasn't all smooth; we had a room right next door to the karaoke bar and could hear the music throughout the day and night, luckily we were able to sleep through this. However if you are a light sleeper I would ask for a room located in the middle or the other side of the bar. Was not best pleased with the cleanliness of the bed; woke up one morning with bites all down both legs. Also noticed stains on the sheets and had to ask for the sheets to be changed. Also if you are on the tall side you may find the bed a little small (we even had the queen size bed) On the plus side lots of pillows which are very soft. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for families; but if your young and looking for value for money then this is the hotel for you, as the price is reasonable for its central location.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Dziadziu
Reviews.Content: Mr. Ng and his staff@ the Butterfly were so gracious and more than helpful during our visits to Hong Kong. A great hotel for short term stays (the rooms are a bit smaller than north american averages) which might concern some visitors. I am disabled and all my needs were positively addressed---stayed in room 708 which was great and on the back of the hotel (no street noise).While we were on a side trip to Phuket they gladly stored luggage for us.Unfortunately the breakfast that could be included was a disappointment. My wife & I are looking forward to another adventure to S.E.Asia and another wonderful experience @ The Butterfly!!! Thank you all again for everything!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “complaints i don't understand”
Reviews.Author: krispykream
Reviews.Content: first off.. if you ever stayed in a hotel in manhattan in the price range of usd$300 to $400, you would not be complaining about Butterfly..same with Singapore..and many other cities in europe, such as Madrid.. so now the complaints and malicious comments from all these people here 1. Glass panel in washroom: this hotel has only one bed in all the rooms.. so you are obviously sharing the room with someone very close..do you research if you don't know about the glass panel, and decide if you want that kind of layout or not.. you should not be complaining after.. 2. too far from MTR: Are you kidding me? Are you kidding me? there is no such thing as too far from public transit in HK! it is so close to MTR, even a disabled person can crawl to the nearest MTR is less than 10 mins.. so people, don't lie.. use google map and do your homework..or pick a hotel that is built above an mtr station! 3. room is dirty, no clean towels: that is BS, just call the front desk, tell them, and they will fix it...this is a hotel, the maids are not your mom.. 4. area too busy: i would rather stay in a area that is busy and people are still walking on the street 2am .. you know why? that means that area is safe! 5. Hotel room too small: hello! the size of the hotel room is bigger than most apartment sfor a family of 4 in HK.. hello, this in HK, real estate is a premium..you think you get a hotel room this size in downtown manhattan? tokyo? for $100 usd a night?? with free internet? brand new? 6. no hair dryer idiot, the hair dryer is in the drawer

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: hydehaven
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights and it was our refuge from the busy streets of Kowloon. Despite being in a shopping, restaurant and pub area our room was cozy and quiet. We had a room on the back side and had no street noise. We found the staff to be very attentive and pleasant, always quick to open the door and greet our arrival and departure. The glass bathroom door is a bit odd but we were reading the newspaper and a real estate story profiled a luxury suite with all glass bathroom walls. Maybe it's more common in Hong Kong than we think. The hotel is close to the MTR, ferry and waterfront and proved to be an excellent base for our exploration of Kowloon and Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Bad rooms. Worse Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Buddhakkan
Reviews.Content: If there is one hotel I will never go back to it is Butterfly on Prat. I had initially (on reading reviews on this site) booked the hotel for three nights; later on a friend's recommendation and also from hotel reviews I booked " The Mira" on TST; and thank heavens for that. We still booked this hotel for one night between our trip to Macau and our stay at Disney. The hotel staff tells you its a less than 5 mins walk from the MTR but be ready for at least a 10 min walk through a not so good lane. The hotel rooms are SMALL we just had 2 cabin bags and there was hardly enough space to fit those in. The room was freezing cold, though there is a temperature control it didnt seem to work, the room was equally freezing at 30deg as it was at 18 deg celcius. On requesting the staff for another room the only solution they could come up with was to turn off the aircon.. on telling them it would be suffocating they sent us blankets... Can some one explain to them people dont sleep in the room always ( or maybe thats the kind of clientele this hotel gets). Finally they gave us heaters to heat the room which made matters worse. Lets talk about the rooms... the bath room has a transparent door... but that does not serve any purpose apart from your roommate getting a clear view of you answering nature calls. It is not in the line of sight of the television which is the primary purpose for having transparent bathroom walls. The bathroom was dirty had hair and grout everywhere. The towels were dirty. The curtains were torn and had stains. The room looked into the building in front so you had to keep the curtains shut at all times. There are some good points on this hotel though... it is in a bylane of TST so lots of eating and shopping options around. It has a small microwave in the room which definately helps people who have dietary restrictions. I did not have the inclination to try any of its other facilities and checked out at 9AM. BoP is like an very expensive student's boarding. I would suggest if you are spening over HK$900 per night ( thats what I paid); pay HK$100 more and get a better hotel... TST has pleanty of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Not so fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Ri_Sun8
Reviews.Content: I arrived an hour earlier and although checking in was relatively easy for me, it was not so for another guest who seemed to have arrived much earlier but was still struggling to get his room. The staff at the lobby was sometimes friendly, sometimes not. I overheard some negative comments made about the other guests by the staff in Cantonese at the lobby; this was totally not professional. Room was small, the smallest room I’ve ever stayed in Hong Kong, but still fairly alright if you are staying only for one or two nights alone or with a partner. Previous reviews are correct; the transparent and un-lockable toilet door can be quiet a problem. I find the toilet sink a little too shallow, water keeps spilling out of the sink, making a mess on the counter which I really didn’t quite like. During my stay many of the common hotel room amenities were missing, I have to called housekeeping for my bedroom slippers, toothbrush, etc; this was not a good experience when you came back into the room late in the night to find missing amenities. The walls were paper thin; I can constantly hear the opening and closing of doors as well as the TV shows my neighbors were watching, not a pleasant experience when you’re trying to get some sleep. The bed was not really bad, but neither was it fantastic. Location wise, the hotel is a walk-able distance from the MTR, with many eateries around the corner. There are many other good hotels around the area, so unless you have a special discount perhaps you may want to consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: TetleyJeff
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 15th floor room at Butterfly on Prat for 4 nights late October 2009. This boutique style hotel is located on Prat Avenue which is a fairly busy street in Kowloon with numerous shops, restaurants and pubs nearby. The room was a good size for one or two people and was very well appointed and clean. The room had a plasma TV with satellite channels, bar fridge and safe. The bed and pillows were ultra comfortable which is important to me when I travel. The bathroom was fresh, large and beautifully decorated. The view out the window wasn’t great but not an issue for me. The hotel itself was quiet during the night however there was a bit of noise from the street (even up on the 15th floor) during the night however as a light sleeper I used earplugs which worked well. The Star Ferry is only a 10 minute walk from the hotel and the fantastic shops of Nathan Road only a 2 or 3 minute walk. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. If you like Japanese food there is a nice restaurant outside the front of the hotel serving good quality Japanese food. I would definitely stay at Butterfly on Prat again and would recommend it to couples of all ages and solo people travelling for pleasure or business.

Reviews.Title: “nice budget hotel in good kowloon location, but not ideal.”
Reviews.Author: blubs99
Reviews.Content: This is a nice budget boutique hotel in a hip kowloon location with lots of restaurants and clubs close by. Rooms are clean but very simple and not great amenities...NO electrical outlet in the bathroom so no hair drier! The shower and bathroom sink provide no privacy since they have windows directly into the bedroom area. OK for a single traveler but no privacy for multiple guests. The bed and pillows were definitely not the quality level I am used to in other HK hotels, such as Marco Polo and Royal Garden and Langham (all naturally more expensive). If the price is similar I would select the Panorama Hotel around the corner. I was on the 13th floor and heard alot of street noise, but not too loud, and no noise could be heard from the next rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foodsmarts3301
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very well appointed, comfortable and amazingly quiet. Shower is particularly nice with plenty of hot water and large shower heads. Flat screen TV with DVD player. Staff is very courteous and helpful. Our room came with breakfast which is handled by the Japanese restaurant in the same building. The breakfast was complete including eggs cooked to order a choice of breakfast meat and potatoes. If the breakfast isn't to your liking, there's a coffee shop right across the street with a variety of breakfast combination plates. A Deli France is also across the street. The hotel is well located within a short walking distance of many major tourist destinations. I'd stay there again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Problems but staff did their best”
Reviews.Author: LPass16
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights here and have to say first that the rooms are gorgeous. large, spacious, free fruit in the mornings etc. Very nice. We had a number of problems including cigarette smoke coming in from the air con. They asked us if we wanted to move room which we agreed to, but the room they moved us to was half the size of the first room. We kicked up a fuss in the end because they wouldn't accept why we weren't happy paying the same rate for a half size room. After 30mins of angry conversations, suddently a room similar to our first room came available. We were furious - felt like we'd been tried to be ripped off, how much would it have taken them to move us to that room in the first place? when we'd paid for a larger room? That issue aside the hotel after that were very helpful with our questions and queries, and even brought earplugs to our room for the noise and didn't charge us. free wifi in the room is also good and computers downstiars if you dnt have a laptop. The location was very very busy and very noisy at night. earplugs helped but i'd recommend staying elsewhere location-wise if you odn't like the husstle and busstle, travel into it when you want to go, don't stay in it. all in all, very nice room, mix of staff service but I think they generally did their best to help with the issues that arose.

Reviews.Title: “Terrfic hotel! Value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: graceux5
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms from Sept 18th - 22nd. My 7 year old niece travelled with us. Everything about this hotel was excellent except for the transparent bathroom doors. Strategically located at the Tsim Tsha Tsui area. Just a few minutes walk from the TST MTR station. Loads of restraurants, convenience stores and shops nearby. You'd be able to get food almost 247. I got a pretty good deal from asiatravel.com . It was almost half the price of other renowned hotels. My 7 year old niece left her face towel that resembled the hotel's in the room and we suspect the housekeeping staff accidently cleared it. When we highlighted this to the hotel staff, they were apologetic and brought my niece a cute little rubber ducky. I think it was a nice gesture even though we couldn't really blame the hotel for misplacing my niece's face towel. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable.Would definitely stay here again the next time I'm back in HK.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel, boutique, fresh and vibrant. AWESOME VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: cpeden1971
Reviews.Content: It was this site and its reviews that gave me the confidence to spend $100 Australian Dollars to book a room at the Butterfly on Prat in HK. Now - I am the sort of traveler that normally always travels for business - where the company puts you up at one of the "supposedly Swank hotel chains" that quite frankly - always seem to disappoint and fail to deliver. Let me tell you friends, it's time to think again. The Butterfly on Prat (BOF) welcomed me after a short and cheap taxi ride from the Kowloon Airport Express Station. If you have a few $$ dont even bother with the bus - for under $10 I was there, unruffled and safe. The bellhop whisked my bags away and I was met by the pleasant staff who swiftly booked me in. To my surprise I was upgraded. Suggest you follow my lead and write "High Floor - low noise - need rest" on your booking form. I noticed some previous travelers complained about noise. Nothing could have been further from my experience. Fresh colours, Flat panel LCD and DVD player, free high speed internet, delightful bed, standard late checkout of 12 noon (awesome!) and a wonderful bathroom. Seriously I had to pinch myself that this was not costing me $350+ per night. As for location, great spot. In 5 mins I was on Nathan Road, Star Ferry, Knutsford Tce and surrounds just minutes from your doorstep. MTR station A2 takes you wherever you want to go. Bravo Butterfly on Prat ! I look forward to future experiences. I hope you grow and prosper.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel - great for the $$”
Reviews.Author: emilykwan321
Reviews.Content: Was on a business trip where my husband tagged along. Excellent boutique hotel, modern furnishings, clean and great location close to MTR. Hotel service was fantastic - helpful, friendly and efficient. Lobby smells great. Indeed, great value!! Thanks to Trip Advisor for helping me find this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money, Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Murad76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Butterfly at Prat for 4 nights. The location of the hotel is not in a glitzy part of town but rather a bustling shopping area, bars and some clubs. Several subway entrances are only a couple of minutes walk. Despite the area being busy and noisy, its very quite inside the hotel. The room are clean, small but classy and adequate. The bathroom is very spacious, the sink was however very low and quite small - a minor problem. The staff was very polite and responsive throughout the stay. You cannot get the same quality accomodations for this this kind of money.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, HIdden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Sue_Simplicity
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel while i was browsing through the Tripadvisor. At that point of time, there were not many reviews.. But still decide to go ahead with it. The hotel was easy to find, near the convenience store, food outlets..and MTR. The staff are quiet professional, the room is fabulous! It comes with microwave, mini-fridge, DVD player, safe. Only problem is the bathroom. It has a clear glass view. So if you're not travelling with your spouse or partner, it might get uncomfortable and awkward. Other than that, I would definite come back again to this hotel whenever I go HK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Danidive
Reviews.Content: Very good value Hotel right in the middle of Tssi Tsha tsui. If you are looking for a luxury hotel do not go there.... but is you look for a nice and affordable one, this is a good choice. The only bad point is that during the week end the area is very noisy and you will not have a good sleep. Very good 24h restaurant just few steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value for Money - Small but Perfectly Formed!”
Reviews.Author: Laineylop
