Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute trip to Hong Kong for the beginning of September 2009 as we got great flight prices with Emirates. Normally our hotel choice is very well researched and booked months in advance, but on this occasion we had to make a very quick decision. We chose BoP on the strength of the reviews here and the Tsim Sha Tsui location, and we were not disappointed! BoP appears to be part of the small, growing Butterfly chain. The hotel guest facilities are minimal (on site-gym, restaurant and free internet via 2 laptops in the lobby) and the lobby is tiny, but that is the reason why this hotel offers incredible value for money. If BoP had more extensive facilities then this hotel would be charging much higher prices in line with the 4 star type places we have stayed before in other cities, which offer more facilities but the rooms were far less attractive than BoP. We booked via Agoda which seemed to be offering the best rates for our stay. We stayed in a standard room and whilst it was small (but reasonable by HK standards from what I understand here), the space was maximised and the room was equipped with everything we needed for a city break base, although an iron would have been useful (I'm sure if we had requested it from reception we would have got an iron, as they were very helpful). The room had a microwave for those wanting to rustle up a quick snack, but we didn't see the need as the hotel was surrounded by bars, cafes / restaurants and had a 7-Eleven store at the street corner. As mentioned by other reviewers, the hotel is either new or has recently been refurbished this year, so the room fixtures and fittings are new. I read a review here suggesting problems with the Air Conditioning; we had no such problems. The A/C was excellent which was essential for us being 2 Scots visiting HK in peak summer humidity. In terms of the location, it was perfect for us tourists. We found our barings very quickly and really welcomed being close to TST MTR station (and its link to East TST MTR), not just for travel but for using the air conditioned underground passages to escape the summer humidity. BoP is on Prat Avenue and is part of a triangle of streets which has various late night bars, restaurants, cafes, etc. We had no problems with the noise at all. I read here that this area could be intimidating at night, but I would disagree with this. We came back to the hotel pretty late during our stay and didn't consider safety to be an issue at all. Please note that the Airport Express bus no longer stops opposite BoP at the Guandong Hotel, but it does stop a couple streets away at the Park Hotel. A very quick walk, even with luggage (and I don’t travel light). Overall, I would highly recommend Butterfly on Prat as an excellent base for a city break / sightseeing visit to Hong Kong. As first time visitors it met our needs perfectly and the price represents exceptional value for money. Granted the hotel may not have the views and the facilities, but to me this was more than compensated for by the rooms, the great service and the convenient TST location.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DickieMoules
Reviews.Content: After searching various websites for reviews and prices, I settled on Butterfly on Prat. A great decision. This place is about $20 US above the price of a hostel room for 2 people, but is a wonderful place to stay. The location is great the rooms are very clean and tidy and the service is Impeccable (Andy was a star). The Internet is free and pretty fast although wired LAN only, no wifi, however they do also have 2 laptops in reception for customers use. This place is without question the best value for money you will find in Hong Kong, Sunday to Thursday anyway as Friday and saturday the price jumps a bit. We would have given it a perfect score, but our only issue was with the humidity in the room. The carpet and bedding felt damp all the time due to the humidity in the Hong Kong air, we spoke to reception and they showed us 2 other rooms, but they were exactly the same. We eventually had to use a heater and the A/C!!!!! Not very Environmentally friendly, to try and solve the problem. I wasn't so bothered by it, but my wife was. The staff did go out of their way to help solve the issue though and we still had a great stay. We would just recommend that the hotel invest in a few De-humidifiers for the guests that really need them. Highly recommend this place though. If you've got 100's of dollars free to spend per night then maybe you want to enjoy the really tall hotels with the view, but if you're looking more at $55 US per night and want a lovely, clean well located room with great service, this is your place. P.S. A few doors down on Prat Avenue is a place called "Ebeneezers", the place doesn't look much byut has really nice good quality, value for money food. Enjoy HK, Richard

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: alsbrew
Reviews.Content: After reading and asking questions here in Tripadvisor and HK forum...we cancelled our room we already reserved in Wanchai area and booked Butterfly with asiatravel.com. Location, just a 5 minutes walk from the nearest MTR, we took the A21 bus from the airport and I think they changed the bus route in reverse. No more Airport Express K3 bus stop in Guadong hotel it is already in Park Hotel next block. It's a bit noisy at night awaken by honks and sirens but it's normal in nightlife area. Cleanliness, The lobby is small and very modern..very welcoming scent and nice cool after walking from the HK heat. The room is Clean..microwave, ref and flatscreen TV. Bathroom water pressure is good. Value, we got the 2 +1night with asiatravel.com...I think it's a good deal. Service, 5 Star! this guy Mr. Andy helped carry our luggage and you can ask him anything about food,shopping, etc...he will answer and ready to help. I will stay with Prat again...No question.

Reviews.Title: “No regrets...”
Reviews.Author: SohLee
Reviews.Content: If you are a international luxurious chain lover, please leave this page and hunt for other hotels. This hotel is an absolute no frills hotels with excellent services and feeling of being at home. Hotel lobby: Small but comfortable lobby. Nice aromatic smell upon entering the hotel lobby. Hotel staff is always on standby to open the doors for you. Few chairs in hotel lobby but you wouldnt be sitting there anyway unless you are waiting for something. Has 2 laptop near the lifts for guests' use. Only 2 lifts to serve the whole hotel but there are fast enough. You only need to wait less than 5 mins for lift to move from Ground Floor till 16th floor. Check-in: Procedures as per other hotels. Passports, credit card or cash. Please note that if paing via cash, there will be a deposit of 750HKD which will be refunded to you upon check out. After checkin, there will be a friendly hotel staff who is on standby to help you with luggage and introduce you the amenities in the hotel and room. Rooms: Its probably one of the biggest superior room in Hong Kong. Its size as I was informed is 24sqm. It has a spacious bathroom (note: As mentioned in too many reviews that the door of the bathroom is transparent, so please think of your comfort level with your sleeping partner before booking) too with rainforest shower head. Comes with toiletries who are being topped up only when half finished (which is good environmentally). Towels are changed everyday but bedsheets are changed on Mon, Wed, Fri and Sun and upon request (environmentally friendly). Has a empty mini fridge for you to store food and a microwave to heat food up. Room comes with safe (but note that the safe is pretty small – my laptop of 14” has prob getting in and out of it) and has pretty decent number of hangers to hang your clothes. It has a work desk by the side of the bed. In-room internet is not wireless but LAN cable is provided in the room. Bed is soft and comfy but pillow is a tad too soft for my liking. Aircon is controlled via in-room individual control unlike some hotels where they are controlled centrally. House keeping is prompt and good. If you happen to be in your room, they will drop you a note to inform you that they have been here but you have set your room mode to “Do Not Disturb”. Tv has good selection of TV channels to keep you occupied – esp loved the 24 hours non-stop movie channel. Amenities: Been to the gym – 1 threadmill, 1 stationery bicycle, 1 gym ball and a rack of weights. Not the fanciful gym facilities you find in big hotels but sufficient for people who are serious about exercising during holiday. Gym has a TV, Hi-fi set, water dispenser and vending machine to buy drinks should you need any. Towels are also available in the gym so you need not bring along your room towel. No pool. Has a affiliated restaurant which serves room service to your room but trust me, the Cha Chan Ting around the hotels are good enough… Staff: Nothing but praises for them. Dedicated to making you feel at home. Even the chambermaids greet you along the corridor when they sees you. Location of Hotel: Distance to TST MTR: 500m or approx 5 mins walk. Distance to Cameron Road: 200m or approx 2 mins walk Distance to Granville Road: 500m or approx 5 mins walk Distance to Nathan Road: 500m or approx 5 mins walk Distance to Macau-China Ferry Terminal: Not sure how long but its approx 15 mins walk Distance to Star Ferry Terminal: Approx 10 mins walk Distance to Avenue of Star: Approx 10 mins walk There are plenty of eateries around the hotels and all are reasonably priced. Please take note if you are a small eater cos their portion is big. It is also a shopping haven esp in Granville Road where you can find many hip shops selling the latest fashion clothings. For the upmarket shopping, Nathan Road is close by, so it Habour City. Taxi is not a prob. There is always no lack of one at the doorstep. A number of KTV lounges surrounding the hotel as well but be assured that its not those sleazy KTV pubs – at least its not sleazy looking outside. Should you have the hunger prangs in the middle of the night, eateries are opened till approx 2am and 7-11 and K-Circle is conveniently located 100m away from the hotel. Overall, I would say I am very satisfied with my choice of hotel and it is definitely worth the money paid for (less than S$100 per night). I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: roosterza
Reviews.Content: We found the Butterfly on Prat on tripadvisor and, based on other reviews, booked it, as we got a very good rate on ebookers. We were greeted warmly by the staff, our bags were brought in for us, and we were given the keys to our non-smoking room on the 17th floor. The room was small, but adequately sized, with a wardrobe with hanging space and an electronic safe, a microwave, a refrigerator, shelves, a television, a dvd player, a desk and a comfortable double bed with clean bedding. The bathroom contained a clean and spacious shower, basin and toilet, and complimentary toiletries which were replenished each day. The air-conditioning in the hotel and the room worked excellently and were always very welcome after a day's sight-seeing in the August heat of Hong Kong. The staff were helpful when questioned about things like public transport and local attractions, and were always friendly. We wouldn't recommend eating in the restaurant adjacent to the hotel entrance (which is advertised in the hotel folder in the room), as the prices are quite steep for Hong Kong, but there are plenty of options locally as the hotel is close to TST station, Nathan Road and the waterfront. We had a very pleasant and comfortable stay at the Butterfly on Prat, were well cared for by the staff, and would happily recommend it to others (and have already done so).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: globeteller
Reviews.Content: Butterfly on Prat is a tiny but well designed hotel in central Hongkong. We enjoyed the thorough makeover they had given the building and all the service was excellent. The designers has been to provide as much quality light into a tiny space as possible and you don't feel how small it actually is if you don't try to imagine the floor plan. To further obtain a light and airy feel they had incorporated glass panels between the shower and bathroom into the main room. This is both fun and alright (if you are a couple well at ease) but actually the glass door right left of the toilet seat almost call for odd situations. Most of us are used to solid doors for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Butterfly On Prat, HK”
Reviews.Author: Memoire
Reviews.Content: We came to know about this hotel through recommendation from my sister. Without fail, Butterfly has impressed us deeply with their excellent service from its staff (they are always humble and polite, always seeing them with a smile on their face and speak good english too. Even the chambermaids greeted us wherever we see them in the hotel.) and their room (its modernly decorated, nice ambience, room and bathroom are very clean, overall we felt very comfortable.) On top of the above, we can further comment that they have made good effort in every aspect eg. nice scented aroma everytime you step into the hotel, they tried to upgrade us from a superior to deluxe room once they knew we are there for honeymoon, rendered fast service when a request was made like requesting for slippers - surprisingly delivered in less than 3 minutes and our last minute request in making up our room during late afternoon hours etc). All in all, making a memorable stay for every customer. I would say that this is the best hotel we have ever stayed in and we strongly recommend Butterfly On Prat to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, would return without hesitation.”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBlackAdder
Reviews.Content: After looking at many different hotels, I picked the Butterfly on Prat and I'm glad I did. Booked through Asiatravel.com on a stay 2 nights, get 1 night free package. Total came to $1400 HKD for the 3 nights. If you take the Airport Express train to Kowloon station, follow the signs for the free shuttle bus and board bus K3. This will drop you off at the Park Hotel 1 block further up Chatham Rd from Prat Avenue, an easy 3 minute walk. Check in was very quick. Instead of a magnetic keycard you see everywhere else, you get an actual key. A very nice touch in the otherwise tiny lobby was 2 laptops for general use. Decent sized room with a very comfortable double bed, LCD TV about 24" wide and very fast free internet access. Great staff always willing to help. Nice bathroom with a huge shower, nice amenities. The only downside to the hotel is the restaurant, give it a miss, at least for breakfast. Great location for shopping and partying. MTR station about a 5 minute walk away, many bars and restaurants in close proximity

Reviews.Title: “great price and location!!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly_0197
Reviews.Content: the location is great!...the rooms are small, but very clean...i was just disappointed with their buffet breakfast..(very few choices..and 1 time they served us set breakfast only instead of buffet)..the owner of the restaurant is not friendly and accomodating...i suggest you eat outside the hotel..delifrance is just across the street...but overall, i love to stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Classy small hotel”
Reviews.Author: joffa777
Reviews.Content: Stayed only 2 nights, wish we could have stayed longer. A little difficult to find intially but discovered the location was very convenient to the MTR, shops and restaurants. Short trip to ferry terminals. Easy access to most places by MTR. Initial impressions were great after the modern reception area, warm welcome from the doorman and reception staff. Easy reception, delighted to accept an upgrade to deluxe. Rooms were of a reasonable size considering reports we had read of small hong kong hotel rooms. Bathroom in our room had visible (coloured) panel to the shower,visible from the bed, the other room our companions had the glass was more discrete. The bathroom (shower only, no bath) was quite large, excellent fittings, glass shower enclosure, all usual supplies, fluffy quality towels. Bed was soft, this was important to us coming from 3 weeks in Cambodia, laos and China. Extra pillows on the bed. Flat screen TV with DVD player. Fridge (no mini bar). Large wardrobe with own combination safety box. Microwave, Tea 7 coffeee requirements. Everything about this hotel was class! The staff were well trained, courteous and friendly. Free internet access on two laptops in the lobby. I cannot recommend this hotel enough, probably the best hotel we have stayed in, specially in the price range. We paid HK$500 per night, it may be extra for Saturday nights.

Reviews.Title: “great room, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: myatienza
Reviews.Content: My friend and I planned on vacationing in HK for our birthdays so i searched asiatravel.com for a hotel to stay at which is comfortable and accessible to shopping and train stations because we chose not to travel on a tour package. butterfly on prat had a promo that if you stay for three nights, the 3rd night is free. after reading the reviews on tripadvisor.com about this hotel, i reserved a room for the 3-night promo. what a great bargain. the money spent was worth it. from the airport, we used hong kong express to get to kowloon (HKD 90, but if you buy a return its worth 160 HKD). at the kowloon station, we rode the free K3 shuttle bus which stops at park hotel at cameron road. we walked a very short one block to prat ave where butterfly is at. its right across guang dong hotel. we got a bit lost because the entrance to the hotel is a bit tiny. nonetheless, even though it has a small reception area, it was clean and smelled really good. we didnt have a problem with checking in as it was fast, though we didnt get our room right away because we checked in early, around 10am, check in is at 2pm. though we didnt get our room right away, we were still able to stick to our travel schedule as they held our luggages for us for free. the room is really stylish (we got the queen deluxe). the interior design was impressive, i think it's because its a new hotel, which means that it has a modern. updated look. it has a small walk in closet, lots and lots of storage, an LCD tv, a dvd player, a dryer. it has an empty frig which is great because there's plenty of room to put bottled water and takeout food. it has a microwave and electric kettle for cofee or tea. the tv has a good set of channels. the hotel replenishes the bottled water everyday, among others. the bed was very comfortable although the pillows were a bit soft for me. it has an extension for charging electronic gadgets but if you need more, you can just request for one for free. my only issue with the room, like the others, was the restroom. although the restroom has a really neat design, the glass windows, walls and doors was a concern (though not upsetting). if you're traveling as a couple this is a great room, but if you're traveling with friends, a compromise may be needed. there is no toothbrush provided by the hotel, so bring your own. nevertheless, the location was great. the mtr is a 5-7 minute walk from the hotel. we always alight at tsim sha tsui station exit A2. it's by humpreys road. since it's near the mtr station, its accessible to all the good shopping locations like mongkok, yau ma tei, jordan. it's also a walking distance from nathan road. around the hotel there are various 7-11s and quite a number of places to eat at. overall, it was a great place and i will come back again to the same hotel when i'm in hong kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location except for the see-through bathroom”
Reviews.Author: AhJie
Reviews.Content: Booked Butterfly on Prat through AsiaTravel and got a good deal at HKD450 per night. Everything about this hotel is great except for the see-through bathroom. I would have been more comfortable if the bathroom does not have translucent glass panel. Had to request hotel staff to bring up the bedroom slipper as it was not readily available in our room. Overall this is a very nice hotel to stay in and the room is quite spacious. Location is excellent which is about 5 mins walk to TST MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Staff, but Housekeeping could be better”
Reviews.Author: wfeo
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay very much, as 90% of the staff at the reception, and the bell boys were very friendly and helpful. I am pleasantly suprised at the standard of their service level, for a new hotel. Saw them handling a few difficult and unreasonable customers, and they did well. The location of the hotel is good. With whatever you want, is near you. Being near to Tsim Sha Tsui is useful, as you can reach many places of interest, within walking distance. The rooms are new, and I personally like the spacious and well-designed bathroom. Was disappointed with the housekeeping. They did not wash our glasses, used the night before. They did not even tug the bedsheets in, as they were supposed to. They also did not refill or replace new shower gel, when they were used. I will return to stay again, if I am on a trip which I am not willing to spend too much on accommodation. :)

Reviews.Title: “Superb...”
Reviews.Author: Vijeolook
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and sincerely regretted that it was not for longer. :-( As with many Hong Kong hotels, the rooms are not large, but so wonderfully decorated that it feels much more than just a room - a mini apartment and a home from home. Even Ikea could take a few lessons from the decor! The staff were great too, no need to waste your money on a Lonely Planet Hong Kong guide... Only regret is that I do not have enough money to go back to Hong Kong in time for the opening of the two new "Butterfly" hotels, "Butterfly on Morrison" and "Butterfly on Wellington" later this year (2009).

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtovar20
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. Great restaurants, shopping, near the subway station, very clean, nice rooms... couldn't say enough. We were only there for 2 nights but when I go back will definitely stay for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer07
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here...I stayed in the Deluxe Queen. I requested a nonsmoking room in a higher floor, I think I was on floor 16. Pros: Water everyday, fridge, and microwave were excellent for the budget traveler. The price deal I got through Asia hotels was incredible with my 3rd night stay free. Staff was very friendly and helpful. As a previous poster said, the decor is cheerful, which makes it a nice place to stay. Bed/sheets/pillows all comfortable and clean, water pressure was great. The location was excellent; really excellent. Cons: -I'm not sure if internet used to be free here, but they charge for it now. I think that is standard for most hotels and it was considerable more reasonably priced than at some other hotels. (Note: there was an unsecured network I was able to access from most everywhere in Hong Kong free of charge). -The see-through bathroom is only the really big minus for me (and it would be so easy to fix, Butterfly! Even if you just sprayed the frost glass stuff over the windows). I was staying alone, so it wasn't a big deal, but I'm not sure if I would really want to stay here with anyone I didn't feel entirely comfortable sharing all of my bathroom habits with (and that is no one). -I had my laptop, so again, not a problem for me, but the little area where you could access a computer in the lobby didn't look particularly comfortable. -There was still noticeable street noise and I was in a higher level room. With earplugs, it wasn't a problem. -The curtains/blinds are relatively see through as well, so the light shines in your room in the morning, which can be a problem if you're recovering from jet lag or if you sleep during the day. Again, I travel with an eye cover, so this wasn't really a problem for me. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Butterfly very much, and if traveling alone again, I will definitely stay here again. Let me know when the bathroom issue is fixed, and I'll bring my husband.

Reviews.Title: “I ♥ Butterfly on Prat!”
Reviews.Author: Halo23
Reviews.Content: I live in China and go to HK regularly to update my visa, so I've stayed at Butterfly on Prat twice now and will definitely be doing so again. When you arrive at the hotel there is always someone to greet you at the door. When you walk into the lobby you'll notice a really unique (and very pleasant) smell. Check in both times for me has been quick and smooth. One time, my partner and I didn't have our passports as we had already been to the visa office but we had no trouble checking in with other photo id and by presenting the credit card i booked with (along with the booking receipt). Also recently, we arrived early (around 10.30am) and they checked us in straight away even though check in is usually at 2pm AND upgraded us! I've stayed in both the deluxe and superior rooms. I can't say there is much difference between the two other than the view. I think the website states there is about a 5 sq m difference or so but I hardly noticed that. Since the hotel only opened last December everything still seems new. I thought the room size was generous for HK. You might think it is small, but remember hotel rooms are generally tiny in HK (and i have stayed in some tiny rooms there!) so you'll just have to take my word on it. The queen size bed is one of the softest i have slept in (in HK), the pillows are also soft. If you need firm pillows for a good nights rest this is not the place for you. Like another reviewer pointed out the only problem with the rooms are the bathroom windows. Since my first stay, they have installed a blind on the clear glass window; however, the sliding door still has uncovered clear panels. But if you're not entering/exiting or using the wardrobe at the time someone is on the crapper you shouldn't have a problem. The room comes with en empty mini bar fridge. Which is great as you can lots of things in there if you need. The room also comes with a kettle, microwave, tea, coffee and a dvd player. The bathroom amenities include shower cap, vanity kit, sanitary bag, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and bath gel of which the last four smell divine. However, I noticed there are no toothbrushes provided, so it would be a good idea to remember to bring your own or by one at the local 7/11. The hotel has a small gym; however, i can't comment as I have yet to have time to inspect it. There are also two restaurants, one Japanese and one Russian. As the hotel is located on Prat Avenue there is lots to do. I'll just list a few things we found convenient. The MTR is about a 5min walk to the hotel, if you take exit A2. There are about 2 or 3 7/11's along your way. I also noticed 2 ATMs which gave you the choice of withdrawing RMB or HK dollars - great if you're from China or heading into China. We normally enjoy eating at one of the Indian restaurants in the area but I also like the soup from DeliFrance which you can find on the corner of Prat Avenue about 1 min walk from the hotel. Harbour City shopping mall also is a short 10min walk from the hotel. If you get a chance visit Kowloon Park (which is on your way to Harbour City). It's a huge public garden with many surprises. I highly recommend it if you have a free couple hours. Lastly, there is some construction going on outside the front of the hotel at this time. I had no trouble sleeping in past 10am. However, if you are a light sleeper this might bother you. More to add: - The staff are exceptional!! - There are two laptops in the lobby for guests to use with internet. I found they came in handy many times! - Use 'travelasia.com' to book. We stayed Wednesday night for $450HKD and previously a Thursday night for $500HKD.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - unbelievable customer service”
Reviews.Author: needtocthewrld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights to celebrate my wife's birthday. Patricia and her team made the stay incredibly memorable! The quality and customer service and the friendliness that each and every staff member displayed was refreshing and completely unexpected. Add to that a wonderful location; close to public transportation, food, and shopping, a lovely room, with a generous bathroom, and a clean lobby and common area and you really have a hidden gem. I would highly recommend this Hotel; I know I will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: dayaya
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in butterfly hotel for 6 nights the next time we'll visit hong kong we'll definitely stay in this hotel again. from the airport it;s very easy to reach the hotel by MTR train (tsim sha tsui station). be carefull not to take one the buses that will be proposed to you in the airport (because you will end up paying double). location is excelent, great breakfast you can eat at delifrance and even better at the cofee shop next delifrance (on prat ave). the rooms are very modern, clean and confortable. in conclusion: great hotel; we recommend it whole heartedly!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for leisure travelers”
Reviews.Author: davidli
Reviews.Content: Compared to the 1440 $ HKD /night we paid at the Marco Polo Hong Kong Hotel , the Butterfly was an absolute steal. We also took advantage of the pay 2 nights stay for 3 promo ( Asiatravel.com). My wife and I actually preferred the rooms here ( Deluxe), the super comfortable beds and the location over the Marco Polo and would gladly stay here even at full price. I will definitely stay here next time for any leisure trips. The only people I would not recommend Butterfly is for business travelers on big expense accounts as there is no overpriced restaurants and services to pad your expenses at Butterfly! As others have noted the standard rooms are actually located on the quieter side of the building than the deluxe rooms . We also were awakened at times from the street noise but was not a big issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Hong Kong...for the moment!”
Reviews.Author: RPaderna
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Butterfly on Prat for 4D/3N and booked 2 Deluxe rooms. While I did not get to see the slightly lower-priced Superior Rooms, I suspect that the only difference between the two would be the view from one's window....which really does not matter all that much since the hotel has no harbour-view rooms. I think the superior rooms are in fact slightly better even if they face the back of old apartment buildings as they are more quiet than the deluxe rooms which face Prat Avenue. The pubs and restaurants lining Prat Avenue can get really busy until after midnight and we were awakened by a combination of noisy pub crawlers and honking taxi cabs at around 3 a.m. I'm not sure if it would make any difference if one is booked at a higher floor because the noise along Prat Avenue can get really bad at times. I will book a Superior room next time to ensure a more peaceful sleep. Other than this noise issue (which is really not the hotel's fault), there is nothing to criticize about the hotel. At roughly US100 nett a night, this is currently the BEST deal in a city known for stratospheric hotel rates and sometimes spotty service. Butterfly on Prat does not have a grand lobby with huge flower arrangements and gloved, snooty butlers at your beck and call but it offers nice rooms and friendly smiles from its genuinley amiable staff. Last thing...the beds, duvet and pillows were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minty22
Reviews.Content: I am in HongKong for 4n3d. The hotel location is 3 mins walk to TST MTR A2 exit and the airport shuttle bus stops directly opposite the small lane of Butterfly On Prat Hotel. Room is clean, modern. A decent size for a HongKong hotel. The toilet is similar to a 4 or 5* hotel but only thing is coming without a bathtub. Pillows are a bit soft, but adding in a bigger fridge and microwave. Hopefully the rate remains the next time I am there!

Reviews.Title: “Worth to stay”
Reviews.Author: AndyNg
Reviews.Content: Currently,enjoying my stay at Butterfly. A nice, small, and neat hotel in the middle of Kowloon Busiest District. So far no complaint. It's really worth to stay. The room small, but not a bird cage type as other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “New boutique style hotel in Tsim Tsa Tsui area”
Reviews.Author: brummiechinese
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 6 March for 8 nights. The hotel is situated in Prat Avenue opposite the Guandong Hotel. Taxi drivers may not be familiar with this hotel so you may need to use the Guandong as a nearby landmark. The hotel is also served by the K3 Airport Express minibus from Kowloon Station and the A21 bus stop is close by on Chatham Road South. It is a boutique style hotel featuring a 28" LCD television, generously sized double bed, microwave, switchable air conditioning, small fridge, electronic safe, kettle, DVD player. The hotel provides broadband connectivity although this is chargeable - there is no wi-fi provided. However, the hotel provides residents with the free use of two laptops in the lobby area. The bathroom was reasonably sized with a roomy shower cubicle. The only drawback for some maybe the lack of privacy for the bathroom due to use of clear panels thoughout. The bed linen and bathroom towels were changed daily which is pleasing although not environmentally friendly. Although the rooms were cleaned daily, I would suggest that the attention to detail needs to be greater as dust in crevices were missed and stains left by cups were still evident on the main in my room. My room also seemed to occasionally draw in the smell of cigarettes although it's unclear whether this was via the air conditioning or otherwise. Then there was the lack of consideration of other residents on this floor with the noise from children as they returned for the day, the general slamming of doors and the banging of one resident's door by a drunken resident! The first of these occured at times through my stay whilst the other issues occurred during the second half of my stay. Staff were efficient and courteous. The area is extremely close to the Nathan, Carnarvon, Granville Road areas for shopping. Similarly, the impressive Harbour City retail complex on Canton Road is also nearby (10 minutes walk). The area is also well served with eateries of all types, numerous 7-11 shops, and bars. I would recommend taking a short walk to the cosmopolitan Knutsford Steps area (5 minutes walk) in preference to the ones found by the hotel! Tsim Tsa Tsui MTR is also a short walk. I made my room reservation via the asiatravel.com website which charged HKD 700 on the first 3 nights of my stay, then HKD 550 for the remaining nights. This was cheaper than other websites (including their own!) although rates are unlikely to stay at this level as people become more aware of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent minimalist boutique design hotel”
Reviews.Author: TokyoJoe
Reviews.Content: Newly opened boutique hotel offers minimalist design comforts. If taking the airport express train, exit Kowloon Station and take free complimentary bus, K3 to hotel. Upon arrival, my room was upgraded by reception at no extra cost , stayed in room 1705 and 1805, both superior size accomodation, 28" LCD TV, mircowave, fridge, comfy queen size bed, electronic safe, ample bathroom amenities, shaver, toothbrush etc, complimentary bottled water replenished daily. No breakfast is provided but not really a problem as there are many eating places outside, eg Delifrance just a minute walk across the road. There are two laptops offering free interent access in main lobby. There are also a number of trendy bars along the street. Excellent location for shopping, Ocean Terminal is approximately 15 minutes walk. MTR Tsim Tsai Tsui 10 minutes so all in all a hotel in a very convenient location. Han, the chambermaid advised sheets are changed daily at this hotel, whereas the Langham Place in Mongkok is believed to change sheets every other day. The only slight drawback is it can still be a little noisy even on the high floors and there is not much of a view from the hotel windows. Fitness room located on the 5th Floor. Asiatravel.com currently have best rates at 550 HKD per night although its appears the room rates are starting to rise.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience without the price tag”
Reviews.Author: rebaducci
Reviews.Content: Everything about this cozy boutique hotel is something to rave about except for the bathroom, which is quite "interesting". The translucent glass panel of the bathroom may be an attraction for newly-weds or couples in a romantic get-away, but definitely not for firends travelling together who value their privacy in the bathroom. We asked the front desk manager if there were rooms with twin beds, but the hotel only had queen-size beds. You could ask for an extra bed but they charge extra for that. Nevertheless, the location was excellent. If you take a cab, just ask the driver to take you to the Guandong Hotel, which is right across the street from the Butterfly Hotel. The MTR station is a 3 minute walk, Nathan Road is a 5-minute walk, the Star Ferry is another 10 minute walk. This hotel was a streal for HKD550 a night. I'm not sure, though, that this rate will be forever. The room size was just right for us. The bed was comfortable (not at all hard which is typical in other HK hotels). The staff were extremely helpful. Cant say anything about dining in the hotel because we didn't eat in their restaurant. Since there was a microwave inthe room, we just ordered take out from the nearby Chinese/Vietnamese/Thai restaurants and ate in the room. Also, getting to and from the airport was a breeze because of the free K3 shuttle which takes you to the airport express station in Kowloon. Again, convenience without the price tag!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: yukoicy
Reviews.Content: We booked thru Asiatravel.com @ HKD 500 per night for the Superior Queen. We choose this hotel as it was Newly opened in Dec08 & the special rate considering its location in Tsimshatshui. Free Airport Express shuttle bus K3 from Kowloon Station, the bus dropped us at Guangdong Hotel, just directly opposite Butterfly, checked in @ 1230pm . Its was new, so everything was clean & perfect. Great TV channels, comfortable bed (but soft pillows). Please note there is a see-thru glass panel @ the basin, a semi transparent panel/+ bathroom door, there is no absolute privacy when using the bathrm. If returning to hotel late night, don't forget your own microwave & fridge --->there are Circle-K + 7-11s along the road, grab a frozen pack Dim Sum & head back to hotel room for supper.. Overall satisfied & i wanna compliment the service oriented Bell Boy (i think he's from China) whom is extremely friendly & helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Butterfly On Prat
HotelInfo.Address: No.21 Prat Avenue, Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong, China
